Reviews.Title: “Why aren't there hotels like this in other European capitals”
Reviews.Author: thedukesofhazzard17
Reviews.Content: So you read Trip Advisor and worry that some of the reviews are not real – we read all the previous reviews on the Circus with a sense of cynicism but they are true - it really is that good. The Circus is a extremely well located, small, beautiful hotel staffed by some of the most effective staff I have ever come across. Remember this is a small well priced hotel, without the trapping of a five-star bow and scrap place. However the rooms are well designed, well appointed and speaking for the apartment we stayed in (apartment 1) very large. However what set it apart was the warmth and comfort of the staff. They really seemed to enjoy their jobs and offered advice and modern service of the highest standard at all times. So, if you are travelling with children (as we were) or are simply looking for a modern hotel which won’t break you, then this is the place. If only I could find somewhere like this in other European Capitals.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: sinet
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here for a Valentines trip and it did not disappoint.it was our first trip to Berlin so we were so happy to be in such a central location with the U bahn literally a 10 second walk from the door and a strip of fantastic little restaurants just down the road. The resaturant/bar in the hotel itself was great, offering a lot of variety and nhad various live musicians playing in the evening.We really enjoyed it. We took a junior suite which was great value for the price. The only complaint i had was the internet was very slow. I would definetly recommend this hotel for couples, families or friends on a trip to Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and service”
Reviews.Author: spicyhippo
Reviews.Content: I booked the circus hotel based on TA reviews and was not disappointed. Rooms are clean and comfy. All major attractions are pretty much in walking distance but good access to public transport also. Some good restaurants in the immediate vicinity but also ate in the hotel restaurant which was also very nice. Drinks served in the bar were also of good quality. In addition to IPAD in the bar that you can use you also have access to a couple of PCs to surf the net, email, print boarding passes etc. We also did a walking tour with original Berlin walks which was really good, no need to book you can just walk to Weihenstephaner restaurant opposite Hackescher Markt S-Bahn station which is about a 10-15 min walk away, starts at 10.30. Also I would recommend if you are planning on visiting a few museums on museum island to get the museum pass which gets you in most of the museums in Berlin and all of the main ones on museum island. Basically once you visit 2 museums its paid for itself and it lasts 3 days so well worth buying, you can get these at the airport when you come through arrivals just go to one of the tour desks and ask if they sell the Berlin museum pass. There is also a version that gives you access to the metro also but as we prefer to walk and explore the city we didn't get this one. One other point on the circus is there is also a circus hostel just over the road which has a bar in the basement which is cheaper drinks and as you would expect from a hostel a younger and more lively atmosphere. Would definitely choose Circus again if visiting Berlin in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great design, excellent neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: PinkiePorkchop
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Circus in 2010 and again for a week in April of this year. We were happy to find how well maintained it was. Beautiful, fun, funky, charming design with nice touches like fresh flowers in the rooms. Quiet rooms, in fantastic neighborhood full of interesting shops, markets and restaurants. Free WIFI. Organic breakfast. Organic local bath products. We had a couple of glitches with check in dates and our room not being cleaned properly one day (an anomaly), both which were resolved quickly by the friendly staff. Some reviews consider the lack of waste, a lack of luxury, but we did not mind the thinner towels, absence of robes and facial tissues, as we appreciate the conservation. Also, love the restaurant and lounge at The Circus Hostel down the street. Free WIFI there, also. Great coffee at both. We look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: SallyBGermany
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 bedroomed, 2 bathroomed apartment for only €110 per night. Great value, great location, great staff who were both friendly and very informative, parking was easy, frankly it could not have been better. We will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant”
Reviews.Author: judith52
Reviews.Content: A must when staying in Berlin. In the old jewish quarter and then Eastern Germany. We had a small double room which was extremely clean. The hotel is very well appointed right by the Rosenthal Platz. When arriving by train take the Airport Express train to the city (buy ABC ticket )and get off at Alexanderplatz. Then go downstairs to the U-Bahn and take line U8 in the direction of Wittenau for two stop. Recomend the walking tour for which no charge is make but donations appreciated. We managed to walk everywhere we wanted and then got the M1 tram back. The breakfast is very good but a second glass of orange juice would have been nice. It is organic with free range eggs and home made jams. Free hair shampoo and conditioner together with shower gel available from reception. Everyone at the hotel was really pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel to stay in Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: Laura_Argentina_29
Reviews.Content: This is the cuttest hotel to stay in Berlin! Staff is friendly, the hotel is very clean, modern and new, breakfast is delicious, and rates are cheap! You can even find services that you were not expecting to find in a hotel, such as DVD players and movies for free to see in your room, or even ipods for free during your stay. The are is great, I would say one of the best in Berlin, as you can find in the near by many restaurants, pubs and fashion shops. Don't even doubt it! This the best choice to stay in Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service”
Reviews.Author: amitj
Reviews.Content: First of all, we stayed on the first floor facing the busy street and slept perfectly well. Street noise wasn’t at all an issue. As other reviewers wrote, it was spotlessly clean, well designed and ideally located. But for us, it was the service that set it apart. We stayed over the Passover holiday and had been invited to a Passover seder by a local Jewish family. It was also Good Friday and all stores were closed so we couldn’t really buy anything to bring (obviously a cake wasn’t an option...). Michael, from the hotel restaurant, had a beautifully presented, reasonably priced salad made for us so that we wouldn’t go to dinner empty handed. It’s true that all of the staff were friendly and helpful, but Michael was absolutely the best! Definitely made our stay in Berlin more special and memorable.

Reviews.Title: “wunderbar”
Reviews.Author: Erine-Smith
Reviews.Content: what a fantastic place to stay. Attention to detail is excellent but this is not a stuffy euro boutique style hotel. Much more welcoming. My partner and stayed here and at the sister hostel (which also deserves 5 stars) across the road whilst the volcanic eruption caused travel disruption. We were well looked after. Links to all public transport is good. Breakfast is fabulous and wholesome. The beer is excellent - when can i go back???

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly”
Reviews.Author: SwissBrit-1283
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed here over Easter. The location is very central, close to Hackesche Höfe and Oranienburger Strasse with great restaurants and bars nearby. The breakfast was particularly good with lots of fresh fruit and wholemeal bread. The only reason I did not give The Circus the top five dot rating is due to sleep quality. Our room was on the first floor overlooking Rosenthaler Platz. Although the windows are very modern and well sound proofed, the trams going round the corner produce a low grinding noise that propagates through the walls. My son's room was on the top floor overlooking the courtyard at the back. He had none of these problems and slept blissfully. Despite this slightly negative point, we really enjoyed staying at The Circus. The hotel decor is really pleasing and verything feels new and well cared for. The service was very detail oriented and friendly. I will definitely go back next time I'm in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luckyduck25
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. Booked this hotel following trip advisor comments and was glad I did. Staff are very helpful. Rooms are bright and funky, each one individual. Nice bar to have a drink, some good singers on when we where there. Great location, next to an underground station. There was a good jazz bar a short walk away Would go back

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: igs1995
Reviews.Content: As many other reviews have said this hotel benefits from a good location and with great service. The postives: Location at Rosenthaler platz- close enough to the main sights without being on top of them. 15-20 mins leisurely stroll to the Berliner Dom and Museum Island or about 5 mins on the U bahn. Lots of nice bars and restaurants nearby. Great staff- happy to help with directions, ideas for places to visits, restaurants and bars. Really the best thing about the place. Word perfect english and really puts us to shame. Restaurant- really good food for breakfast, option of buffet or other hot food but both really nice. We ate dinner on the first night and again it was pretty tasty and reasonable. General atmosphere- im not sure how to describe it but there really was a nice laid back atmosphere to the whole place. I guess the modern room decor helps promote this but we both really enojoyed the bar/ restaurant area which was a great place for a drink or even just to relax and borrow the ipad to surf the net. Good music being played, plenty to read or even a bit of live music at the weekend. The negatives: No tea/ coffee making facilities- i know they encourage people to drink tea of coffee downstairs in the bar but it did annoy me not being able to have a cup of tea in the morning/ evening in my actual room. Noise- not external noise as that was well insultated but for some reason the acoustics meant the shutting of other room doors in out corridor seemed to reverberate through our room which was quite off putting at night. Shower door- the bathroom themselves were really nice but our shower door kept opening, meaning the floor got a bit wet. Overall this was a great place, more personal than a large hotel chain, but still offering the majority of facilities and location that you want on a city break. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: KC92
Reviews.Content: The Circus Hotel is in a great location - only yards from an underground station and close to plenty of bars and restaurants. When we arrived only one of the rooms we had booked was ready but the staff we very polite and helpful and were happy to look after our luggage. The rooms we had were spacious (we booked jnior suites for only an extra €20 per night - well worth it) and really nicely decorated. The bathroom was spotless and the shower was roomy and powerful. We paid for breakfast, which was only €8 each and you could have as much as you wanted from the buffet. The best thing about this hotel is the staff. They were all warm, friendly and always there to help. If I visit Berlin again I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Number 1 for a reason”
Reviews.Author: annmar1e
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel. Right on a tube stop so easy to get to and from. We were greeted warmly and shown to our room after a little wait even though we had arrived a couple of hours early. We booked an economy double with a queen size bed at €80 a night which was comfortable and looked out onto Rosenthaler Platz.. The ensuite was a great size with a modern power shower. We chose to eat breakfast every morning as it was everything you would want....except the full english!!! I only have a couple of complaints: 1) There is no air conditioning. Which was fine for us at the end of March but I can imagine that in the summer it would be very warm in the room. Due to its location you cannot keep your windows open at night. My second complaint is more like a word of warning. The size of the room is small. This was not a problem for us but those who are are a little heavier, they might find the space around the bed a little tight (although we did have the economy room). This in no way affected our stay. We would recommend this hotel in an instant and would definately stay here again should we want to stay in Berlin again.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves top spot”
Reviews.Author: dsheane
Reviews.Content: Warmly welcomed to the Circus hotel after our journey. Hotel is very easy to find if you follow the information available on the website. Picked a junior suite which was fresh, clean with modern style throughout. Breakfast is an organic buffet. The staff were lovely and made time to talk and help with our itinery and gave suggestions of things to do. The price is very reasonable probably as it is located a little bit outside the main city centre but the tram or metro is v accessible.

Reviews.Title: “There's no clowning around here!....”
Reviews.Author: Tommytyke
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for three nights towards the end of March and have only praise for this hotel. Booked a junior suite which was a great size and decor was fab, also very clean and a great shower. We were in a suite that was on the street side which was great for watching the world hustle and bustle beneath you. The trams were quite noisy as they passed but weren't as frequent late and night and didn't really disturb us. €100 per night is cheap for the quality and size of the room, we also had the breakfast which was well worth the €8 as it set us up for the day. The organic buffet style feast that was on offer was perfect for us and we enjoyed it thoroughly every morning. A selction of cereals, as well as meats and cheeses with fresh bread and fruit and everything in between. Be warned however that if you are after a full cooked breakfast a la England then you won't find it here! The hotel location is perfect also, literally 5 metres from the u-bahn exit of Rosenthaler Strasse and simply found if using the Airport Express train from Schoenefeld......45 mins from airport exit to hotel door! REMEMBER to validate your ticket at your station of departure!! There are little red boxes on most platforms that you must insert ticket to be stamped as there are transport police that check tickets!! We hired monthly passes from the hotel for €4.50 per day per tickets which gave us unlimited travel and were well worth it. One last tip is to do a bike tour! We did the 'Fat Tire' bike tour and it was a brilliant way of getting around all the sights and learning a lot about this wonderful city! Would definately reccommend! Overall a great city to visit and a pleasurable stay at this top hotel! We will be back!!.......

Reviews.Title: “Good but would not rate it #1”
Reviews.Author: MJontheroad2011
Reviews.Content: We booked a suite after reading reviews here that the double rooms are a bit on the small side. We found the suite very spacious and it was perfect for us. Decor of the room is very colorful and fun. I would say this hotel has done a great job in staff management - The maid did great, room was spotless. Being a clean freak 'spotless' is a term that I do not use lightly. The reception staff speak very good English and are friendly. Our suite located on the first floor smelled of drainage however. We had to keep the bathroom door shut to contain the smell. In terms of location, I read all the reviews here that the hotel is very conveniently located. We beg to differ as we do not find the surrounding area of the hotel as charming as described. U-bahn Rosenthaler Platz is located on a line that requires numerous train changes to quite a few main sights and we do not find that as convenient as say, U-bahn station Stadtmitte. But I guess whether this hotel beats others location-wise is more a matter of taste.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Value!”
Reviews.Author: JandPsAdventures
Reviews.Content: We found The Circus Hotel when traveling to Berlin for the weekend. The staff is wonderful. Our situationwas unique, I flew in a day earlier than my husband drove in. The staff arranged for parking in a secure nearby parking structure for a very reasonable 15euro/day. Hotel location is perfect.....convenient to everything. Also a "green" hotel, organic products for the room (you must take them from the lobby...Shower Gel, Body Lotion and Shampoo (no hair conditioner)). Room access is secured by key activated elevator, no room key~no access. Restaurant is great featuring organic foods. We had a small issue with a long wait one evening (post lunchtime-pre dinner could be the reason) but we didn't tell the server we had a time crunch. Had the buffet breakfast every morning, it is european style and a good start to your day and only 8 euro! Had drinks each evening as well, and the service was great. The only other issue was with housekeeping. Towels were removed and not replaced, we didn't notice until the morning when both of us had to use the same towel. Towels are also on the small side (we are not "big" people), but enjoy a larger bath towel! Also, ran out of green tea bags, housekeeping did not replenish. I did notice this and asked the front desk, I was given an entire box for our room...fantastic! The rooms do not have mini bars, coffee, robes, paper/pen etc. BUT Apple products (laptop, ipod, maybe a tablet?) are available in the lobby for guest use. We stayed in a Junior suite, overlooking the patio. The Circus offers rooms that are basic, clean, lovely and a great value in a superb location. Our friends stayed in an "apartment"...Large room with a full kitchen & several small balconies (perfect if someone is a smoker). Upcharge is minimal for this fantastic room....

Reviews.Title: “Your starting point for the very best of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Zarquito
Reviews.Content: The numerous positive reviews of The Circus Hotel proved to be true. We could not possibly have enjoyed our stay here more. Our room was clean, stylish, spacious, well-appointed, quiet, and affordable. Staff was welcoming, friendly, reliable, knowledgeable, and available 24/7. The first floor bar/restaurant is so hip that it draws numerous non-guests because of its tasty menu, creative cocktails, live music, and serene ambiance. The location cannot be beat: in the heart of the city (Mitte), steps away from numerous public transport options, upscale shops, and amazing restaurants. Not a single detail has escaped the attention of the owners, staff, and management. If only all hotel says were this marvelous...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: HollCrew
Reviews.Content: This is a smart, clean, modern hotel in a good location - U Bhan station literally right outside the door. Hotel felt very quiet - we barely saw any other guests while we were there. Decor is very modern - pink walls, wooden floors. Room was big and overlooked the street, but quite well insulated so noise of the traffic wasn't too bad - could only really hear the trams. The walk in power shower was amazing. We didnt have the breakfast buffet as we liked the cafe opposite which was very cheap (diagonally opposite - called Back Factory and has serve yourself pastries and hot drinks). Hotel also has its own restaurant. We ate there one night and it was great - good food, not too expensive

Reviews.Title: “Just the ultimate place to stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: SapfoChatz
Reviews.Content: Helpful and friendly staff, modern and comfortable rooms. Attention to detail...and a perfect breakfast buffe (till 13.00 !!!) I'm definately coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Very surprised!!! Excellent hotel for such a great price.”
Reviews.Author: RenJamBrisbane
Reviews.Content: We honestly booked the circus hotel because we were looking for somewhere cheap as we were only staying in Berlin for 2 nights and this place came up as one of the cheapest places in the city. The hotel was only a few dollars extra then the hostel so we went with the hotel. The room was so modern! Small and compact but everything was basically brand new. We ate breakfast here in the mornings in the restaurant of the hotel, which are offered at a reasonable price (and I think a lunch or dinner - can't remember, I just remember it was this delicious crusted schnitzel thing). The reason this hotel was so cheap is really because they don't waste money on the unneccessary things. Things like replacing your shampoo/soaps etc daily even though there is plenty left to use, they provide a little area at the front desk with all the shampoo & soap that you can take for free as you need it, rather then have the room cleaners throw them out (hence wasting them) and replace them. The breakfasts were beautiful and fresh, but they wouldn't put out a massive amount of food, just small amounts and replace it as it has been taken (again food not needing to be wasted). Really the concept is quite simple - save money by not wasting anything & you can provide a good hotel at a very good price for guests. The staff at the front desk can help you with any tours you want to do, we had them book us a tour at the last minute (we arrived late in the afternoon & they booked us in for the next day) and it was the best thing we did in Berlin! I highly recommend if you only have one full day (like we did) to do a segway tour - while you will most likely annoy the hell out of local drivers/taxis etc, you will see so much in a short time & not have to walk for hours to see it (I think the total tour was 4 hours???). But anyway, excellent hotel, amazing price. We have recommended this place to other people we know who weren't sure where to stay on their trip and they agreed that this place is awesome, Definitely a must-stay if you don't want to spend a fortune & like nice hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great Value. Great Price.”
Reviews.Author: thomas_destinations
Reviews.Content: A quick two night stay, that was booked at a great price. Rooms a little on the small size (like many hotel rooms in berlin). Great funky hotel with great dining and drinking options (also worth noting a great cafe on the corner across the road) worth the visit ... spread the word!

Reviews.Title: “above average, but not as good as very good.”
Reviews.Author: pr0fumo
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the circus hotel earlier this month. we chose this hotel because of the excellent reviews on tripadvisor. we've stayed at many hotels across europe and i have to say this is on a par with most other places we've stayed. its good, but i struggle to accept this is the best hotel berlin has to offer. we booked a junior suite at €100 per night. i think this was wise, because i seen the inside of a few double rooms as they were being serviced during the day and they were very small. decor is nice, modern, and clean (although i dropped a very small amount of makeup on the floor on monday morning and it was still there on thursday afternoon when we checked out!). the rooms are very much like something you'd find in an ikea catalogue. one major gripe for me was that in booking a junior suite for a romantic break, the room had 2 single beds pushed together and 2 seperate single covers. couldn't quite understand the point in that. i should also mention, the only other real gripes we had were that the towels were really small, and most certainly past their best. these should be renewed with something altogether more decent looking, fluffier, and most certainly bigger. the other thing we noticed that, while we were told the rooms have no minibar facilities, it would have been nice to have a few glasses which we could drink from. there are no shampoo's etc supplied in the room, however, at reception, there are plenty to chose from, free of charge. so, in all, excellent location, staff were young and friendly. the bar area was nice, though mostly quiet. we came back one evening around 11pm and were able to order just one drink each before the bar closed. there are ipads and ipods dotted around the bar area, and reception has laptops which can be rented free of charge. theres also free wifi in the hotel, though they appeared to be having some problems with it during our stay. if you stay here, you should take the breakfast buffet in the mornings. its €8 per person, and truly is exceptional value. the food is largely organic, i'm told. there is fresh bread and rolls of different varieties, as well as meats, cheeses, eggs, cereals, muesli's, nuts and yoghurts. very well laid out, and as i say, well worth the money. we ate breakfast every morning of our stay and didn't eat again until around 8 in the evenings. i'd recommend this place to friends, however, as i say, i'd be surprised if this truly is the best berlin has to offer. rooms were nice, though exceptionally warm. the radiators are individually controlled and we turned them all off every day and they automatically came back on during the night, it seemed (and stayed on until they reached 30 degrees!!!, which meant a broken sleep every night, trying to turn them off again!). the pillows arent great quality, and the fact that we had 2 single bed covers also added to the broken sleep fiasco every night. however, all that said, we enjoyed our stay. i may have nitpicked slightly in this review, however, i feel that its a fair review. be aware, its not as wow as others have said. whilst very nice, and an all in all enjoyable experience, there are better out there!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: GreeceGoodfellas
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel, without second thoughts i would stay there again. Location: 10 metres away from subway station "Rosenthaler Platz", which is 2 stations away from "Alexanderplatz", so the location is very good. Service: The staff is really friendly (in a different way than in a 5-star hotel, they talked to me as if we were buddies) and easy-going. They try to find solutions to problems and are very helpful. Breakfast: To be honest, i had greater expectations, but as it is not included in the prices, feel free to discover also other places. Room: Sufficient size if you use the room only for sleep. Nice colours and design. Bathroom is also quite good and clean. Didn't like the fact that you have to get your shampoo at the reception yourself (it is for free, but i do not quite get the point/benefit nor for the customer or the environment (it is supposed to be environmentally more friendly this way)). We did not have dinner in the hotel, but i liked the fact that also quite late there seemed to be people eating there or having a drink at the bar. Wrap-up: For the money requested, you get a great location, very friendly service, clean rooms and a nice restaurant, i think it is a very good and fair deal!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, just wow!”
Reviews.Author: Giesemann
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Circus because someone in our company read about the good reviews, i googled the hotel and liked the idea of having such a great location, but believe me, everything what you read or find in the internet about this hotel is not enough to describe the awesome experience we had, it is by far one of the best hotels i have stayed in the whole world!! Just one thing, if you are traveling for business, be patient, their internet is not good at all, but everything else is 300% recommendable

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in a great city!”
Reviews.Author: timmac_10
Reviews.Content: We came in from Schonefeld airport on the airport express , which takes around 30 mins to get to Alexanderplatz..Then the U8 heading to Wittenau, 2 stops then hop off at Rosenthaler Platz. We bought a 72 hour welcome card, which you can use on all S-Bahn, U-Bahn and trams, also gives you a discount into some of the fascinating exhibitions and galleries (though many are free). Anyway, onto the hotel..Upon arrival into this funky little hotel, we were greeted by a really friendly guy on reception, who couldn't have been more helpful ..the theme continued with the team all weekend. Nothing was too much trouble at all. The rooms are quirky and basic but have all the essentials, towels, hairdryer - as many have said before, if you would like shampoo, shower gel or body lotion, just help yourself from the reception desk. We ate breakfast in the lovely restuarant area - for 8 euro's, you can help yourself to a buffet breakfast of cereals, bread, meats, cheeses and eggs with unlimited coffee/tea, just delicious and sets you up nicely for a day of sightseeing.. On our last day, we wanted to take in as much of the city as time permitted, without carrying bags around, again the team were so helpful and securely locked our bags away.. This was our first visit to Berlin, and we just loved every bit of it, that includes this hotel..Circus Hotel, you thoroughly deserve your Trip Advisor award.. Thank you for making us feel so welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Great People. Great Room.”
Reviews.Author: bekoubetts
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel made so by a combination of three definitive factors. The staff are very young and interested in making your stay a good one. They do this by being helpful, polite and effective. I was most impressed and this attitude has permeated all the way through the chain of command. The rooms – they are very clean, modern and enhanced by the exceptional bathrooms. The showers in particular are fantastic. Lastly, the location of the hotel also makes for a good stay. It’s in Mitte, which found to be bang central for us (5 thirty something blokes) for culture and bars as well as transportation. I really can’t highlight how much we all enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: dpl18
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend in the Circus hotel and throughly enjoyed our stay there. Our hotel room was facing the street but the windows were of great quality and we didn't hear any street noise but got to enjoy watching the world go by. The room itself was nicely decorated and the shower in the bathroom was powerful and spacious. The toiletries which are not in the bathrrom but available to take from Reception were gorgeous. The breakfast buffet at €8 was delicious and the restaurant is a lovely setting for relaxing and chilling out. The location of the hotel was perfect with the U Bahn right outside the door and plenty of bars and restaurants on our door step. Couldn't fault this hotel, they have really paid attention to every detail.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: emilysmith_12
Reviews.Content: Easy to book, good price. Very impressed, turned up and was given an upgrade to an apartment! Staff were friendly and helpful, giving advise on things to do in hotel or city. There were secure lockers too where we could leave our bags after check out. Very good location (on U bahn line). All round great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “February visit was very nice (but freezing in Brrrrlin)”
Reviews.Author: Daryl G
Reviews.Content: Very nice room for our 2 nights in Berlin. Reasonable, great food downstairs. Everyone was very helpful. It is in a great location in terms of the museums, trams and Ubahn, etc. Even the kabob next door was tasty enough to have twice :)

Reviews.Title: “Great unique hotel in Berlin - would definitely visit again”
Reviews.Author: little_L86
Reviews.Content: Circus Hotel was a great hotel all round. It is relatively new, so unsurprising that there are a few teething issues but nothing major at all. One thing to bear in mind is that it is not no.1 on TA for being a great 5* luxury hotel. It is rated #1 because the service is exceptional, much better than many 5* establishments, and the hotel is quirky and accessible. If you are looking for luxury in particular, go elsewhere. Pros: Location: Rosenthaler Plaza, about 15 minute walk to Hakeschter Markt and c.25-30 minute walk to Unter der Linden and all the associated sites. If you are feeling lazy, the U-bahn (line U8) is literally right outside the front door. Service: In many ways, unbeatable. We arrived early and the lovely receptionist switched us to another same standard of room so that we could check in early. The staff were extremely helpful and offered plenty of advice on places to go. Rooms were tidied everyday, and the hotel offered all sorts of extras to make your life easier, such as travel passes and a little piece of paper with directions to the airport, etc. Rooms: We stayed in a Standard Room, which is one up from the Economy. The room was spacious, there was adequate storage space, bathroom was modern and the shower was great! Food: Breakfast is not included in the room price. There is a choice of a la carte and the buffet. Both are great. 8e is probably slightly on the expensive side for the buffet breakfast (good spread of muesli, cheeses, meats, bread, condiments, fruit), but is probably worth paying for the handiness of it being in the hotel, and it did taste good. There are less expensive a la carte and hot food options. Value: Good - 90e a night for the standard room. Areas for improvement: - The bathroom doors are sliding. This is not a problem, except that sometimes, when you are on the outside of the bathroom and someone has just left it, you might like to keep it closed (yes... exactly!). a rubber doorstop would solve this problem. - I had dinner in the restaurant one night and the service was not great. I always believe that even if you are extremely busy, you should not leave the customer feeling that you are rushed. The candle was also not lit and was not addressed (I did try to ask for it to be lit but the waitress very quickly ran away after an order or request - see first point). - Lighting in the rooms are a bit dim and leave the room sometimes appearing kind of cold. Warmer lighting would be more welcoming. - Towels could be fluffier. - Worth flagging to customers when they check in that they have to turn the heating on (heating is great btw, and fully customisable. It just got to the point when I felt really cold when I realised that I needed to turn it on myself...) Overall, a great stay and I would definitely go back on my next trip to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grant M
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, friendly service, central location, and affordable.

Reviews.Title: “The type of hotel I would love to find anywhere I travel to.”
Reviews.Author: Noor79
Reviews.Content: The Circus Hotel offers a great stay in a great city. It is nicely situated and the service is outstanding. The bar/restaurant linked to the hotel serves good meals/drinks and a lovely breakfast. The fact that sustainability is regarded as very important makes booking a room feel even better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: LizzieLou1964
Reviews.Content: Good central location, close to bars and restaurants. The hotel bar and restaurant is a nice place to relax and the food is good, but neither food or drink is particularly cheap. Great hot chocolate and cakes though! They loaned us a kettle for our room so we could make our early morning tea (typical Brits!). Very helpful staff. Enjoyed the live music on the Friday. We had interior rooms and so no problem with street noise. My sons room was next to the lift however and he was a bit disturbed by the lift noise. Would recommend it as a good base for exploring Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Most Pleasant Experience Ever!”
Reviews.Author: relx
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Berlin where we spent 5 days... We booked The Circus Hotel upon the reviews of other TripAdvisor friends and contributors. And thank you all!!! The hotel felt cosy and comfortable just like home. The staff is easy-going and relaxed, yet always at your service. The highlight of our visit was that we got tickets for the Berlinale - International Film Festival, as the present from the hotel management, just because we expressed regret for not booking them online beforehand! Thank you, Circus Hotel, we'll definitely come zurueck!

Reviews.Title: “Good location with very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Garrywb
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading reviews on Tripadvisor and we were not disappointed. The hotel was good,right next to a U station and close to all the main attractions. The rooms were basic but spacious and very clean. The staff here were excellent and on hand to advise on places to visit and recommendations. We ate at Fabisch for breakfast which provided an excellent healthy choice for 8 euros and we also ate there one evening after a long day sightseeing. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and it's staff if you are looking for a well located place with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: demented
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend in February 2012 with a group of 6 adults. (3 couples ) We were quite happy with the hotel , despite a few smaller issues. I had booked the rooms and had specified three Double rooms ans the Double economy are quite small with the beds against the wall. I also verified on check-in that we were all getting those rooms. However one of the rooms provided was a Double eonomy - my friend went to reception to ask about this and was quickly given another room - but really why should you have to do this? The bart didn't stay open very late & we would have liked a night cap on returning ion the cold to the hotel at night before retiring. ~ I also feel that the breakfast buffet at €8 was quite nice. But was disappopinted that the hot breakfast was not included with this - and one of us bought the seperate scramble eggs for €4 - we ate elsewhere the other mornings. Despite the cold weather the heating was great and we were lovley & warm. In general I liked the decor of the hotel (except the crazy picture in our room - but that lent itself for much discussion and laughter.) The location is great - Ubann right outside the door & a quick walk to many things,. Plenty of bars & restaurants in the area too. Would stay there again.,

Reviews.Title: “Six stars service”
Reviews.Author: LadyAstur
Reviews.Content: Excellent philosophy Extraordinary customer service Delicious breakfast ... So worth paying for! I will be back ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Super location”
Reviews.Author: PenEllis
Reviews.Content: Just spent a freezing but fun filled weekend in Berlin, staying at the Circus Hitel. Thanks to Tripadvisor we choose the Circus based on positive reviews re location, thankfully they weren't lying. A transport strike meant we had to explore the city by foot. The Circus Hotel is superbly located within walking distance of most if Berlin's major sights. The Hotel is very cosy, cafe attached is fantastic-buffet breakfast is well worth paying €8 for. Interior room would be worth requesting, street can be a little noisy.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: jennifercap
Reviews.Content: We booked the Circus Hotel based on this website and we were not disappointed, the bedroom was a good size and the bathroom was out fo this world with a massiv double shower cubicle. The rooms were all tastefully decorated and we benefited from the free transport passes as well. There was a small jazz bar round the corner, beside the arch way that was open until 4am, playing great musin and had reasonably priced drinks as well. It was close enough to walk to the train stations as well to get you to all the historic places to visit in this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Best ran hostel I've been!”
Reviews.Author: scottydz
Reviews.Content: Big, clean, secure, fun, friendly and good location.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: suzzie71
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the Circus Hotel last week. While there is nothing fancy about the hotel, it is clean with a friendly and helpful staff. The location was perfect. Great neighborhood with tons of restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value with the right Eco Attitude”
Reviews.Author: obclan2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 night last weekend in a group of 6 adults. Was very impressed with the attitude of hotel staff, cleanliness of accommodation and choice of health organic food. I particularly liked their approach to eco sustainability. The property is well serviced by U Bann and Metro track outside the door. Food and booze prices were reasonable. Great restaurants and bars nearby and only a short walk to city centre. Get the buffet breakfast at least once, cost is €8 for residents and full of wholesome goodness to suit all tastes.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: petite_pommie
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights just after new years (our original booking was 3 nights, but we were enjoying the city and liked the hotel so extended our stay) The hotel's location was great for us - right on top of the subway station, walking distance to the city centre (about 20 mins) and also to some cool more local neighbourhoods. The care that the owners have taken, in decorating the hotel and the services provided, is clear. There are many nice touches throughout, and our room was comfortable. We chose the slightly larger room - looking at some of the others there's probably not much in it, so if you're cost conscious at all then a standard room would be a good option. The staff were all very helpful at all times, and genuinely friendly. We don't normally eat in the hotel, preferring to explore a new place, but were so tired when we arrived that we headed downstairs for a late bite before bed. the food was among the best we had in Berlin. The oat rolled schnitzels with baked apple especially were a nice modern twist on a german classic. Only negative - and really this is the only thing - is that the hotel makes it a bit challenging to have coffee in your room. They don't provide instant coffee due to concerns about quality, and have plunger coffee available for free at reception - which is great. But it's a bit of a palavar to organise every day. Overall a great hotel and top recommendation for any stay in Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could live here”
Reviews.Author: dizzymisslizzy
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. It seems to be geared (stylistically) towards a younger generation, but I am young enough at heart to enjoy that. Plus, I was traveling with my 22 year old daughter, so we were both very happy. We had a room on a lower floor (possibly the first, which is really the second), with a window out to - not really a courtyard, just a patch of ground surrounded by hotel walls. This eliminated any problem with street noise, which would not have bothered us anyway since we live that way at home. The room was very comfortable for the two of us - we had twin beds as requested. The shower was nice and the bathroom roomy. I think the best part of this hotel was having the very nice restaurant downstairs (in the lobby). The food was very good (breakfast cost 8 euro but was quite substantial) and the bar was open late, giving you someplace to meet up with friends or just have a place to sit rather than your room. And, it was not a rowdy bar - just a nice relaxing place. The music was, once again, geared for young people but it was not loud. It was very soothing "young" music! I loved it!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic & ethical choice”
Reviews.Author: Lazio18
Reviews.Content: I have been to Berlin 5 times in the past 3 years and regret not having discovered Circus earlier. Well-connected by public transit to Schoenefeld airport and rest of the city - tram and underground stops are right outside. I arrived late and ate at the hotel restaurant, which I don't usually do, but in this case was rewarded with a delicious and sustainably-sourced meal of fish and seasonal vegetables. I didn't manage to eat a full plate at breakfast so had the price reduced upon a suggestion of my waiter (who noticed that I took a small portion) - this is an honest and ethical choice on all levels: read the hotel brochure and you'll be impressed at their commitment to people and the planet. I had forgotten a paper to bring to my conference and collected a notepad of recycled paper at the front desk - just one example of their attention to detail and 'being green' on every level. In a nutshell: don't look anywhere else, pay extra to stay in a double even if you are travelling solo - this is the only place to stay in Berlin, as far as I'm concerned.

Reviews.Title: “Hate to be the bearer of bad news....”
Reviews.Author: mgrt09
Reviews.Content: But in this case I am not, I am with all the other 5 star reviewers, this place is simply fantastic. Great Location Great Rooms and to me the best and most important part, Great staff!!!! This place was a fantastic location for a great weekend in a great city. Everyone else is right in what they say about this place. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a flawless hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeseraiparisienne
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at the Circus hotel for 3 nights and it was perfect. Great, beautifully decorated rooms with very comfy beds (that are needed after long days of sightseeing), fantastic bathrooms with the best shower ever, TV and a collection of DVDs to borrow, a great restaurant and bar that put on events such as gin dnd jazz nights, a lovely organic locally sourced breakfast. The whole ethos of being an environmentally friendly hotel is brilliant too! Couldn't be closer to the U-bahn and tram but definitely within walking distance of the sites and lots of bars, restaurants and shops. Lovely staff who all seem to speak perfect English. Walking tours and a trip to Sachsenhausen leaving from the hotel. All in all, a fantastic place to stay, and I will be (and have been) recommending it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Role model for all hotels”
Reviews.Author: ozplod66
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights based on the strength of Tripadvisor reviews plus the hotels own website which is excellent. The hotel models itself as thoughtful, green, quirky, relaxed, and thoroughly efficient. It was successful on all fronts. I had a junior suite which was massive. Bright clean decor with timber floors and a slight arty feel. The room faced Rosenthaler Platz which is not a quiet place with trams and many people out and about at all hours. I liked the hustle and bustle but some may prefer a room facing the courtyard instead. The staff are all friendly and chatty. Best thing in the hotel is Fabisch Restaurant and the relaxed vibe there. Live music, good food and comfy sofas with a mini library all add up to the perfect spot to chill out and watch the trams trundle past. Flawless, small characterful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Berlin Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Marion-Jane79
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel with brilliant staff who are never too busy to stop and chat and advise you. The bar manager (originally Australian, I didn't catch his name) helped us plan our weekend, recommending sites, guided walks, bars and a jaw-dropping acrobatic cabaret at the Chameleon Theatre - all of which was invaluable. The hotel's restaurant and bar was so great we ate there twice and enjoyed settling into the leather chairs whilst borrowing the complimentary ipad and drinking the Baileys hot chocolate - bliss! The location was perfect for all the sights as well as being a stroll away from a multitude of great bars and shops. Our room was spotless with a great shower and despite overlooking a busy junction it was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - Wonderful stay...”
Reviews.Author: kerso2201
Reviews.Content: We booked the Circus Hotel based on this website and we were not disappointed, the bedroom was a good size and the bathroom was out fo this world with a massiv double shower cubicle. The rooms were all tastefully decorated and we benefited from the free transport passes as well. There was a small jazz bar round the corner, beside the arch way that was open until 4am, playing great musin and had reasonably priced drinks as well. It was close enough to walk to the train stations as well to get you to all the historic places to visit in this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Charming !”
Reviews.Author: mctheworldcitizen
Reviews.Content: this is my type of Hotel... like a visit to very close friends house... from waiters to bartenders, reception to housekeepers they are all my friends from now... even i don't know them i feel like that. because everyone is working happily there and you can feel it. Also i like the food, coffees clean and cute rooms. I did not made a reservation so i have to check out for 3 different rooms. But i am lucky because all the rooms are separately decorated. And i love all of them. Each radiator has own control unit so you can arrange the your rooms degree as your wish. On my visit it was winter and Berlin was quite cold. Feel sick a little bit. At the bar they made me a tea with ginger and honey and don't charge for it. i insist on paying but its really cute to hear that they are not selling this tea, just to see me healthy tomorrow morning. i will be back for sure for PJ concert on July.

Reviews.Title: “First Time to Berlin”
Reviews.Author: ColinS1951
Reviews.Content: Berlin is a fantastic city to visit as it has a good feel about it and compares well with Paris. The Circus Hotel is situated in Rosenthalerplatz which is quite close to all major attractions. It is a funky hotel whose staff go out of their way to answer all/any queries you may have. The rooms are rather compact but comfortable bright and airy and the in-house restaurant serves delighful local and international fare. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to those looking for a reasonably priced hotel close to transport and attractions. Will visit again . Colin and Helen-Adelaide Australia

Reviews.Title: “closer than we thought!”
Reviews.Author: camobio
Reviews.Content: Initially, we thought that we would be a bit out of the way staying at the Circus, but we were super close to everything we wanted to do and check out. The hotel was clean and tastefully decorated, with all of the essentials available in the hotel. The rooms were on the smaller side, but that was not so relevant for us as we spent most of our time out and about. A bonus was that you can get a daily pass for public transportation in the city for about 4-5 euro, which was very helpful in getting around the city. There are several stops (both the underground metro and the tram) right outside of the hotel. The staff are knowledgeable to ask them for suggestions! We read a few staff restaurant suggestions from the magazine provided in the room, and were not disappointed with any food options they recommended. We loved Berlin and we loved Circus!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: RamblinRoesofMedia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Circus in mid-December 2011 and enjoyed every moment. The staff is incredibly helpful and friendly making our stay even more enjoyable. Amenities are just right with wonderful attention to detail but not over-the-top. Breakfast was a great value and dinner in the restaurant was lovely. Would very happily stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Apartments”
Reviews.Author: whitechristmas07
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the apartments and it was fantastic, so roomy, modern and comfortable. There was a kitchen with dining area, lounge area, 2 bathrooms and two bedrooms. The staff could not have been more helpful and would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone. We loved having the extra room of being in an apartment. They stored our luggage for free in a locker for a whole day for us, gave us tips on sightseeing, let us borrow the free umbrellas - all in all a great place to stay. We did not have the breakfast as there were two bakery across the road and they were very reasonably priced. This hotel was one of the best we stayed in over our trip to Europe. The metro stop is right outside and the "free" walking tour which picks you up from the hotel is awesome - Matt our guide spent 4 to 5 hours with all of us explaining the sights of Berlin - definitely would tell everyone to go on this tour.

Reviews.Title: “It ticked all my boxes!”
Reviews.Author: BlowfieldAlana
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the Circus Hotel if you are visiting Berlin. It seems the owners have really thought of everything here. The rooms are modern & simple with everything you need. Everything in the room is beautifully cleaned & presented & the pillows are so comfortable. We had read in other reviews that people had found the rooms to be noisy at times but this is definitely not the case. Our room faced the road but we slept really well & were not at all bothered by traffic noise. The staff are very helpful & approachable & the breakfast is tasty & sufficient. There is not a huge selection for breakfast but the food on offer is tasty & good quality produce. I like the idea of not much food going to waste. The restaurant is a lovely place to sit & relax & enjoy a drink after a day on your feet. We loved The Circus Hotel & would highly recommend you stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: solotraveler21
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small but they are clean and comfortable. Great for the traveler who will only come to the room for shower and sleep. The staff is excellent and very helpful. They even have bikes to borrow which I encourage!

Reviews.Title: “The Circus Hotel is a friendly great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TKNgaio
Reviews.Content: The Circus Hotel was the highlight of our stay in Berlin in July. The weather wasn't great and so its good location to transport and warm friendly atmosphere was just the antidote to grey skies, rain and wind. The room was modern clean and comfortable. The food was great. Best of all is the layout of the dining area, from soft lounge areas complete with a wide range of books (including about the history of the area and building) and music listening posts, to a more formal dining area. It creates the atmosphere of a lounge in your home - very clever design. The staff are very friendly and helpful and speak many languages. The Circus is in an interesting area of what was East Berlin. The building was once a Jewish clothing shop and then a communist style clothing shop. The owners have taken the care to respect this history and provide good information for those interested in social history via a mural and info folder. Really worth a visit for a meal or to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location and service can't be beat!!!”
Reviews.Author: Keep-travelling
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Circus Hotel for 8 nights over New Year's and can't wait to go back! The location was fantastic, right outside a metro station, and within walking distance of all kinds of great restaurants, shops and main sites. Be sure to use the hotel's metro pass for just 4.5 Euro/day. It's very convenient to have and cheaper than buying a pass from the metro stations. In the 8 days we were there, we were never asked to show our passes on the transit system, but for 4.5 Euro/day, it was worth the peace of mind to have it with us. The service at the hotel was absolutely outstanding! Local Berliners work there, so they know all the regular and off-the-beaten-path places to go and how to get there. It is obvious that they all love their jobs and go above and beyond to help you with anything you may need. They also have great suggestions on restaurants in the area - our two favorites being Transit, just down the street and Schwarzwaldstuben, which is about a 10-minute walk, but definitely worth it! It has typical south German food and the atmosphere is amazing! Be sure to have the hotel make reservations for you at either place because they are both very busy and lively! Rooms at The Circus are on the small side, but spotless and modern. Shampoo, body wash and lotion are all available at the front desk any time you need it. Breakfast is very convenient and available in the hotel's restaurant. You can choose a-la-carte or have the full buffet. The food is very good - our favorite was the muesli - it filled us up for a good part of the day. The hotel's restaurant/bar/cafe is also a great place to relax at the end of the day with a drink or two. If you don't want to have breakfast in the hotel, we found a great neighbourhood place nearby called Strandbad Mitte (about a 10-minute walk from the hotel). The hotel is owned by avid travellers, so they can anticipate all your needs and really cater to their guests on every level. We were beyond impressed and would stay there again without any hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Ok but the rooms could be lot better”
Reviews.Author: nell65
Reviews.Content: Liked the staff, the bar and the breakfast but sorry the rooms are a real let down, very very bare. I have stayed at modern style hotels that manage a bit more style in the rooms. This just felt like on step up from a Travellodge room. Was only here for two niights, would have struggled for longer. Much more suited to youngsters, although they might not like double rooms which are two single beds pushed together. noise from street is a problem and I never got to grips with the heating so was cold.

Reviews.Title: “Simply perfect”
Reviews.Author: Palmatraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights, the staff is very friendly and efficient, the building itself is very nice decorated, with modern and comfortable facilities, nice and clean Junior Suite with good and powerful shower. We booked it with breakfast, which is excellent. We want to come back ;-) Same style and similar philosophy as Casa Camper (we stayed there previously a few times in BCN) but more convenient rates.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place”
Reviews.Author: kesbus
Reviews.Content: Everything said in previous reviews holds true - great hotel, great restaurant, friendly helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service and really friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Dahaab
Reviews.Content: We had one of the apartments in the hotel and were really pleased with the interior. The bedroom was big enough for my 2 children (2, 4) and a king size bed for ourselves. We were up on the 4th floor with elevator. The kitchen and bathroom were of high quality. The breakfast was not included but was very good value. The hotel is in a very good location and all sights are within easy reach on foot, or tram or underground. All the staff were very friendly and went out of their way to help us with any questions we had. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, fantastic service and convenient (take ear plugs!).”
Reviews.Author: Richiric
Reviews.Content: Was worth going to Berlin for this place. It has a real interesting history sitting in the east of Berlin, right next to the underground and with plenty of trams going by. We were in a very nice room overlooking the crossing, which meant you can hear the trams that run all night. The room was nicely decorated, and each room seems to have a different style. It wasn't any bother for us as we live in a town, but for others you may want to take ear plugs if your a sensitive/light sleeper. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful, always willing to answer questions and advise. There was a Jazz and Gin night in the restaurant bar, where breakfast is served in the morning and you can get a meal and drink in the evening. Breakfast is good and a reasonable prise. The bar is a bit more dear than other bars in the area but it is nice enough that this doesn't bother. Can recomend.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay where the staff went above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: scottie0077
Reviews.Content: We firstly tried to book into the new Circus Apartments which unfortunately were not ready in time for our stay. However at short notice they found us room in the hotel and reassured us that everything would be on track for our stay in Berlin. The rooms were a good size, very clean and offered all that we wanted. The breakfast was nice but it would have been good to have some warm options on some mornings - I am told a traditional German brekkie would be good. All the staff were friendly and helpful and all the restaurant tips they gave us were spot on - great food at good prices. I'd definitely recommend a stay at this hotel and I'd go again.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't have changed a thing!”
Reviews.Author: KirstydK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love small boutique hotels which provide clean bedrooms, quality linen and good service without all the unnecessary frills. The Circus Hotel was exactly this! Beautifully decorated, spotlessly clean and with a divine, vibey restaurant attached it was perfect for our stay. It is brilliantly situated right next to an underground station one stop away from the Alexanderplatz. It is a real gem and such good value.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Ntabrum
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed there over new years eve & it is as good as everyone says. The staff are fantastic & the restaurant equally as good. We spent many an hour having a coffee or wine after a long day exploring Berlin, at the restaurant enjoying the live music & relaxed atmosphere. It's location is perfect as well as having loads of public transport right outside. Totally recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful wonderful wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Bijoucas
Reviews.Content: Found this gem through tripadvisor myself- looking for a unique, non-chain hotel. The reviews are spot on and wonderfully accurate- this is THE place to stay in Berlin. A matter of mere metres from the U-bahn or a 7-8min stroll into Alexanderplatz, superbly located for literally everything. Some gorgeous vintage shops on Rosenthaler Platz down to Hackensche Markt too. We found a gorgeous pub called Sophie'N Eck on the corner of Sophiestrasse. Hotel rooms quaint and superbly clean. Ours was on the very busy interchange and we heard nothing thanks to the efficient windows. Love the iPad in the bar. We cannot wait to come back!!

Reviews.Title: “best service we have ever had in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: thewino
Reviews.Content: Everyone went out of there way to make our trip as enjoyable as possible. From walking me to a bank to solve a problem,to dealing with some lost articles, all staff members went out of their way to please. Add to the hospitality, with really exceptional value and excellent East location, this is the place to stay in Berlin. and dont forget to begin the day with its excellent breakfast (not included,but good value) And Jim, thanks again for all you did for us.!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great room for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: pcm_1983
Reviews.Content: Berlin is an amazing city and this is a great choice to stay while you explore it. I got the jr. suite which is a large room and bathroom with a not so large price. You can expect a great hotel with a friendly and helpful staff who speak excellent english. You don't want to stay here if you are looking for luxury, a special romantic get-a-away, or something like that ... but it's an excellent choice for families, friends or couples looking for a great hotel at reasonable prices. If you are going to drive here, there is no hotel parking so be prepared to circle the hotel for awhile to find a place to park. They do offer a parking pass for free, but you need to call to reserve one. Because the hotel is right down town, it can be noisy if you leave the windows cracked to let some air in. It's in a excellent location, the U-Bahn is 10 steps away and there are lots of must see locations in walking distance, like the TV Tower. It's in a great spot for restaurants, live music and bars ... just ask the staff for recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Back again after two years and it's still so great - if not better!”
Reviews.Author: Roddick777
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at The Circus Hotel at Berlin in 2009. Now, two years later, I have come back to this amazing city and this amazing hotel, and I still find the hotel so incredible - if not more! First, there's the location. This hotel is literally RIGHT BY Rosenthaler Platz Bahnhof, which is extremely convenient for traveling to historical sites and interesting neighborhoods in the city. The immediate neighborhood is young and artistic, which makes for a very cathartic walk when you want a relaxing moment. Then there is the service - each and every member of the service team are so helpful and well-versed in all aspects of the city. From food to sight-seeing, just ask, and they will be there to help! The consistency of its service is immaculate. The rooms are clean and so comfortable, we actually enjoy relaxing in the room for an hour or two after our escapades in the city. If you travel to Berlin, you will never go wrong with Circus Hotel. In fact, it should be your NUMBER ONE choice!!

Reviews.Title: “This is an excellent Hotel, why have you not already booked it.”
Reviews.Author: Antbee001
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this fantastic hotel, and I cannot rate it highly enough. Upon arrival we were greeted by Anna (Anne?), who provided us with our keycards, Internet connection codes for 2 mobile devices and info about the Hotel and the services that they provide. The staff are very knowledgeable and helpful if you ask, but not in an intrusive way. The food in the restaurant is magnificent and reasonably priced. The room we had was a double, more than adequate for your needs, I mean you are only going to wash and change and sleep there. ( there is a hairdryer provided and plenty of plug points)The room itself was uber modern and very very clean. I have to comment on the design of the Hotel, and the whole ethos of it. Every single inch of space is utilised perfectly. Our room faced onto the small courtyard, it was simply perfect. There is a story behind the hotel, but you have to use the downstairs toilet to find out what it is. Guests please note, when returning to Schonefeld Airport, at Alexanderplatz Rail Station, it's the Airport Express train on track 1. We shall return next year. Berlin has far too many wonderful sights to see to do it justice in 3days. Go on a tour of the city first thing, we used the Berlin City bus tour, a green bus, the guide was fantastic and had a wonderful sense of humour, and buy a welcome to Berlin travel card, it is by far the most cost effective way to travel around Berlin. The ABC version takes you everywhere.The Berliners we encountered were very helpful. I suggest you study the subway system before you go, and the area around the sights you wish to visit. Enjoy, we certainly did

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bobandliz48
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at The Circus, and would not hesitate to recommend it to people staying in Berlin. Very easy transport links, clean room, and as friendly a group of staff you could expect to meet anywhere. They made our stay in Berlin perfect!

Reviews.Title: “This is THE Hotel to stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Terebv
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after reading all the great reviews and having stayed in the hostel 10 years ago and we could not have taken a better decision. We had a great time here. Staff is the best and so willing to help. We were traveling with a 5 month old and they just made our stay so easy with them. The hotel is super cool, the restaurant is great, we just loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: grantbloke
Reviews.Content: I think when you check TripAdvisor prior to booking you risk building expectations to unreasonably high levels. I think that's what happened with The Circus hotel. That's not to say that it wasn't great. It was very comfortable and the staff were helpful and friendly. The main points: + Rooms decorated to a high standard and spotlessly clean + Fantastic, large bathroom with an amazing shower + Great location with all transport links nearby + Cool bar/restaurant for chilling out + Check out is 12pm - Room was a junior suite, expected a double bed, got two singles pushed together with two separate duvets. - Only two English TV channels. I realise it's Germany, but it's also 2011. Not a huge deal, but if you return to your room to relax for a couple of hours it would be nice to have. - If you want to make coffee in your room you need to get some milk from the bar - Breakfast is just ok. I'm sure everything is organic and ethically sourced, but you can eat better for €8 per person. I'd stay again no problem.

Reviews.Title: “It lives up to the expectations....fantastic”
Reviews.Author: rx8man
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Circus purely on the basis of the fantastic reviews by other visitors, and the impressive prices that they were charging. We booked a Junior Suite at 100euro and were delighted with the design, cleanliness and fit out of the suite. It was worth every penny, and more. The staff were always happy to help and nothing was too much bother. Its convieniently located right next to the U-Bahn station of Rosenthaler Platz so getting around is simple! All in all, thoroughly recommended. One of the best hotels we've stayed in, and certainly the best value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, welcoming staff from front desk to room cleaners”
Reviews.Author: keith e
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in the second week of December. The initial good welcome at the desk was coninued through our stay by all the staff. Rooms were very good and warm, food was excellent and the publiuc areas were comfortable and relaxing. The hotel is very well situated just two U-Bahn stops north of center Berlin with good public transport including U-Bahn, trams and buses on the doorstep. There are also a good selection of eating places around the hotel. All the staff were only too willing to help with our queries on travel, events and general tourist destinations. Discounted travel cards were available at the desk at a very good rate. Overall, very good value and a most enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “I´m in love...”
Reviews.Author: Kustvagen
Reviews.Content: Just spent the weekend at The Circus Hotel - and I am blown away by how good it was. They have thought about every little detail. It is top notch place to stay. Many thanks to all of the staff - You are the best!!! So friendly and informative - without you the stay would not have been the same. All the excellent reviews here on TA are really true. If you go to Berlin this is really THE place to stay and I will be back for sure. Even my 70 year old mother came back raving about the place. ;) See you soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah P
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel recently (room 113 from 4th to 8th December 2011), and it was fantastic: the best thing about it was the staff - they were so utterly polite and helpful, they couldn't have done more! The room was a standard room, small but very comfortable, with a lovely clean bathroom with a great shower. It was warm and cosy and very welcoming after a hard day pounding the streets of Berlin! The hotel is situated a 10-minute walk from Alexanderplatz, and there is a U-bahn station literally right outside the hotel, so you can get to pretty much anywhere in Berlin in a short time. There weren't oodles of bars and restaurants in the immediate vicinity, but it's only a short walk down to Orianbergstrasse and Alexanderplatz. The hotel restaurant was excellent, can't fault it at all, and it was also a very good price - even the beer was relatively cheap! Breakfast was lovely - there was no hot food, but there was a large selection of cereals, meats and cheeses, and lovely bread, all organic. All in all, if you stay here, you won't be disappointed - and I will definitely be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, friendly staff, great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Richard T
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Circus Hotel at the beginning of December with my girlfriend. It was a very pretty place with a nice ambience. The rooms were decorated very nicely, and it seemed that everything about the rooms was well-thought through, and designed to be as convenient as possible for the guests. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. A fantastic experience.

Reviews.Title: “Everything done right and great value”
Reviews.Author: Idontqueueatsecurity
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel from the central location and public transport access down to the attention to the smallest detail in the rooms - our safe had a felt sheet so that our phones didnt get scratched! Staff were friendly and knowledgable and spoke good English -you can tell they liked working there. The bar and restaurant had a cool and relaxed atmosphere with an interesting menu and live music. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I wish there were more stars to give!”
Reviews.Author: annadive
Reviews.Content: This is THE place to stay if you want to explore Berlin. I would have happily spent twice as much money for the room, because the rooms were fun and modern, the staff incredibly friendly, the hotel breakfast fantastic and the location just cannot be beat. And you get all of this at a budget price. I grew up in Berlin and stayed at the Circus with a friend whilst showing her the city. You are within walking distance to the TV tower, the Hackescher Markt, all the attractions of Unter den Linden, the Museumsinsel (museum island), the Brandenburg Gate and the Reichstag (a longer stroll). There is a subway station right in front of the hotel and you are a 10 minute walk from the central Alexanderplatz train station. In addition you have lots of trendy shops and bars right by the hotel. Just wandering around the hotel you get an excellent feel of Berlin life instead of being tucked away in touristy areas such as the Ku'damm and Potsdamer Platz. And instead of having to take public transportation, many of the attractions are within walking distance. As already mentioned, the staff is extremely friendly and the hotel is set up to be accomodating to their guests with free wireless and Berlin cityguides that you can borrow for free. The hotel has an associated bar and restaurant that serves an excellent breakfast buffet. They also organize walking tours, bicycle rentals and seemed in general to be very knowledgeable about Berlin. Every time we walked past the front desk the staff was giving directions or suggesting attractions to guests. In addition the hotel seems very family friendly ... guests ranged in age from their 20s to 50s including several families with kids. Definitely a hotel that has something for everyone. I will be recommending the Circus to all of my friends who are planning a trip to Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Now I know why this hotel become number-1”
Reviews.Author: susanpradja
Reviews.Content: The room is cute and all I need was there. The staffs are so friendly and helpful. I quite surprised they even have their own magazine, and gave me a welcoming note with my name on it (like a 5 star hotel does!). I like the way they manage this hotel, these guys are really serious. I found in their magazine an article about The Circus Hotel-A Green Hotel: "Prices are predictable and calculated- we believe-fairly. We are not interested in squeezing the last euro from our guests..." and they really meant it. Once I asked about how to go to Gendarmenmarkt and Potsdamer Plats, and the reception, Isabella, gave me the map with the direction of tram from the hotel and a one day pass ticket, for free!

Reviews.Title: “If you visit Berlin and don't stay here, you'll regret it!”
Reviews.Author: Chrisshep1
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern, great rooms, great staff and a reasonable price for a major European city. Couldn't ask for much more. Oh and the bar has a great relaxed atmosphere!

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Nicinici
Reviews.Content: The location of hotel is very good, takes less than an hour from tegel airport. Many have mentioned the convenient of U bahn, but I would like to supplement that if you are going to museum island, the tram is so convenient that it just stop in front of pergamon museum. The Chinese food and donna keppa (???) just down hotel is tasty and budget.

Reviews.Title: “The Problem with Trip Advisor”
Reviews.Author: stone2
Reviews.Content: Is that am sitting in my room in this hotel. Booked in for three nights but I am not sure I will last one. Did any of the reviewers below note that if you get the room I have you can hear the traffic, the trolley and the voices of people on the street. What on earth are the thinking when they say perfect hotel or "best I've stayed in." That particular review must have come from someone just out of prison. The staff is utra nice and it is all very hip with the concern for environment but I'd trade all of that to escape the racket. What is that crashing should from the room on my right? As is so often the case, no air is stirring in the room and you cannot open the window unless you want the street sounds to pin you against the wall. Just how thin can these walls be. Will I inadvertently become part of a threesome. Beware of the hype of the people who write for trip advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Cristina A
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in one of the apartments (Apartment 1- for up to 5 people). The apartment had 2 rooms (flat screen in each room), 2 bathrooms, living room, dining room and kitchen. It was extremely comfortable, clean and beautifully decorated. Amazing Location (the Rosenthaler Strasse U station is in front of the hotel). Wi-Fi is available in the rooms. Staff was extremely friendly. Definitely an excellent choice!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Iain F
Reviews.Content: The Circus Hotel is the best hotel I've stayed in. Located around 10m from Rosenthaler Strasse U station, you're only 2 stops from Alexanderplatz. I stayed for 3 nights last weekend. Starting at reception, where my appalling German was complemented (thank you!) the experience was excellent. I stayed in a single room, which had everything I needed. Fittings were high quality and the room was absolutely spotless. Each room is decorated differently - I stayed in a green themed room that was very cool. Fabisch restaurant served a lovely buffet breakfast (EUR8) that sets you up for the whole day. Food is local, seasonal and very, very good. The staff were very helpful throughout my stay, sorting out a ticket to watch Hertha Berlin (bargain at EUR12 including free travel throughout the day)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Pat1234
Reviews.Content: I actually read 258 of the reviews before choosing to stay here - and agree with all the very favorable reviews. This was my first visit to Berlin and it was going to be a fairly long one - 8 nights. Since it was business related, I needed excellent WiFi (and it's free) and the room had to be bright, comfortable and cheerful to work in - which it was.
