The room also had lots of easy-to-get-at electric outlets. The safe in the desk was large enough for my 15" laptop, external hard drive, SLR camera, and more. Greatly appreciated was a vase with fresh flowers. Altho solo, I stayed in a double. Great location. The metro is right outside. So is a taxi stand where several were always available. The kiosk around the corner to buy bottled water, juice, etc is open 24/7. Post office (which sells stationery, envelopes) 1/2 block away. ATM machine at a bank also 1/2 block away. Several places to get a quick coffee, sandwich, or slice of pizza, some of which stay open until 4 am. The staff, at reception and the Fabische restaurant, were fantastic, friendly, helpful, enthusiastic, young, spoke excellent English - standouts include Keima, Veronika, and Michael. There was always a bowl of fresh apples at the reception desk for the taking. When I needed a sewing kit, in an emergency, they had one. Had dinner twice at the restaurant and enjoyed it. Since I rarely eat meat, was thrilled the menu included poached pike which comes with delicious vegetables. potatoes, and salad. Sunday evening there was free jazz (guitar and acoustic bass) in the restaurant. In addition to tables and chairs, there are large, comfortable, leather chairs and couches. A couple of nights friends joined me for drinks - and the ambiance is great. As others have noted, the water temperature and pressure in the bathroom sink and shower is excellent. The guest determines the temperature in the room and bathroom, so even though it was chilly outside, the room could be as warm as you like. A nice touch: the do-not-disturb sign for the door is red (stop) and make-up-the-room side is green (go.) The age of the guests varied from 20's to 70's, tourists and business. My room was on the 4th floor, facing the street, and I enjoyed looking at the activity of the street. Although I didn't hear street noise - I kept the windows closed since it was cold outside. I don't know what it would have been like during the summer with the windows open. There was also a feeling of good karma in the hotel. A sign on an exterior hotel wall gives a very short history of the building - that it belonged to the Fabisch family, who were Jewish, and that it ended under the Nazi dictatorship. "We live and work here with the knowledge of their fate, and in respect for their work." In the basement, near the restaurant bathrooms, there is a longer, more detailed, history of the building and the Fabisch family - including that "Phillip Fabisch's three children were deported to the Theresienstadt concentration camp in 1942 and murdered." Also, that the basement of the building housed a library "known as the 'writers' library' because of all the jobless writers who spent time there." It is a wonderful hotel, very reasonably priced for what it offers, and I can't imagine staying anywhere else when I return to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to all these excellent reviews”
Reviews.Author: DJKane2006
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4days in Berlin staying at the circus hotel. Before we went we wondered if a hotel could really be as good as all these reviews.... Actually it is! Lovely comfortable rooms, great staff & an amazing location. While I would definitely recommend the circus, I don't want everyone to find out about it as I'd love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fantastic Location, Roomy for Families”
Reviews.Author: alwysluv2travel
Reviews.Content: Although a little late, I feel I must also contribute to ensure this hotel keeps its status. We had a two bedroom, two bathroom suite at the back of the hotel looking over a courtyard on the first floor. Although the stairs are a little narrow for large suitcases, once you get inside the apartment it is so spacious and roomy for a family of four. The entire suite was exceptionally clean (and kept clean) and tidy and very quiet. The supply of fans to keep cool was more than adequate for July. Internet connection excellent and staff only too happy to help with buses, trains, recommendations and bookings. There is a very handy laundromat across the road (diagonally) for longer stays and many great restaurants in the area. Having a full kitchen we were able to cook for ourselves which was great. I would highly recommend this hotel for families visiting Berlin as the suites are very spacious and can sleep 5 and are well appointed. Supermarket close by as well as train station. All in all, a wonderful stay and we will definately recommend and return hopefully sometime in the near future. Thanks Circus Hotel for ensuring our stay was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: chrisasheffield_UK
Reviews.Content: Perfect. Great breakfast service. Friendly and helpful staff. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, comfy hotel in great location in trendy East Berlin.”
Reviews.Author: Ben1982Manchester
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel with individual, trendy rooms and incredibly friendly, helpful staff. Really comfortable atmosphere. Brilliant location in walking distance of Hackescher Hofer and Prenzlauer Berg with tram and U-bahn stops outside. Brilliant buffet breakfast in stylish Fabisch bar/restaurant downstairs. Has books and even iPods and iPads to entertain yourself with. Loved our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Romsparkle
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, excellent location right by the metro. Great room, very modern and trendy. Lovely bar area and nice food. I wouldn't stay anywhere else when visiting Berlin. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “The Greatest!!”
Reviews.Author: Jontejonte
Reviews.Content: This place i really really great! It´s like a second home!

Reviews.Title: “Service minded staff, nice location, great breakfast and nice drinks/music in the jazzbar during Sunday evening.”
Reviews.Author: Sebban81
Reviews.Content: Relaxed and friendly place with a great attitude. High quality in everything they do.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: TDietrich
Reviews.Content: I was interested to know if this hotel was really as good as the reviews, and it was! Easy to get to from the airport, the instructions on the hotel website make it very simple. Staff friendly, even at 11pm at night when we arrived. Rooms great, cant fault them. Bar, fantastic, cocktails wonderful, food in resturant really good. Its in a brilliant part of Berlin. I have booked again for January and cant wait

Reviews.Title: “Charming personal and chic”
Reviews.Author: peder_palmstierna
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel in central Berlin. The staff was so friendly and knowledgeable and the hotel fun and green. Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “THE hotel for Berlin”
Reviews.Author: garryDC
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for visiting Berlin from the East side (Mitte & Prenzlauer). Comfortable rooms, all different. Modern design & recently renovated. Friendly staff. Lively. Nice breakfast. Regular events organised - conferences, music etc. Stayed there a week but would have preferred to stay a month. Ubahn & tram stop just in front of the entrance. Lots of great restaurants in the area. The whole neighborhood is changing fast - go see it soon. As they say in Berlin, the city is "poor but sexy"

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service the name of the game”
Reviews.Author: seasonedtraveller976
Reviews.Content: Those reading the reviews and expecting a 5 or 4 star hotel will be disappointed, but after staying here, the thirst to stay in another sterile branded hotel will be quenched. The hotel is medium sized and what it lacks in size it more than makes up in service. Nothing is too much trouble and has some nice touches, making it a place you can relax and feel comfortable in, especially for the evening night cap! Although on a weekend trip we didnt spend a lot of time in the hotel, everything was good when we did. The hotel is geared around supporting the 'east' side of the Berlin economy and many recommendations on places to see and eat will be on the east side. This is a positive thing, as since the regeneration of the east, there are plenty of good places to go. The walk up to Bernauer St and then down along the remaining bits of the wall to the Wall memorial is both fascinating and sobering. The route is laden with information points which provide a small insight into what local life was like living with the wall. You cannot comprehend it. Excellent hotel, recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!!!”
Reviews.Author: pepas
Reviews.Content: Everything positive written about this hotel is true, one of the best service received at any hotel I have stayed, including 5 star properties, and all because of its employees !!! Great location, lots of restaurants around and you can walk or tube to attractions. The only thing if I had to find something to improve would be getting bigger and thicker towels, but the ones they had did the job. Congratulations to all their emplyees and mgmt team for a job well done !!!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jogigibbons
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay. Stayed in a junior suite which was a lovely room. It's not really the rooms that make this hotel though it's the great atmosphere. Staff are very friendly and willing to help. Also the iPad for guests to use was a nice touch. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Spacetank
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week while visiting Berlin for the first time. The staff were really friendly, all spoke English and were happy to recommend things to do in the city. We especially recommend the free walking tour that stops by the hotel and hostel. Our standard room was lovely, with an awesome walk in shower that was huge. The food in the restraunt was really nice and I recommend the breakfast. I've seem quite a few reviews of it on here saying its frugal, but unless you expect a banquet we didn't find that this was the case. Overall we had an awesome time there, it made a great holiday extra great.

Reviews.Title: “Dream hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sinix
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I've ever been :) There is 0 complainments :) I've came from Serbia to Berlin for a 5 day vacation, and I read about reviews on this site to help me find bes hotel, and I choosed Circus! I can only tell the best things about this number 1 hotel in Berlin! Staff is great, veeery friendly, rooms are very unusual and amazing, decorated in very special style, very realaxing and modern style. Restaurant is great: You can find german food which is amazing here (loved cold cucumber soup). You can use laptops from reception, and you'll get a free BVG card, so you can use public transport for free during your stay.. When I come to Berlin again, I know where I'm going to stay.. This is like second home :))

Reviews.Title: “Simply delightful”
Reviews.Author: BeeZak
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed a week in The Circus Hotel while visiting our daughter in Berlin, May 2011. The location is lively, yet not too touristy. There are many unique and fun restaurants near this hotel, and easy walking to many interestings destinations. Public transport is steps from the hotel door. The hotel restaurant is great, and we enjoyed stopping in the bar for tea and cake after an evening out. Every hotel employee was friendly, helpful, and engaging. The room was spotless, attractive, and very comfortable and the shower was one of the best we've ever used in ANY hotel anywhere. The windows opened to the fresh air and we slept likes babies. When we return to Berlin next year, The Circus is where we will stay. No need to even consider any other hotel. We always visit Berlin in the spring or fall, so the temperature of the room is never an issue for us. Summer could be uncomfortable with no AC.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: macarr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in November 2011. Decor is lovely and the staff are very helpful. There are loads of bars and restaurants in the local area and the facilities at the hotel are great. We ate at the hotel restaurant one night and really enjoyed it. They have a great selection for breakfast also

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: akt2011
Reviews.Content: My family enjoyed a fantastic stay at the Circus Hotel in November 2011. We had 3 double rooms and all were really smart, modern and clean - lovely bathrooms with good showers. Food at breakfast was really nice, healthy and good quality. Public areas were nice and cosy, bar was nice too. Staff were friendly and helpful always, and all spoke English. Position was perfect, right beside the U-bahn so accessible for all areas, and with a huge variety of restaurants and bars in walking distance. Would highly recommend and would stay again - and would try the hostel over the road too! Ran out of time to try the buffet breakfast there!

Reviews.Title: “Good all round hotel”
Reviews.Author: pearlo
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. The location is perfect! with a U-Bahn station right outside the door of the hotel, lots of cafes and lovely restaurants just round the corner from it. On a sunday we walked to the lovely flea market just round the corner. The rooms are clean and modern but we had an issue with the heating, on the first night we had to request extra blankets - as the hotel is Green, it seems to be rationing the heat. The staff are extremely friendly and organic breakfast was great. The attached restaurant also serves really great meals... I'm not sure if this hotel is reasonably priced or not because it was recommended to us and we didn't bother to shop around. All in all I'd recommend this hotel highly

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: aaceYork
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at The Circus and loved everything.The atmoshere and ethos of the hotel is to be highly commended. The rooms are modern and very clean. The food, at all times of day and night, is delicious and the seasonal menu offered plenty of choice for all budgets. The staff were outstanding - (probably the best staff we have ever experienced in any hotel anywhere! ) and they are what makes this hotel stand apart from other good hotels.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: 2inmelbourne
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently spent 10 days at the Circus. It's all been said in other reviews - just how fantastic are the staff, the accommodation and location. The Hotel really works on its presentation in all areas, and its ethos against waste is impressive. The morning coffee was fantastic, the seasonal restaurant menu was interesting and the food was great. In terms of value and location close to the subway we just couldn't imagine anything better. We are recommending ti to any of our friends who are travelling to Berlin - and we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: ajd83
Reviews.Content: There isn't too much more that I can add to what other reviews have already said. The Circus Hotel is fantastic! Staff are super friendly & eager to assist in any way possible. Whilst the breakfast is good (& I like the fact that it is organic), for Berlin it is kind of pricey. There are heaps of bakeries & cafes to grab something which are much cheaper. Location is perfect, very central. Taxi from airport cost about 40€. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Unbeatable Value”
Reviews.Author: Mel_In_Melbourne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. The hotel is situated in a fantastic area, very close to public transport, key tourist attractions and great shops, restaurants and bars in the area of Mitte. Rooms were well designed and very clean and tidy with modern decor. Bathroom was also very well maintained, spacious and clean. Staff at the hotel were very helpful in terms of recommending places to visit and making reservations and bookings for us, such as organising passes for us to visit the Reichstag. One of the highlights of this hotel is the buffet breakfast at their restaurant Fabisch - produce was fresh and delicious and a particular highlight is the bircher muesli, one of the best I have ever tasted! The restaurant also has a bar which has a great vibe in the evenings, depending on when you are staying there, they sometimes get bands and other entertainment to play there creating a great, relaxed and social vibe. This hotel also aims to be environmentally conscious if that is important to you. Overall I think this hotel is excellent value, compared with many other hotels we stayed at in Europe, you really do get the full value of what you pay for, if not more. Free wi-fi is also included. I will definitely consider staying here again if I were to visit Berlin in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Notts_Today
Reviews.Content: Dont go anywhere else. Great service, great hotel, great location, great german people, great everything, we had a fab time!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Miatamomma08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Circus Hotel in late October 2011. My husband and I (both age 66) found this gem from a guide on Berlin from the internet. Then went to Tripadvisor for recommendations and was happily surprised to see everyone really liked this small hotel (only 60 rooms). The hotel is located in Mitte and is on a train and bus line. The rooms were small, but modern, very clean and airy. We forgot our electrical converter and they gave us one without charge to use for our time there. There is also a great restaurant attached to the hotel if you want breakfast, lunch or dinner. We did not have an opportunity to eat there, but stopped for a cup of coffee and some German chocolate cake in the evening. The coffee and dessert was good. Staff is competent and friendly always helping us navigate around the city. I would recommend this hotel for anyone, any age.

Reviews.Title: “Great bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Sarah L
Reviews.Content: Nice location close to Hauptbahnhof, great breakfast, friendly staff, clean with a really good bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic accommodation to start to our holiday”
Reviews.Author: YVNZ
Reviews.Content: It was our first time with European accommodation on our trip and what a great start. We were able to check in early after arriving on an overnight train which meant no lugging around a heavy pack until check in time. The reception staff were excellent, very friendly and happy to give us a map and advice on things to do nearby (which was plenty!). The Hotel was easy to find and location fantastic - around 15 minutes walk and you were at Museum Island and the Berliner Dom. The room itself was lovely and clean and despite being on the first floor overlooking the busy intersection, we hardly heard any noise at all with the windows closed at night. In a way, listening to the people chatting in the shop below and drinking made it more atmospheric! Book a double room at the economy rate if you want to save a bit of money too - the room is big and comfortable enough for two people! Overall, excellent accommodation to start our trip and fantastic hospitality! Thanks Circus Hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Ernestine9
Reviews.Content: I have only the highest praise for this hotel. The building is beautifully designed - comfortable and really lovely to be in. The bedrooms are excellent, with great showers and modern design. The breakfast is stunning and the staff are exceptionally friendly and helpful. It was a great base for a few days in Berlin, right next to the U-bahn and a very short walk from several other central stations such as the Hackescher Markt. Lots of restaurants, cafes and clubs nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly atmosphere, lovely accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Cat N
Reviews.Content: Really a home away from home. The staff are extremely nice and will do everything they can to make your stay enjoyable. This was our first trip to Berlin and I was a bit concerned about the location, but it turned out to be ideal. I loved Berlin and I loved this hotel -- definitely hoping to return.

Reviews.Title: “Circus heaven!”
Reviews.Author: Peeps76
Reviews.Content: After researching a number of hotels for a short, half term trip, the Circus Hotel seemed to match all of our requirements. In reality, the hotel delivered all of what it promised and more. Friendly staff, a fantastic room sited above the courtyard with a great balcony (that had it not been so chilly we would have loved to have enjoyed). Great food starting with a delicious breakfast and unusually for us we sampled the hotel's dinner menu which was just sublime. Can't fault this hotel enough, we were very sad to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaPT
Reviews.Content: I loved the view of the busy street below from our bright blue room! The room was very unique, comfortable and pleasant and I appreciated that it was not the standard hotel box room and decor. Very clean and tidy. The hotel seemed close to so many attractions and great restaurants. The staff were so helful in giving directions. The bar was pleasant and very affordable. I loved traveling across the street to the Circus Hostel for a simple breakfast and great lattes at hostel prices. I am so excited about this hotel that I hope to return some day. Berlin is a fun city and the Circus hotel added to my very enjoyable visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect modern hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: SatanicSurferz
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights on September 2011 at this hotel and I really loved it! Let's start with the downsides... as there are very few. - I'm a light sleeper so I specifically requested a quiet room facing the inside courtyard and far from elevators. I was answered by email that my request was accepted. On arrival, I was a bit frustrated to see that my room was right in front of the elevator and facing the very noisy Rosenthaler Platz. There are bars, restaurants, some traffic and a very noisy tram stop. - The breakfast served in the hotel restaurant is 8 euros, which I found a bit expensive for what was offered (no hot meals). That was the only downsides... everything else was just perfect! About the noisy room, I could have complained to the front desk... but I thought I should try it one night to see if I could sleep. To my big surprise, once the door (window) is closed, the room is pretty much quiet... I just heard the tram and with cheap earplugs, I didn't hear anything. I didn't hear anything from the elevator or from the hall. The room seemed very well soundproofed. I slept like a baby on all five nights. On the bright side, I had a good view of a beautiful square and of the TV tower. About the breakfast, I ate there the first two mornings, and then I tried other restaurants. So, no big deal at all! As for the great things about this hotel, there are too many to list them all. I'm a solo traveller so I opted for a single room on the fourth floor. - Very good location! The U-Bahn (U8) right outside the hotel will take you to the Alexander Platz station where you could go anywhere in the city very easily and safely. You can easily walk to some nearby attractions (TV Tower, Museums Island to name a few) - Very modern and clean! Very nice furnitures, flat TV, in-room safe, a "real" shower (no bath), no carpet (which is a good thing for me... I don't know if it was real hardwood floor, but it looked like it), comfortable bed. I don't need that but for those who needs that... the room was beautifully decorated. - Very good staff! Every staff I ran into (about 4-5) all spoke perfect English, were very polite, friendly and helpful. They can lend you all kind of stuff. Personally, I borrowed a laptop with Internet access once in a while, free of charge. - Very eco-friendly hotel! Lights in hallways were automatically turned on when you entered and automatically turned off when you exited. We could feel that they were trying to do their best to help mother earth. - Very good price! I paid 70 euros a night, which I find pretty reasonable for the quality of the room and the location. All in all, this is the perfect hotel. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and would definitely stay there again on my next trip to Berlin... and I definitely would not bother trying to find another hotel in the city as I don't think I would find any better place for this same price!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good experience”
Reviews.Author: lovesylvie
Reviews.Content: I have some mixed feelings about the Circus Hotel. In general, the staff were very friendly, though some less interested than others for sure. I really liked the cafe and the ability to hang there, borrow a laptop, and get something to eat or drink. They do have some amazing services (INCLUSIVE) that other luxury hotels do not even offer for a price (like the laptop). I stayed in a Junior Suite (though I didn't get the balcony that others have spoken of..) but the 'suite" part was just space enough for two armchairs that had no lights near them, so were really useful for sitting reading. The lighting was another complaint- as the room was very dimly lit in general, and my friend and I both foudn the beds too be very uncomfortable. I did like the location, with the metro directy across the street and a very quick walk to the museums and Hacheschker Hofe. Very clean rooms--- I would definitely stay again for sure- but did not get the wow factor that so many others have spoken of.

Reviews.Title: “Really good value hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: LondonJimmy101
Reviews.Content: Fantastic value, sociable and fun clean. Would definitely recommend this place to anyone on any budget. I'd also recommend hiring their Segways to see the city- a really good way to whizz around the sights without too much strain,

Reviews.Title: “What a hip, affordable find!”
Reviews.Author: CreeksideGrassValley
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at this hotel and loved our junior suite with balcony and view of the Fernsehturm. The bathroom was very large, very modern with a gorgeous shower; however, the shower floor was very slippery so we used sponge cloths on the floor to fix that. The hotel is beautifully decorated with a contemporary style and interesting little features. The Reception Desk staff were enthusiastic and always helpful; the public transporation passes they loaned were great. Public transportation is all around the hotel - the U-bahn, streetcars & buses abound. We found the public transportation very accommodating in terms of access - elevators and escalators were well marked in the U & S bahn stations. The Fabisch restaurant had an excellent menu, and free jazz on Friday and Sunday evenings. We would return to this fun, upbeat and highly affordable hotel in a minute!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff - a great introduction to Berlin”
Reviews.Author: JulieAHP
Reviews.Content: We landed at TXL after a red-eye flight from Canada and arrived at The Circus Hotel after following the public transportation directions posted on their web site - very easy and incredibly helpful! (The Rosenthaler Platz U-bahn station is steps away from the hotel's entrance.) We were warmly greeted and quickly checked in to our Double Economy room. The room was cozy, bright and cheerful - and even a bit quirky - and had a very comfortable bed and enough room to store our things. The bathroom was a great size and in good, clean working order. Toiletries were only available from the front desk but were easy to get. The staff was full of great information and suggestions for things to do. They did not hesitate to highlight some of Berlin's 'must sees' on a map and show us newcomers the way. We had them hold our luggage after checkout and watched as our bags were put in large, locked compartments - very reassuring. The breakfast buffet was a great option for a reasonable price. I definitely recommend The Circus Hotel to others who appreciate good value and a bit of character.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Seniordublin
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our first visit to Berlin and stayed in the Circus Hotel, recommended by you. It was wonderful: Lovely room, really friendly staff, all of whom spoke perfect English and very good food. We also went on several trips with Brewer's Berlin Walking Tours, which the Hotel recommended and these were first class too: most informative. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Erin L
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Berlin and we loved the circus hotel. We booked the small (economy) double room and found it spacious enough for us. The shower was heavenly and I'm pretty sure my husband would have been content to stay in there all day. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel because we were running late in the mornings, but with the 2 bakeries across the street, we had other options. We had a drink in the courtyard, however, and it was very pleasant. Shampoo/body wash/lotion is not provided in the rooms, but you are told at check-in to take what you need from a shelf right behind the reception. We were very happy with our stay and would stay again in a heartbeat. We found the directions found on the website from Tegel airport to the hotel to be very easy to follow and accurate. It is super easy to get anywhere from the circus - great location!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: readytogo63
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews. We were not disappointed. Price was good, location was excellent and the staff most helpful. Loads of places to grab a quick bite for reasonable prices. Very close to 2 self-service laundry facilities for those who have been on the road for awhile. The rooms are not plush but very serviceable and comfortable. The only down side was the airport shuttle service. When we mentioned our frustration to the front desk they acknowledged they had received several complaints about service recently and were currently looking for a new provider. With this in mind we used public transportation to the airport when leaving Berlin. The Underground is steps out the front door with an easy transfer to a bus for the remainder of the trip. Total time about 45 min to an hour and costing 2.30 Euro per person. When our laptop didn't work, the hotel loaned us one for free. We could e-mail from the comfort of our room. Such a nice perk. The Circus Hotel is a real find. We loved the vibe and the personable staff.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are acurate”
Reviews.Author: Brian J
Reviews.Content: Epic place in a great location with attention to detail. In addition to all the normal expectations this place takes it a step further: They even rent out daily subway / train / bus passes-- what a great idea! Great shower! I couldn't find anything that I disliked about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Not much else to add”
Reviews.Author: AlexF77
Reviews.Content: I really don't have much else to say. Great location in the Mitte. Extremely friendly and helpful staff. Very nice comfortable rooms given the price. Good bar downstairs. I can't imagine staying at another hotel in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Deservingly no. 1 in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: poleus
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in great area of Berlin. Everything you need from a hotel with none of the unnecessary extras often included in major city hotel chains and independents alike. Extremely helpful staff, lovely individually decorated rooms, good bar area and courtyard. If you are going to stay at the Circus, make sure you include breakfast, it's a locally and ethically sourced buffet which is great value, a must. We're going back next month...

Reviews.Title: “Staff is right on with everything”
Reviews.Author: sailbetz
Reviews.Content: Esra in reception is a wonderful resource and hep. Michael in Fabisch could not have been any more accomodating with our meals.

Reviews.Title: “Should be your first choice for Berlin”
Reviews.Author: flynn78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Circus Hotel for four nights in September and we were delighted with our choice. From the easy to follow directions from Tegel Airport to the hotel by bus and U-Bahn to several excellent suggestions regarding restaurants and things to see, we found the staff at the hotel to be enthusiastic and very service oriented. Our junior suite was huge and very reasonably priced. Our only minor quibble was with the pillows. The big ones were too big and the little ones were too small. Other than that, we literally had no complaints. The hotel brochure in our room suggested a neighbourhood walking tour which we took to our great satisfaction. With so many big sights to see in Berlin, small neighbourhoods can get overlooked. This tour, which should take about an hour and a half, lasted almost four hours for us and included a short side trip to the Berlin Wall Memorial on Bernauer Strasse. We highly recommend this stop and were grateful to the hotel staff for pointing it out. They also recommended the Brewers walking tour, which was one of the best we have ever taken. Overall, we were blown away by how helpful the desk staff were. If this isn't enough, the location of the hotel is great. There is easy access to almost everywhere you would want to visit and many big attractions are within walking distance. Many others have mentioned the great restaurants nearby, so we'll just add our concurrence, but we especially enjoyed the Oranium, which is about a ten minute walk from the hotel. They have some excellent tapas choices and their full course meals are quite good as well. The bottom line on the Circus Hotel is straightforward, if you can book it, do so. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lauren25c
Reviews.Content: Circus Hotel Berlin is a really lovely boutique hotel, right in the centre of Berlin, in the Mitte district. The hotel is not part of the Hostel across the road, so remains a very upmarket place to visit. Circus is located right next to the local underground station, but is only a short walk from the central tourist sites too. Rooms very chic, spotlessly clean, lovely bar, food and drink, and really friendly staff - a recipe for success.

Reviews.Title: “The coolest hotel. Anywhere.”
Reviews.Author: Joel R
Reviews.Content: Unless you're someone who absolutely has to stay in an exclusive, expensive hotel, The Circus is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel let down by poor service”
Reviews.Author: maxineLondon
Reviews.Content: All the positives have been said and I totally agree - however poor service is a problem, We were told that because of 'green' issues tea/coffee were not provided in the room, but were available 24/7 from room service free. Not the case a charge was made and on one occasion we were told they were too busy... The service in the restaurant was poor, we waited 90 mins for a main course and were then refused a desert because the kitchen had closed! No apology from the waitress just attitude. When I complained to the manager the matter was dealt with well and to my satisfaction. Reception staff were very unhelpful in providing information on the weekends Reunification celebrations and suggested we walk the 15 mins to the tourist information centre. Potentially excellent hotel letting themselves down with poor service.

Reviews.Title: “lived up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: travelmum
Reviews.Content: I appreciated the reviews on this hotel, so will add one, but will try to not just repeat what has already been written. It is a good find; a nice small boutique hotel, not part of the hostel. Very friendly staff and very helpful when booking. Great directions from the airport to the hotel via public transport, though the directions actually take you to the hostel, but you just cross to the other side of the plaza to get to the hotel. Nice modern rooms, and although they are small, they are certainly adequate in size, and very modern and sort of funky in decoration. Modern bathroom, comfy bed, and as said elsewhere, excellent insulation and no noise from the traffic when the windows are closed. Restaurant has small but lovely menu, all healthy organic type of food, and lovely coffee! 2E for a coffee, but 4E for the museli/yogurt/fruit bar for breakfast including the excellent coffee! 8E if you wanted the larger breakfast which we didn't. Location is pretty good; can walk downtown, in fact we walked everywhere, but there are subway stations close by if you're not a walker. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “easy hotel”
Reviews.Author: haticeg
Reviews.Content: Circus hotel has a simple german formula to be number one: perfect location and next door to night life. Young and helpfull staff, trendy and simply clear room and good price.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: RachelG6846
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Circus Hotel for three nights in September. I can see why this hotel is rated #1 in Berlin! The hotel was perfectly located in Rosenthaler Platz in a vibrant area of Berlin. Stepping right out the door there was a huge variety of take away and sit down cafes. (The Chinese place next to the hotel was awesome - can't remember the name!). The room was chic, modern, clean and big for European standards. We had the Double Room. We had breakfast at the hotel every morning, and it was fresh and a lovely sit outside in the courtyard in the mornings. The staff was very helpful, calling a taxi for us, giving us information on tours (take the Brewer's Berlin tour!), and even supplying a band aid after a nick with the razor. Berlin is an awesome city, and The Circus Hotel fits right in. I plan on returning to the Circus Hotel many times!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: sssteveg
Reviews.Content: We just got back (September, 2011) from a 6 day stay at the Circus Hotel in Berlin. The hotel lived up to all the wonderful recommendations here on TripAdvisor. The location is perfect, our junior suite was spacious, and the staff is absolutely wonderful. Breakfast at the hotel's restaurant Fabish was also excellent. The only drawback would be that the hotel rooms have no air conditioning, although they do supply a strong fan. This was no problem for us since we were there in September, but I would think twice about staying there in July or August. There was some street noise during the night, but it wasn't a major problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location and general vibe.”
Reviews.Author: davidking75
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and were very happy. The staff couldn't be more helpful and the rooms were clean and modern with a good touch of style. A Metro station is just outside which is very useful for travelling around the city although Alexandraplatz is a pleasant 15 minute stroll away. I would not hesitate in recomending this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “#1!”
Reviews.Author: chicotattini
Reviews.Content: Everything is perfect, starting with the lovely staff, who helped us with everything and much more! Will be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Unicorngiraffe
Reviews.Content: I love little arty, quirky things. Circus Hotel is this and perfect service. We were instantly greeted by the loveliest girl at the desk, who introduced us to all of their services, gave us a map and gave us all the information on Berlin we needed, and then let us check in early. The room was immaculate and gorgeous- I absolutely love the design! You should definitely eat at the restaurant- buffet was amaaaaaaaaaazing (bircher muesli delicious! And the jam. YUM!) and the dinner was excellent too. Perfect hotel, and I'm sad that it's so hard to find something similar anywhere else! All of the staff were absolutely lovely and the location was great. I cannot say anything bad about this place!

Reviews.Title: “All tyhe great things you read about The Circus Hotel are true!”
Reviews.Author: margo c
Reviews.Content: The first impression is always the most important and at The Circus Hotel you are greeted by very friendly and helpful front desk staff. They go out of their way to ensure that everything is just the way that you want it and they do it with a genuine smile. They tell you that they love Berlin and want their guests to love Berlin too. They will organize all sorts of sight seeing trips and help with getting tickets. Their idea of a subway pass for 4.50 EUR a day is so very helpful. The hotel has all sorts of rooms with different themes, the beds have nice crisp white sheets, very clean bathrooms with a large shower and lots of hot water. There are fans in the room and thye windows open. We spent 5 nights at the Hotel and always felt very comfortable coming back. The restaurant has a small selection of meals but they are high quality. We spent one afternoon with very tired and sore feet sitting in the back courtyard eating lunch and then drinking a pot of tea for over two hours and it was so very relaxing. The location is perfect for using the extensive subway system. Berliners are very nice people who often came up to us to offer directions or to translate while we were trying to mail home souvenirs. Wonderful hotel, city and people!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Principessa18
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with stylish rooms, great breakfast (delicious bircher muesli) and impressive green credentials. It's a good place to base yourself to explore Berlin and the local area is well worth a look (try the curry wurst around the corner). Very friendly staff and the visitor is well catered for with helpful information and services. But should it be a rainy afternoon and you don't fancy going out it's worth enjoying the relaxed cafe / restaurant downstairs; friendly atmosphere, books and magazines to read, and maybe find out about the history of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: mooro79
Reviews.Content: Circus review WOW My reservation was based on all the previous comments posted on here and I can safely say my expectations were still exceeded. Okay let's go through a brief run down in bullet points. Fab staff - nothing too much trouble and more than happy to offer suggestions. U-bahn - the underground literally outside the door so easy to connect to anywhere in Berlin. Top tip 1- ask for the hotels transport pass as it saves u money €4.50 per day compared to €6+. It's then charged to your bill. TT2 @ weekends you only need one pass between 2 of you. Breakfast - is a bargain for €8 each. Wide selections and a good filler for the day until later on. Easy to over eat but I guess you are on hols. Cakes - well I'll leg you treat yourselves to those ;-) Nearby food. Try out Transit - out of the door, turn right and 50yards down on the left you will find a very reasonable Chinese come tapas. Lots of little dishes all very reasonably priced @ €3 with rice and noodle sides only €1. Harvest gold a particular fave.  Shopping. Rosenthaler str is very boutique like but individual and bring your wallet. TT3 take a left at the Fred Perry shop and follow the road for some great shops. Machima for ladies fashions at reasonable prices was a big hit with the Mrs.  It leads on to Alexander platz. KaDaWe is a cracking dept store on Kurfenstendam  and can be accessed by u-bahn on U2 at the Kurfurstenstr stop. V handy for Steiff on floor 5. We were there for the marathon and what a spectacle. Well organised and flat. No PB but loves the experience. If they do it again well worth getting your time lasered to your wrist band at the asidas store on Kurfenstendam. TT4 if you fancy watching Premier league games the Irish Bar under the S Bahn at Hackescher Markt is spot on. Only a small walk away from the Circus and handy for a pre match meal.  The Circus was a fantastic experience and Berlin is well worth a visit. If doing the marathon enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend break”
Reviews.Author: Roy B
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic break at the Circus. Welcome was best we have had anywhere. Staff made us feel so welcome and relaxed. Better than we expected by far and we will recommend to all our friends and family. East is best!

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: BlueAllOverTheWorld
Reviews.Content: Don't expect five star service but expect a four star hotel, at hostel prices. They don't have a gym, but there's a great restaurant attached, with good food at a low price. It's not a hotel in the service sense, there no bellhop or people to wait on you. But there's always someone there to answer your questions, free guide books and iPads for you to use, you can take food up from the restaurant to your room at no charge. They thought of everything. My only gripe is that their bicycle rentals weren't great, the bikes are well cared for, but they just aren't nice bikes (mine didn't brake well). They should recommend people to use the DB Call A Bike station just around the corner. Be warned, there is no AC, but the weather is pretty mild even in July. Otherwise, they are the master of casual chic. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: shnel
Reviews.Content: Stayed with 2 young children (1 & 3 years old) at 2 room apartment. Room was very clean and nice. Perfect location on U & tram stations. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Tripadvisor award was well deserved”
Reviews.Author: bobbyg66
Reviews.Content: Just spent 6 nights at the Circus Hotel. Perfect. Clean, friendly, well-decorated, well-priced, and located in the hippest part of Berlin. Thanks for the splendid recommendation. The breakfast buffet was good, but you might want to partake of other venues in the neighborhood for a change of pace. [There are some very chic bistros just up the street.] U-Bahn stop right next door makes getting around easy, although the walk to Museum Island is just 20 min.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Traveller´s Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EASYEZ
Reviews.Content: I wish this hotel was a chain hotel in various parts of the world. They were exceptional in all ways. The staff were incredible and the rooms spotless and comfortable. I felt totally safe. The breakfast buffet with meats and cheeses , etc was 8 euros including coffee/tea. This was good value but even better value is to have just their muesli buffet with coffee/tea for only 4 euros. Just a little tip for those of us who want to each a little less at breakfast and save money as well.

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: Jessska
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here in the summer as a special splurge after backpacking for 3 months. We made our booking via the hotel website which was super handy and we had no dramas checking in. The staff were young and the most helpful I'd met throughout all of Europe, always greeting and smiling at us even if serving other customers. We had one lady suggesting great spas to us throughout the city and another helping us find numerous destinations we were looking for and giving us so many suggestions we didn't know what to do with. The room was FANTASTIC with funky designs and lots of space. Gorgeous bathroom as well and a flat screen television. You could borrow a dvd player and dvds from downstairs too. The room service was free and the restaraunt had spectacular food but isn't the cheapest of options; however, I HIGHLY recommend the italian place across the road (cheap and amazing!!) The things we loved the best was it's fantastic central location, metro station right outside, the countless things available to you as a guest (inc: travel books you can borrow, brochures, board games, cheap segway hire, dry cleaning, and so much more), and the attentive staff and management. I will always stay here when in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: Tom L
Reviews.Content: great location, great hotel, very clean and modern, staff so helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: slyngen
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean rooms and superfriendly and helpful staff. Great location with lots of great places to eat nearby. Nice and safe neighborhood. Also near the metro, so the hotel was easy to get to from the main stations and it was easy to get around. Great value for money. Would choose to live here again next time I'm in Berlin. Thanks, Circus!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Tim G
Reviews.Content: There's a U Bahn entrance right outside the door, the television tower is an easy walk, and there are interesting shops, bakeries and outdoor cafes close at hand. The updated rooms are comfortable and the bar/cafe inviting. The price is very reasonable -- why stay anywhere else in Berlin?

Reviews.Title: “A circus for Excellency”
Reviews.Author: TravelstarSpore
Reviews.Content: I went to Berlin for the first time with my 2 boys, 12 and 14 and we ended up at the Circus Hotel, found by chance on Internet. Only one world characterize the place: PERFECT! Perfect were the location, the room, the price, the ambiance and the food at the hotel restaurant. The friendliness of the staff and their support was just outstanding. Coming from Singapore were hospitality is paramount, this is a real compliment.

Reviews.Title: “I Wish All Hotels Were Like This”
Reviews.Author: gelijojapa
Reviews.Content: Kind of earth shoe, and at the same time very stylish, and none of that at the expense of being totally efficient. Management and staff are passionate about providing great hospitality. We stayed here for four nights, and the longer we stayed, the more the place grew on us. Great location, nice restaurant. Even if you're not staying here, stop in and have a cup of coffee. Be sure to go downstairs and read their history.

Reviews.Title: “Very central and staff very very helpful”
Reviews.Author: EAMOH
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel very centrally placed in the heart of the city centre. All sights within walking distance. The staff are so helpful they will literally plan your entire stay if you want. They arranged a trip to reichstag for us.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T LOOK ANYWHERE ELSE - THE CIRCUS IS FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: isis44
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay here with my husband. It was our first trip to Berlin and we chose the Circus after reading the tripadvisor reviews. I'm so glad we did. From the moment you book accommodation at the Circus it feels like you are part of the family without it being intrusive. The website is brilliant for planning your trip for everything you can think of that you might like to do in Berlin. The directions for public transport to the hotel were spot on and just made it easy to get there. Once we arrived the check-in was friendly and even though we were early we were made welcome. The room was brilliant and really clean and comfortable. We had a junior suite overlooking the courtyard on the 3rd floor. Fantastic rain shower. The cafe/restaurant was really good and not expensive and the breakfast was excellent. We loved the muesli breakfast which was only 4 euros including unlimited drinks. The bircher muesli was especially fantastic! Location is within walking distance of all the places you want to go. We walked everywhere and you see so much more this way but if you want to get the underground there's a stop just outside the door as well as trams and a taxi rank round the corner. But the best thing about the Circus is the staff. The desk is manned 24hrs and we were told when we checked in that 'you can ask us anything at all - we know everything!' I tested this out and I think it was true! No one minded being asked for advice or assistance or just chatting to customers. It's a really lovely place to stay and I wish i could have stayed longer. Can't wait to book again. I wouldn't even bother looking anywhere else. Thank you everyone at the Circus. You are the best advocates for Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “CONGRATULATIONS THE CIRCUS TEAM!!!”
Reviews.Author: AndreaSP
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just come back from a 6-night stay at The Circus Hotel (Junior Suite at the first floor, facing the inner courtyard). We are totally delighted!!! We were not only captivated by its incredible location, comfortable room, fantastic staff and delicious food, but especially by its philosophy (http://www.circus-berlin.de/philosophy.html - the whole website is worth visiting). One of the most admired businessmen that I met (Fabio Barbosa) usually says that we must aim to “succeed by doing the right things, the right way”, and I believe this is exactly what The Circus Team is doing; so congratulations and thank you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: tomsimmons
Reviews.Content: Cannot recommend this hotel highly enough, excellent rooms and facilities, very helpful staff, great location and reasonably priced!

Reviews.Title: “Great location helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: F1veStar
Reviews.Content: Only had a brief stay but it was a  good room with comfortable bed, except for the noise - ask for a non-street room. There is no a/c so avoid in high summer.

Reviews.Title: “Just Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: MysteryLover61
Reviews.Content: Seriously, just stay at the Circus. Wonderful (and fun) rooms, great, reasonably priced food, super staff and a great location. What more could you want? We traveled all over Europe this summer and the Circus was far and away our favorite hotel. In addition to all those great features, they have free wi-fi throughout the building (something we found pretty much unknown in Germany) and a great Wiki that we used for restaurant reviews, museum hours, etc. And everyone there speaks fluent English.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place, clean, central and with very friendly knowledgeable staff”
Reviews.Author: Den999
Reviews.Content: This place is really a great value and an excellent base for the city on Rosenthal Strasse in Mitte area. Centrally located, very clean (spotless and I'm fussy!), designer- trendy rooms with great showers and comfortable beds BUT most of all fantastic and lovely staff all very helpful and knowledgeable about places to go, see, where to eat and drink. Everyone was great of course but a BIG THANKYOU to lovely Anna who put up with us umming and arring about where to eat and drink!! We had a room (309) facing the busy main crossroads but good quality windows kept the noise out at night. Our son had a single room (310) facing the inner courtyard which was equally as great. No A/C in rooms or hotel due to the hotels green'policy but that was fine as the rooms had fans and although we had temperatures in the mid to high 20's it was OK. Good breakfasts at 8 euros a piece. Good value meals for lunch/dinner. Has a roof terrace for nice views and chilling out. Just such a lovely base for a city trip and thoroughly recommend the place. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Circus Hotel made me in love with Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: TravellingBarefooted
Reviews.Content: This is the last night of my stay in Circus and I can't help but write down this review already. I can't wait a few days more. Actually, I don't want to fly back home yet. I love it here.:) Overall, I rated this hotel excellent because I am more than satisfied. I feel like I am living in a 5-star hotel right now(kidding aside). This boutique hotel is so special when it comes to the interiors, furnitures and design. Extraordinarily chic, environmental friendly, but of course, live-able. One can notice every detailing they did in every room (in my room, this case), bath, alley, reception, and everything from beautiful headboards to ecological soaps to LED lights, and many other to mention. Really a lot to mention! My room is big enough to house my long bare feet and cleanliness was never a problem. Every corner is dust-free and everything smells good (I check and smell everything!). The location is perfect! Beside the hotel is a metro station and if I wanted, I could have walked up to nearest main railway station. 5 points! Service is absolutely great! If only I could give more than 5 points.:) The staff is extremely hospitable and very friendly. You could ask almost everything from them. They are passionate with what they do that you feel like you can trust them like friends. How's that? I don't know but that is the Circus magic I'm feeling. I paid an amount that, I think, could not surpass the level of service I experienced and experiencing now.:) I will be back in Berlin again, anytime soon, and surely in Circus too. Right now, I have never thought of trying any other hotels so far. I am just looking forward to my next Berlin trip, and my new experience here in Circus!:)

Reviews.Title: “A long weekend in the uber cool Berlin”
Reviews.Author: K8ECardiff
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. The staff are lovely and very helpful. The bar is very cool - there was excellent live music two of the three nights we stayed (Fri-Mon). The food is delicious, but be warned, the portions are very generous! Breakfast was lovely, plenty of choice, all local produce, seasonal and organic. The room was fab - great layout, we settled in straight away as they've thought of everything. Very functional with no clutter and a lovely walk-in shower. The location is perfect too. The hotel is in Mitte in East Berlin, which is Berlin's equivalent Covent Garden (in terms of the trendy boutique and big name shops) all walking distance from the hotel. Funky area Prenzlauer Berg is within walking distance too. We'd recommend the Alternative Berlin walking tour http://www.alternativeberlin.com/ and the local flee markets (esp. the one in Arkonaplatz) on Sunday as the shops are closed. Fabulous weekend break. Thanks Circus Hotel - we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “We liked the Circus style and substance”
Reviews.Author: themacrae
Reviews.Content: We booked a Junior Suite here as a result of Trip Advisor reviews and were not disappointed in the 4 nights we were there. We enjoyed the Junior Suite @ 100euros a night and breakfast in the Fabisch restaurant depending on what you have was around 16e for two - if you only munch on the muesli and fruit, you get the cheapest deal . Total bill with tea and cake and the odd drink in the evening was 519 euros. We were on the third floor streetside above a crossroads where 5 roads meet which meant the nights were noisy - not helped by what turned out to be a rash of car burning which kept the fire brigade busy rushing around with sirens blaring.But this was more than compensated for by the central location. The Circus is right next to the Ubahn Rosenthaler Platz station and you can walk to the Museum Island in about 15 minutes through the Hackesher Markt. We had supper in the restaurant on the evening we arrrived - like breakfast, the service was friendly and efficient and the food was fine. All the staff we talked to spoke English and were v helpful on the usual questions that all first timers in Berlin like us ask . The room was a good size and the shower a big walk-in which was great and free shampoo gel etc was available at reception. No mini bar but not really needed. The tv was stuck up on the wall furthest from the bed but we did not have much time to watch it. We have stayed in several designer hotels where the priority appeared to be the cutting edge design - where not to like it meant only that you the guest were not hip enough to be there. The Circus manages to balance looking good with excellent guest service. Even the hotel magazine in the room was worth reading and was not the usual self-congratulatory 'aren't we great?' style. Security was good with the room swipe card needed to work the lift - necessary with the ground floor open to the street. Apparently reception is manned round the clock. Hauptbahnhof is one change away on the U and S bahn which means a bit of a walk at Alexanderplatz.

Reviews.Title: “Completely Incredible Circus Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sammifli
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Circus Hotel last week for two nights based on the reviews on Trip Advisor and I certainly wasn’t disappointed. We arrived at Berlin Schoenefeld and used the instructions from the website on how to get to the hotel via train. It couldn’t have been easier, the instructions were spot on and we found the hotel in no time and navigated the trains with ease. We got to the hotel early (10.30am) and wasn’t expecting a room to be ready but they said to come back at 11.15am and we could go to our room. We went off for some breakfast and came back an hour later to go to our room. The décor was amazing in the room, we had a Japanese theme (I understand all the rooms are different), the room was spotless, very clean, lovely bathroom and really comfy beds. The hotel promote organic fares and that they are environmentally friendly which I really liked. When booking I asked for a room facing the courtyard which we got and it was very quiet, the hotel is on a busy crossroads so can imagine there would be traffic noise in the outside rooms. The restaurant/bar Fabische (not sure of spelling) adjoining the hotel was lovely, again the décor was amazing, very funky whilst being impeccably clean. The food and drink was gorgeous, we ate there twice out of three days and had a drink in the bar every night. Very very reasonable prices too, a lot cheaper than anywhere else we went. I had pork schnitzel in wholewheat breadcrumbs (€13) and my boyfriend had the Currwerst (€6) both were absolutely delicious. I would definitely stay in this hotel again if I return to Berlin, I cant think of one negative comment on it. The location was perfect. Top tip – do a walking tour, we did a 4 hour Insider Tour and it was so good, you see so much more than if just walking around on your own.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, friendly hotel - A must stay!!”
Reviews.Author: sf_travel8
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a few friends in July. The staff here are friendly and courteous! They also offer free yoga classes on some days of the week. I didn't get a chance to try it out of shear laziness. The hotel breakfast buffet is yummy. I highly recommend this hotel! Each room has an IKEA like design that's whimsical and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good wheelchair access, great location and fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: Melissa M
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in The Circus Hotel for six nights in early May 2011. We chose the hotel partly on the basis of good TripAdvisor reviews, and were not at all disappointed. We arrived in Berlin by train and The Circus Hotel was a short taxi ride from Berlin's main train station. In fact, we could have caught a bus to the hotel, as we did on departure. Our room was not huge, but spacious enough, with a very comfortable bed. The bathroom was superbly accessible - one of the best wheelchair accessible showers I have ever seen in a hotel room. The room did not have air conditioning, but room windows were easily opened for fresh air. Our room overlooked the street and a tram line, but even with the window open at night, the tram noise was not disturbing. In fact, opening the window to get a bit of tram noise was helpful to drown out the sound of our neighbours having sex. The room had only a little storage for clothes, but did have a safe big enough for a laptop, with a power outlet inside. The hotel served a buffet breakfast that was organic, very European/German and delicious. The hotel's location was excellent, with tram, train and bus routes passing outside the hotel's front door. There were plenty of cheap eating options nearby too ... Turkish across the road, German self-serve bakery opposite, curry wurst around the corner, and some of the best Thai-style food I have had anywhere (including Thailand) down the road. Staff were friendly and helpful, and able to point us to a nearby laundromat to do a load of washing. My only quibble (and it's a minor one) was that wheelchair access from the street into the hotel was not through the main door, and required the front desk staff to unlock a side door. But at 90 Euro per room per night, The Circus Hotel was not just a good hotel, but extremely good value as well.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, quirky hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: NikiCoogeeAustralia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights, staff were very helpful and friendly, offering us heaps of things to do and see like local exhibitions, bike rides, even their bbq where its a great place to meet people. The hotel is in an awesome spot, really close to great places to shop and eat, plus its a short walk to jump on a hop on hop off bus tour. The room was clean and comfortable (best shower head too, its massive!) with quirky little artworks in the room. We had a fantastic view over the main intersection on the corner so it was really noisy with the window open but they are sound proof so its fine to get a good night's sleep. The only negative thing was there was no fridge in the room but you could keep things in the fridge downstairs, plus even borrow a microwave if you needed. I would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: blurondo
Reviews.Content: Little to add to all the other positive comments - there have been one or two mentions of noise - we were lucky and had a room overlooking courtyard (Rm 101 Junior Suite) and I don't think I've ever slept so well in a hotel. Bathroom and the hotel location were the very best elements but everything was good

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IrishGuest10
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, very clean, extremely friendly staff, perfect location. Would have no problem recommending to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: JSL_IL
Reviews.Content: We (two male friends) travelled for a weekend in Berlin and stayed at the Circus. The hotel is very well located just next to an underground station two stops from Alexander Platz (which is actually a walking distance). We used public transportation from/to Tegel airport - ~30 -40 minutes. The hotel it self is very clean. The rooms are convenient and modern, designed and decorated with good taste. The hotel cafe offers good food and especially good coffee (we were there during the "vegetables panick" so didn't dare trying all they had to offer). The hotel staff was very friendly and willing to help us. I'd like to mention Isabelle from the receprion who was always there for us with a smile and a tip. We reserved a Berlin Brewer tour - hoghly recommended - thanks Sylvia and Matt! All in all very good value for money, and I'll definitely stay there again in my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: JEJ1
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we had stayed at The Circus, the first being in December 2010. The Hotel is clean, centrally located, modern, comfortable and the staff are great. I have had a room facing both the courtyard and the road and although loud (as it’s a main road) it’s not unbearable and my partner and I both slept fine. The Hotel is one of the best examples of value for money I could think of, the quality and finish of all the rooms is quite astonishing actually when you think of the price. If I was forced to think of a negative it would be that on a Friday and Saturday night the hotel bar/restaurant can get very busy which can result in a long wait for drinks. This didn’t put us off though, we still drank at the bar almost every night before venturing out. I would recommend the hotel to anyone and everyone and couldn’t see myself staying anywhere else in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely helpful staff, great design hotel and environmental concept”
Reviews.Author: LadyTheodoraDarling
Reviews.Content: The Circus Hotel and adjacent hostel couldn't be any better to be honest. The staff are brilliantly helpful and have great suggestions on what to do, where to eat and you will also find a very informative guide to the hotel and Berlin in your room. The room was large and spacious, with a big bathroom. The hotel is decorated really quirkily and this was probably my favourite part of the hotel. ANother extremely handy facility they have at the Circus is the fact that you can borrow laptops, guidebooks, dvd players, ipods and cameras from reception which was a major plus for us. The hotel couldn't be cleaner, and I really liked the concept of an eco friendly hotel, which was really highlighted throughout the building. The one downside was that the weather was absolutely roasting when we were in Berlin, so not having air conditioning was a slight downside but the fan in the room was good enough. I understand that air conditioning goes against the hotels environmental ideals, so we totall understood where they were coming from. LOCATION!!! The location of the hotel was absolutely perfect, surrounded by good restaurants, interesting shops and within short walking distance from Museuminsel etc. What I liked about Mitte was that the atmosphere was so relaxed and laidback, and the people are not judgemental in any way so it was great. Just down the street and beside the park there were loads of great restaurants and loads going on. I would definitely go back tomorrow to this hotel and will reccomend it to anyone visiting Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: NNadejda
Reviews.Content: I've spent 4 nights recently! If u came for sightseeing - location is perfect, for business - perfect as well! The staff is very useful with the meaning of this word! Value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean and efficient!! I will be back!”
Reviews.Author: SoloTraveller83
Reviews.Content: The Berlin Circus hotel provided a service beyond my expectation. From before I arrived (speedy replies to emails), to while I was getting there (my flight was delayed and they helped with re-arranging my airport transfer) to during my stay (staff were helpful, food was great, service was top notch). Its located about 30 minutes away from Berlin Schoenfeld. The receptionist even helped with calling a cab for me when I departed and helped me fix my luggage which broke. Very conveniently located for a solo traveller. The Brewers Berlin tours pick people up from the hotel reception. It is centrally located. You can borrow laptops for free and use the hotels free wifi. Rooms are quiet at night and very clean. i would recommend the Circus Hotel for any type of traveller arriving in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “The best big-city boutique in the world?”
Reviews.Author: jcbluk
Reviews.Content: We were a couple staying four nights as part of a wider trip around Europe. I prefer independent hotels to chains and use them wherever I can, but this place is in a different class. Room: Our 100 euro small suite was spacious, stylish and very comfortable, facing onto a quiet courtyard (which I asked for having read other reviews). There was no minibar; no attempt to sell bathrobes, or CDs; or any other rubbish: just a really well-appointed room, thoughtfully laid out room with radio/iPod dock and a decent kettle. A great touch was the 'magazine' with both hotel amenities and a guide to current events in the city. This had far more time and thought put into it, and was more useful, than anything else I'd seen. Location - in the middle of trendy Mitte, on top of a U-Bahn station and walkable in 10 mins to the S-Bahn. I think most tourists would prefer to be on this side of the city: sightseeing west of Tiergarten is quite limited apart from places easily reached by S-Bahn. Staff & amenities - this is where Circus is a bit different. There is a more informal mood between guests and staff really works. Staff are polite, extremely helpful and very pleasant without the stiff 'yes sir, no sir' that is sometimes regarded as 'good service' whilst being completely insincere. The place feels relaxed and welcoming in a way that a few comfy sofas and a bit of jazz can't generate. We don't normally eat in hotels any more than we've paid for as part of the room, but chose to eat both breakfast and (on one night) dinner here. Food was excellent. But it's the little touches like the laptop loan that make this feel like a home away from home. The organisation started with the hostel across the road and seem to have adopted the best of hostel ethos to a hotel setting. Downsides: we were able to get a decent breeze through our room so weren't bothered by the lack of air-conditioning, but others may be. Also, if you like staff in gold braid and someone to come in at 7pm to put a choccy on the pillow, look elsewhere. It's not that kind of place Otherwise this place has it sussed; if everywhere had a 'Circus', there'd be more happy travelers in the world.

Reviews.Title: “The best place we stayed in Europe!”
Reviews.Author: BexfromOz
Reviews.Content: We originally only planned to stay in this hotel for 3 nights of our 7 nights in Berlin. However after the first night we cancelled our other hotel and we extended our stay at the Circus Hotel. It was clean and comfortable. The staff speak several different languages and will always go above and beyond to help! They were the most helpful that we have had in our tour of Europe. They helped us with maps, public transport, even down to hiring out laptops so we could check our accounts and update the facebooks, free of charge! The rooms are spacious, clean and most of all comfortable! Our room was a little noisy, from the tram line and traffic, but it just added to the lovely atmosphere that was Berlin! We also LOVED the potato soup served by room service. It was just a shame that the chef wouldn’t give me the recipe! Will come back and stay next time we are in Berlin, and there will be a next time!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, Spain
Reviews.Title: “Super”
Reviews.Author: trotamundosj
Reviews.Content: The staff is very nice and helpfull, the location is great (you can walk to many points of interest, and there is an underground stop just there), the rooms are spacious, super clean and nicely decorated. It is not super cheap but the price is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: adamdamme
Reviews.Content: i found here from my guide book. I am very happy that i stayed at this hotel. One think that i did not like, it is forbidden to bring food or beverages to your room. The rest was perfect. I wish i will come back for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very Cool Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GusM
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights at the Circus and it was awesome. This is one of the coolest hotels I have stayed at. Staff was excellent and extremely helpful with on every question we had. The additional services are great. We were able to get transit passes for E4.50/day, as opposed to E6. We had a junior suite, which faced the courtyard. It was more like a full-on suite. Huge. Great bathroom. Only issues, as previously mentioned by other reviewers, was that with people on the patio and the windows open, you could hear the activity. The hotel is close to laundromat, restaurants ( Fleischerei for currywurst) transport and walking distance to the commercial area at Hackesches Hof area. A great place to stay in one of the cooler parts of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Browns16
Reviews.Content: Very friendly, good location, all-round excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth staying here!”
Reviews.Author: daysiees
Reviews.Content: CIrcus Hotel is great -- centrally located, helpful staff, awesome vibe and a great place to socialize (but not annoyingly too rowdy). I'm 29 and I felt a little too old for the hostel (we checked it out when we got our bikes that they rent out there). The Hotel is perfect though -- fun bar but also a sense of culture. The breakfast had an array of authentic food... really enjoyed opening the large windows and having coffee in the cafe area. Would definitely stay here again! TIP: Check out the rooftop Terrace. We discovered it our last night... er, morning that we rolled in from experiencing the night life of Berlin. I wish I knew of it before then... It's got great views!

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time here!”
Reviews.Author: Paddy17BustoArsizio
Reviews.Content: We had a great time here and I will stay again! The bathroom and room were very bright. The bathroom was very large; they gave us organic products for body care. For breakfast we could choose a rich buffet for 8 €, including lots of fruits, homemade yogurt, various types of muesli, almonds, hazelnuts, juice and tea... Saturday night they organized a jazz night and we had a great time. Tthe staff is young and friendly. They picked us up at the airport at a good price. I felt at home!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at the Circus”
Reviews.Author: oddjob16
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Circus Hotel and as always there was nothing to point your finger at. The hotel is perfectly located close to the U-bahn at Rosenthaler Platz and you can easily reach every location in Berlin within no-time. The friendly staff is always welcoming and very serviceminded. Isabella in the reception remembered us from our last stay, which I find impressive. Rooms are spacious and the breakfast buffet is perfect. We will soon be back.

Reviews.Title: “The ideal base for exploring Berlin”
Reviews.Author: peter_wilde
Reviews.Content: We had four nights in this friendly, modern and helpful hotel. It is modern in both design and in attitude. The young independent management team has a welcoming philosophy and nothing was too much trouble. The lobby has an open plan restaurant that looks across to the bar and the open doors to the street (on warm days). There is also a nice quiet inner courtyard ideal for a relaxing coffee or drink. You can get a meal or drink any time and the English speaking staff had lots of suggestions for travel and activities. Our room was modern and functional with a very nice shower room en suite (it did overlook the main street so you had to keep the window closed to reduce the traffic noise). The Rosenthaler Platz underground station is directly outside the hotel and there are trams and busses everywhere. No problem with getting around! The position is, though, close enough to walk into the centre of the city if you enjoy doing your city breaks on foot. We loved it and will go there again next time we visit Berlin. Well done Circus team! Peter W

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for a great price!!!”
Reviews.Author: CalM04
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our time at the Circus Hotel, the room was very clean and also quite a good size. The staff were very helpful with all our site seeing questions and made us feel very welcome. Would most definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeTirebiter
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and great value. Booked a two-bedroom "apartment" that was larger than their website indicated - decent kitchen and living area, two bathrooms, and two large bedrooms. Rooms were clean, comfortable, and stylishly decorated; especially liked the framed portrait of Miss Piggy above one of the beds. Staff very friendly and helpful, and the hotel provided a permit that allowed us to park on the street for a couple of days. (A hotel staff member was even nice enough to come out with us to make sure we weren't missing any signs that would result in the car being ticketed or towed.)
