Very convenient location; right above a U-Bahn (subway) station and an easy walk to the major tourist sites.

Reviews.Title: “Spot On”
Reviews.Author: Plymouthbomb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few months ago for a friends birthday so about time I wrote a review. Have to say this hotel manages to get it right. A combination of welcoming, friendly and knowledgeable staff, rooms which are contemporary but comfortable and at a decent price mean it deserves its ranking on trip advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Might be an excellent option”
Reviews.Author: QuicaP
Reviews.Content: The hotel is cool. The staff is great. The Fabisch restaurant is marvellous. The location is very good, some 3 metres to the Rosenthaler Platz station. The bed is really comfortable and as we got a superior room we did have a lot of space. The only inconvenient is that there's no air conditioning in the rooms. The Circus proud itself for being a green hotel, but at least in the summer season they should consider offering those portable air conditioning machines to their guests who asks for it. They could pay an extra ammount and the money could be given to a nice project involving water or trees, or something like that. Berlin is warm in the summer and as I needed to open the windows I had another situation: the noisy coming from the restaurant yard from around 7AM, every day. Anyway, our overall experience there was great, and if air conditioning isn't a must for you, don't hesitate: at the Circus you'll feel really welcome!

Reviews.Title: “They've got it 100% right!”
Reviews.Author: Stupewbarny
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Circus for four nights.we were given a warm welcome and were immediately given a map and information about the local area.the managers are very relaxed and friendly, nothing was too much trouble for them or the staff in the hotel bar.the room was spotless and beds very comfortable. Bathroom very modern and nice shower.our room was at the back of the hotel which made it very quiet-we both slept very well! The hotel is perfectly situated and only 30min journey in total from Shoenfeld airport.the decor and furnishings are very trendy and modern,the cafe/bar has comfy chairs and a very chilled atmosphere.would suggest that breakfast at the hostel over the road is cheaper and very good! Lots of different breakfast options! Air con in the room would have been nice though the windows were large and we had a nice fan.perhaps towels could be larger? Other than that-no complaints-would recommend anyone to stay here-fantastic place! If you are over the age of 25 the hotel is better than the hostel which was full of noisy student types so this one is better suited to couples and older people! Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best for service, room quality and price.”
Reviews.Author: dipperette
Reviews.Content: Stayed here due to recommendations. It is excellent. The rooms are trendy and comfortable. Everything we ate from the restaurant tasted good. Breakfast was great especially the bircher muesli . Highly recommended. The only slight problem was the few wierdos hanging around the train station. Ask for a quiet room with windows that open.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Room Service!! Entertainment should be enhanced..”
Reviews.Author: Sarah21ny
Reviews.Content: Room were big and clean. They have an excellent room service. Each time we called to the room service, room boy turned up in a very quick time. Sometimes, I felt that they are standing outside our room, waiting for our call to frontdesk, Lolz. Modern look and feel. There is a small kitchen with cutlery. Bathrooms are equipped with everything required. Beds were amazingly comfertable and curtains on windows were very beautiful. On entertainment part they should have something more than a TV in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Lived Up to Its Reputation”
Reviews.Author: FloridaState
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Circus Hotel because of its good reviews and it lived up to them. We stayed in a junior suite and it was roomy and comfortable. It is nice to be able to move around in the bathroom and it also has a spacious shower. All of the staff were quite friendly. Keima was extremely helpful. He answered every question we had enthusiastically. He certainly made our stay much nicer. I would recommend staying here to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back to stay here in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: ply_singapore
Reviews.Content: The location was great as there is a U-Bahn station just downstairs and it was easy to get to the Mitte area. The hotel and the hostel are located in an area with tons of shops and cafes with loads of character; it took us a day and a half to explore and it wasn't enough! Service is fantastic - there are laptops to borrow with free wifi throughout the hotel, guidebooks in various languages to help you with your trip, weekly jazz and yoga sessions organized by the hotel. The hotel is also about being environmentally friendly which I give the thumbs-up! A definite stay and it was one of the highlights of my Berlin trip!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: Aetopetra
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Circus Hotel, Berlin, for one night in June 11. It was absolutely perfect! The room fabulous with modern design but very friendly to the guest, the personnel very kind and the cafe - restaurant ideal too. I totally recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Everyone was so accommodating......”
Reviews.Author: virginia2555
Reviews.Content: Just returned from six nights at the Circus Hotel. My husband and I stayed in a double room for 90 euros a night. The room was spacious, clean, bright. Bathroom was great. Bed was very comfortable. Nothing to complain about. The best part of the stay was the staff and their ability to help us in any and all of our needs. We felt so welcomed. The people at the hotel could could not have been more accommodating. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Happy to return yet again.”
Reviews.Author: MonkeybearNYC
Reviews.Content: We were very happy to return to the Circus, this time choosing one of the larger doubles, worth the extra ten Euros. As always, service was terrific, the room and bath well appointed and comfortable, breakfast at Fabisch (downstairs) delicious, and the neighborhood alive and rocking. Don’t neglect the history of the building and the neighborhood, sensitively told by the Circus folks (in their magazine, in a small exhibit downstairs, and on line): Fabisch is named after the Jewish family whose store once stood on the corner. Two notes of caution: no air-conditioning (though a strong-blowing standing fan is provided), and Rosenthaler Platz is noisy (bring earplugs). We love the Circus and will continue to stay here every time we come to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel we were always looking for!”
Reviews.Author: Miguelito1975
Reviews.Content: Located in the middle of Berlin, outstanding service-orientation at the reception, nice and tasteful restaurant (breakfast and other meals) cosy and clean rooms, wonderful philosophy - just perfect! The hotel we were always looking for - and a hotel we wish to also find in other cities.

Reviews.Title: “One of the friendliest hotels I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Penelope5L
Reviews.Content: The visit did not start off well as we thought we had booked a two bedroom apartment and we had only a double bed. Since there were no other rooms available we had to use the sofa bed which was not ideal but was okay. This experience could have put us in a negative frame of mind, but that was soon overcome by the friendliness and helpful attitude of the staff. They answered our questions and made suggestions and were always inbterested in what we had done and whether we had had a good time. I have recommended the hotel to friends and would use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Central and modern”
Reviews.Author: theyallexist
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in May. Circus certainly lived upto the favourable reviews we read on tripadvisor. It was clean, the staff helpful, the food nice and the wifi fast!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: mraan_2001
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Circus Hotel for 3 nights in June 2011 and really enjoyed our stay. The location is great (walkable from the Hauptbahnhof in one direction and central for the Museums and sights in the other). The staff were excellent, and happy to help with any questions we had, and the room was great. Little touches like walking tour maps, Ipods with pre-loaded itineraries and discounted travel cards made a big difference. We also had two meals in the restaurant, Fabisch, which were exceptional. Only slight negative is that there is no AC, so if you're in a room which gets afternoon sun bear this in mind. There is a fan in the room but it still got hot at night which migh be a bit uncivilised in July/August.

Reviews.Title: “frantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: owainh
Reviews.Content: loved this hotel,staff are extremely friendly, rooms are very clean. would definetly return. berlin is a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely brilliant all round”
Reviews.Author: Saph_80
Reviews.Content: Myself & my partner stayed here for 4 days in May & we've just booked to go back again. The hotel is brilliant, really modern designs, lovely rooms, some of the friendliest staff ive ever come across who are more than happy to help with getting you around the city. Perfect location, walking distance to main platz & right beside an underground station too. The bar staff were nice enough to let us sample the local beers so we knew what to ask for when we went out, and free use of internet too. Cannot recommend this hotel enough!! Brilliant bar across the street too called Mein Haus am See, and definately try Back Factory across the street for every pastry imaginable!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: ichristiani
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after the rave reviews on Tripadvisor. First advice: book way in advance. I tried to rent a room for a weekend getaway in March and they were fully booked till June! We arrived by car. That's a first con: the hotel has no parking and there is no parking garage anywhere near the hotel! You're allowed to park in the streets but you have to use annoying coin machines which take forever and per day you're paying around 30 euro. So, it's not cheap. Besides that, you are obliged to buy some stupid green sticker (around 13 euro) because the hotel is located in the city's "green" zone. We were told back home that you could buy the sticker at any gas station. That's not true! And neither in the city itself could we find the damn thing. We decided to give up. Thankfully we weren't fined, but I wouldn't advise trying the same. It could leave you 40 euro poorer. The hotel has resident car permits for guests, so you don't have to pay. But we weren't told that so upon arrival the permits were all taken. I was kinda bummed about that since we booked so far in advance! Fortunately the next day one was available. So: if you're coming by car: buy the green sticker in advance and reserve the permit! We booked the 2 room apartment (apartment 3). We loved how big it was. The bathroom was bigger than ours at home :) We also loved the kitchen. Everything was provided. It even has a little dishwasher! Another pro was how clean everything was, absolutely spotless. Unfortunately there's also some cons: it was bloody hot (30 degrees Celsius) and the room has no air conditioning and is situated on the top floor under a flat roof. It was way too hot at night. We were forced to keep the windows open. The hotel is situated on a busy crossing of two big streets, so we had a lot of noise come into the room, especially of the trams and cars. Besides that, the bed is from Ikea, is a queen size and has a hard, uncomfortable mattress. Due to all of this, we didn't sleep comfortable. Another con was the location. As I already mentioned, it is located at a very busy crossing. However, it is not located as central as I expected in advance. Alexanderplatz and Unter den Linden are around 15 to 20 minutes walking. There is a subway station next door, but you have to transfer at least once to get to all the main tourist attractions. After three days of exploring the city, we got tired of all the subway stopovers. After weighing the pros to the cons, I'm not sure if I would book the hotel again. You'll never find another 2 room apartment for this money (110 euro a night) but at the other hand I'd rather have just one room with a big, comfy bed and aircon. it depends on your preferences whether or not this hotel is gonna please you...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: TJBrooke
Reviews.Content: Whilst we've been to other cities in Germany this was our first trip to Berlin. We wanted a hotel close to the main attractions, quiet on an evening and within budget (£70 ish) - The Circus Hotel ticks all these boxes. If you email the hotel they are very efficient and usually get back to you very quickly. The hotel is situated on a busy junction therefore it's worth asking for a room facing the inner courtyard which is quieter. There is no air conditioning but fans are provided in the rooms. All the staff speak perfect english and the reception is staffed 24hours. The standard rooms are very modern in design and have everything you could require. If anything is missing the hotel offers a loan service which includes kettles, ironing boards, mobile phone etc In the lobby there is a lounge area, bar and restaurant with seating both inside and out. The whole atmosphere is very relaxed and in the lounge there are lots of books to read / flick through, there is a computer and printer and even a iPad so you can research what you want to do. There is also free wifi throughout the hotel. If you need any advice the staff are always happy to help. If you travel to the hotel from Schönefeld airport it is well worth downloading the video guide on the hotel website on to your iPad or iPhone. This step by step video is fantastic and got us to the door (watch it as you travel). Breakfast - the hotel offers a buffet breakfast for €8 each which is well worth it and is served until 1pm (so relax...) The tube is right outside the door and the staff can help you with any question you might have. They can also sell you day tickets for the hop-on / hop-off bus which is a great way to see the sights. All in all a great hotel. It is functional, clean, comfortable, well managed and well run and the hotel has a great philosophy of trying to be as sustainable as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Just loved!”
Reviews.Author: AnaCarolB
Reviews.Content: Me and My husband stayed for 3 nights at Circus on my birthday and it was veryyy nice. We are opened mind people and We are always looking for modern and special places to stay when travelling, but affordable ones, and This place is perfect. Loved the interior architecture, the staff were very kind and the restaurant Fabisch is very good too. Humm.. the barbecue was delicious. The only thing I would say is: Ask for a upper room and facing the backyard! The front ones are too noisy. They gave us one on the 1st floor and I asked to change.;-)

Reviews.Title: “Why have so many people rated this hotel so highly?”
Reviews.Author: DandCCanberra
Reviews.Content: There are many things to recommend this hotel but I am amazed by the ratings. It is a good hotel, very good location,with a very good breakfast but is far from excellent. We are very experienced travelers and keep our expectations low, but the Circus Hotel did not come close to meeting them. Be warned, the hotel is on the intersection of 4 main streets and there are high traffic flows. It isn't air-conditioned so if you open a window it is very noisy, day and night. The staff were generally very good, except for the guy on reception on the first morning who couldn't find the metro travel cards and made it clear he couldn't bothered to look. The hotel should be embarrassed by the condition of the bath towels-paper thin, small and worn out. It's a good hotel but it is far from excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews are all right... it's fantastic”
Reviews.Author: kismet1808
Reviews.Content: I've booked this room months ago, and confirmed by the great reviews here, it was the best decision.. The hotel is fantastic, the staff super friendly and very outgoing. We had a room on the 4th floor towards the courtyard, it was very warm and we even had to turn on the vent, we had the window open and you could here the people sitting outside in the courtyard. The room was to my own surprise quite spacious and the bathroom was great- big shower and nicely cut. There is free WLAN, and the took once the breakfast for 8 EUR (included free coffee and 1 glas of either apple or orange juice) - breakfast was very nice and reasonable for the price. But especially in this area there are a lot of locations to grab breakfast - we can recommend "anne blume" is about a 20 min walk. The location of the hotel is great, within walking distance from the alexander platz (about 15 min) and the Haeckesche Hoefe. Overall a very good value and a fun hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring Berlin”
Reviews.Author: cedartrail
Reviews.Content: Berlin is big and the location of this hotel makes getting around manageable due to the S-bahn access point just out the front door. The hotel itself is very nicely appointed with good sized rooms and convenient lift access. The staff was friendly, considerate and most helpful. The adjacent Fabisch restaurant serves up a good breakfast and the dinners were also excellent. This was our first trip to Berlin so we did a walking tour with the company recommended by the hotel. Matt, our guide, was very good at his job, providing great insight and perspective during the full day tour.

Reviews.Title: “super hotel”
Reviews.Author: mondovino
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at that hotel in Berlin unlike most other experiences in Berlin. It has a very refreshing style. The room is tiny, but the bathroom has a good size and is absolutely astonishing. The breakfast was the next highlight. Everything was super-tasty and freshly prepared. There even was home-made Bircher-Müsli. Overall, I do love this hotel and look forward to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Niiiiice!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kaori16
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, with the nicest staff that will assist you in everything! The hotel has a "green" speech, reason why we haven't found even bath towels in the room, but all you have to do is ask for it ;)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location, excellent restaurant but get a quiet room”
Reviews.Author: WrightmanLondon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Circus Hotel for 3 nights in May 2011. We had a double room which had all the modern conveniences and was clean and comfortable. We especially liked the bathroom because it had a great shower. I would have liked to have a kettle in the room, as I enjoy morning teas in bed during holiday, but hey, the rest of the room was great! Staff was really friendly and helpful with directions, and the location was convenient to everything we wanted to see. There were good restaurants and bars within close walking distances as well, and some of them were recommended by the staff, which we appreciated. The restaurant on site was excellent - we had breakfasts there every morning and it was all very fresh and organic. The dinner we had there once was good as well, a bit pricey but not absurdly so. They also had some desserts that we tried, which we enjoyed. I would stay at the Circus again, but I would request to face away from the street, as it was very noisy at night to be on such a busy road. The nights we were there were quite warm, and we couldn't sleep with the windows open. I would make sure we could face the garden if we went again.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: OutiOm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Circus Hotel in May 2011 for four nights and enjoyed every night. We had the economy double room which was 80 euros per night. The room was spacious enough, the bathroom was lovely (I especially loved the shower!), the decor was quirky and cool. I didn't like the pillows but that's the way they usually are in central Europe, the beds were comfy though. Our room faced the street which was pretty active but it didn't bother us. There's a chinese and kebap fast food stands downstairs and their smell can bother some guests if sleeping their windows open. The breakfast buffet was 8 euros per person and included unlimited coffee or tea, one glass of juice, bread, fresh fruits, all sorts of muesli, cold cuts, boiled eggs, yoghurt, cheeses, croissants and so on. The restaurant that served the breakfast called Fabisch was very pleasant especially in the evening. There were live music two nights out of five. They serve classic cocktails that are pricey (about 8 euros) when you compare them to the other places for example in Mitte but in my experience they were also better. The food in the restaurant was good too even though they didn't have the meat my boyfriend wanted that was on the menu. I really like the concept that they use seasonal, regional and organic produce whenever possible. The staff was very helpful and always friendly, they were talkative and their knowledge of Berlin was great. There are laptops, movies and guidebooks you can borrow from the 24-hour reception, as well as a whole lot of other things you might need. There were also an iPad free for people to use in the restaurant which was a fun idea. The room service is also free of charge. I liked the ambience, the cleanliness, the decor and the restaurant best. The pillow is my only minor complaint. I will be back in Circus when I get a chance!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, Excellent location & staff”
Reviews.Author: EatBeast
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after friend's recommendation. We got the apartment, which was probably too big for 2 people. But nevertheless, it was excellent. It was 2 floors and we had a kitchen, living area which doubled as second bed. The upstairs room was like a mezzanine which was spacious and light. The decor wasn't posh but I think it was the hotel's policy to be environmentally friendly and well-priced. The 8 Euros buffet breakfast was beautiful. Good German fare and yummy. Hotel was located in Mitte Scheunenviertel, which is perfect location for me, as close to trendy bars and restaurants, shopping district, and was a very safe, clean suburb. You are also next to the U-bahn, so easy access to transport, and walking distance to another trendy suburb, Prenzlauer Berg. In fact, if you are keen, you can pretty much walk to all the surrounding suburbs like Kreuzberg, Friedrichshain & rest of Mitte..which was what I did. Make sure you walk down nearby side streets of Auguststrasse, Alte Schonhause, Linienstrasse, Rosa-Luxenburgstrasse for local cafe life and interesting graffiti. Staff were generally very helpful, friendly & approachable.

Reviews.Title: “Best place I ever stayed !”
Reviews.Author: Derekmillen
Reviews.Content: Went for surprise 40th birthday . Hotel staff friendly , rooms amazing great little touches . We stayed in room 315 , this was massive . Perfect location . Will definitely go back .

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good price, good service”
Reviews.Author: beenaroundLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in May in a good sized room (called "junior suite" but not really a suite) for 100 Euros a night. Breakfast was good and good value at another 8E a head. The hotel's restaurant has good food and excellent wines, again very reasonably priced. The location is central and the UBahn outside the door. The people are helpful and pleasant. There's internet access at reception if you don't have your laptop. It's really very good. So is it perfect? Depends on when you are there, but if there's a heatwave you need to be a deep sleeper as your room will either be on the street or face the inner courtyard, where people sit outside and their noise reverberates. Or you can keep your windows shut. Unfortunately the Circus has bought into the German mania for Umweltfreundlichkeit and there's no air-con and last week I saw the temperature in Berlin was in the 80s. So go when the weather is cool

Reviews.Title: “Need I say more? The best hotel we have stayed in Europe!”
Reviews.Author: prechiel
Reviews.Content: We were on our third leg of our European trip, and I was a feeling a bit homesick already. But when we stepped inside Circus Hotel, the warm reception washed my homesickness away...They were so welcoming and warm. They took time to talk to you and orient you with the Hotel and help you out getting around Berlin. Service is great! The took care of our luggages and made sure it's already in our room when we checked in. Everything is perfect. Location is a plus. A few steps and you're in Rosenplatz staiton. Perfect, perfect stay. Keep it up Circus Hotel! I'll definitely stay here again when I get back to Berlin. More power!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are true”
Reviews.Author: apciatto
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. It is so clean and the decor is so nice. The staff is wonderful and the breakfasts are fabulous. Great central location. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic staff, nice food, great location, almost perfect.”
Reviews.Author: e6kirkby
Reviews.Content: We could only get in for one night in an apartment. It was extremely well furnished and very comfortable. The food was great and we spent a very pleasant evening having a few beers and people watching through the large patio door that opened onto the street. The only downside for me was that due to the hotels green policy there was no air conditioning. This led to me having a very uncomfortable nights sleep, the room was hot and stuffy. The street below is very noisy so I couldn`t have the window open. Reading other reviews here I`ve only just found out I could have asked for a fan. Apart from that one thing I`d go back again and can thoroughly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Circus Hotel - Take a Bow!”
Reviews.Author: taff37
Reviews.Content: On our fourth visit to Berlin it was our pleasure to spend three nights at the Circus Hotel. If you like corporate, formal hotels - this is not for you. The Hotel is cool, vibrant, eco-friendly, good value & unique - with young staff who go the extra mile - and more. We stayed in a Superior Double to the rear of the Hotel. Beds were comfy, shower facilities A1 and the room uniqely decorated. The Fabisch restaurant & bar, within the Hotel, was a terrific venue for both guests & passing trade. We took breakfast in the Fabisch, ate a traditional German meal in the Fabisch & listened to a delightful Aussie folk singer, Coby Grant in the bar. The windows in the Bar are opened up onto the Street in warm weather giving it a cool, cafe bar style. The young Circus Hotel staff are unbelievable. They provide 24 hour reception, are courteous and helpful & provide the best 'tourist/location' advice ever, If they cannot help - they provide you with a free PC or netbook so that you can use their wi-fi to do your own research. During our stay there were guests from around the globe - all seemed chilled, relaxed and very appreciative of their surroundings and the customer service. If you like 'different' and go to a hotel to enjoy yourself - 'go to the Circus'.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was just so cool - as was Berlin”
Reviews.Author: RockChickX51
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are 26 and 28 and love to travel. We're both very unique people who like different things. When we came to book a hotel for Berlin, this one looked to fit the bill perfectly. We try to stay away from main chains when we travel. This hotel is just awesome, from the time we booked until the time we left. We started this booking 3 months before we left. We stayed 6 nights in a standard deluxe room, but left at midnight on the 6th night to catch a train to Amsterdam. I asked the hotel to switch to a single room on the last night to save money and they said "Nonsense, stay in your double room and you can just pay the single rate since you're not staying the entire night anyway." The place is ran with common sense and courtesy. We arrived to a bright, quirky, clean hotel. The front desk staff was awesome and spoke very good English. I forgot soap and shampoo and they gave me some of the hotels but also pointed out on a map where the nearest drugstore was. The hallways are dark with funky lights. The artwork and furniture were so different and just added to the uniqueness of the hotel. Our room was spotless and awesome. It was kept clean the entire time we were there. We had a street view on the 4th floor (actually 5th). The noise from the street didn't bother us but if you sleep with the windows up the trams can get kind of loud, but not so loud that you can't sleep. We asked for a fan on our 2nd night for "white noise" in the room and it was brought immediately by the staff. The bathroom was awesome with a rain head shower. Location is AWESOME right by the U-Bahn, S-Bahn stops with a taxi stand right outside as well. There is a little "convenient" type store in front of the hotel as well as a late night Chinese/pizza place. Loads of bars and restaurants right in the area. Brewers Berlin tours picked right up from the hotel. Let me suggest the Third Reich tour with them. It was great. We did go down for the breakfast buffet one morning and it was great, my husband loved it. The early morning courtyard setting was nice to eat in. The bar next door is a little pricey and the crowd a little older but it was nice. We preferred the bars down the road (Kaffee Burger and White Trash Fast Food). Free Wi-Fi throughout was also a PLUS!!! My husband is already talking about staying here again on our next trip and staying in one of the apartments. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: Lizteag
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, good location the wifi didn't work in our room but not a big deal and stay away from the hot chocolate! But breakfast was good and rooms quite nice

Reviews.Title: “A real gem in Berlin....definately stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Fimacca
Reviews.Content: Went to Berlin with 5 other girls for a long weekend, stayed at the hotel after a recommendation, we were not disappointed. We stayed in the 4 bed apartment and a 2 bed room. Apartment was fab, plenty of space, new , nicely decorated and had a photo of Miss Piggy on the wall! Also went on the walking tour ran from the hotel which was brilliant, saw all the sights and learn alot about the history The staff were always friendly when ever we asked anything also Fab stay and loved Berlin!!!

Reviews.Title: “Book the Circus now!”
Reviews.Author: barbielab
Reviews.Content: Your search for the perfect Berlin hotel should stop right here, right now. Book the Circus Hotel, you will not regret it. Clean comfy rooms; helpful knowledgeable staff; welcoming bar and resturant; and, convenient location. Seriously book it now!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great value”
Reviews.Author: Dave1111
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in a double room facing the courtyard. The room wasn't large but it was comfortable and the bathroom was nicely done with a tempered-glass enclosed shower and nice fixtures. For the price, the location and accomodations provided a great value. The staff, however, put it over the top. Everyone we dealt with was very helpful, and the folks out front were always pleasant and friendly, ready to help however they could. We dealt with Alice and Yorgos mostly, based on our comings and goings, and we wanted to mention them specifically -- thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Miizstyles
Reviews.Content: All I have to say about this hotel is AMAZING. We were very satisfied with everything this hotel had to offer. The staff was just incredible. Very friendly, always eager to help and always smiling. Breakfast was great with everything you can think of. Rooms were nicely designed, spotless cleaned and incredibly comfortable especially after long days of walking. We enjoyed our drinks in their lovely lounge area.

Reviews.Title: “worth it”
Reviews.Author: NorthernEurope
Reviews.Content: Nice and cheap. Most of the personnel were very friendly. I didn´t mind that they forgot to empty all the garbage one day, that the room decor was most suited for a ten year old, being served withering veges for breakfast (dinner veges were fresh), that the breakfast voucher system was ridiculous as they forgot who had given them and asked several times, that the OJ I was served obviously came from a bottle behind the counter, that the elevator was out of order, the time of "the best bread in the world" is definitely vorbei, plus some other small things. I enjoyed my stay, slept well, didn´t complain about anything, and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant, great location and lovely staff.”
Reviews.Author: Jostalbans
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely time here, would definitely come back. One tip would be to get a room facing the courtyard as the road is a bit noisy but that was my one and only (tiny) complaint. Staff were lovely and the room was fantastic. Highly recommend this hotel, I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Location, Staff, Customer Service, Interior Design... A+”
Reviews.Author: N_and_C_Travels
Reviews.Content: We agree with previous positive reviews about this funky conveniently located hotel - it is set up ideally for tourists with a great custormer service ethos and proved a great base for our stay in Berlin. Our highlights of the hotel were: * The vibrant cool room decor - so different from most European hotels - the bed in our pink 'pop art' themed room was comfortable with a great shower and smart bathroom * Discounted metro tickets - the hotel will rent you monthly travel passes at a daily rate (4.50 euros instead of 6.20) which is so useful - ask for them as soon as you arrive as demand can exceed supply! * the very helpful staff, all of whom spoke extremely good English * the breakfast - for 8 euros there is a big choice of healthy organic muselis, breads, yoghurt, fruit, jams, croissants, meats, cheeses etc plus unlimited tea or coffee - really sets you up for the day * the free wi-fi and library of guide books were very handy - we didn't make use of the laptop/iPod loans but why don't more hotels offer services like this? * on checking out, reception offered us a choice of being billed in pounds stirling or euros - saving us a bit of money on the current poor exchange rate plus the standard credit card conversion charge. A very nice touch! * the hotel has lovely common areas - courtyard, dining room and reception area are pleasant and unstuffy areas to hang out. We also liked the way they had given some history of the building, memorializing the previous owner (a holocaust victim) There were a couple of negatives - far outweighed by the many positives but worth noting nonetheless: * we booked an economy room (which did not feel 'economy' at all, it was lovely - see comments above) - however it did face the street and there was tram and traffic noise through the night. We were zonked out after busy days of sightseeing so it didn't bother us unduly, but if you're a light sleeper avoid these cheapest rooms or take ear plugs! * a tiny point about the otherwise great buffet breakfast: included with the unlimited food, tea and coffee was 1 very small glass of fruit juice. It was freshly squeezed but it would be nice if other fresh juice was available as well or they could have at least made the glass they serve you a bigger one. * While the shower gel and moisturizer (which you help yourself to at reception as needed) was very nice the organic shampoo was a bit weird - bring your own! We really enjoyed staying at the Circus - it is terrific value, ideally set up for tourists, right on top of the metro and simply a fun place to stay - we would definitely return! One of the best European hotels we have ever stayed in - Highly Recommend

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Laura10928
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Circus hotel for 3 nights and really enjoyed our stay. we opted for a junior suite as there were no double rooms available when we booked. The room was nice and spacious - modern decor and very bright with 3 big windows. We faced out onto the courtyard so didn't have any traffic noise although the windows seemed to be double glazed so I doubt it would be an issue. The only very minor thing that I found was that they decided to rake the gravel in the courtyard at 8am one morning which made quite a lot of noise and woke us up! We had the windows open as it was quite warm so it was pretty noisy for that time of the morning. Maybe something they'd be better doing in the middle of the day... But a very minor complaint about a very nice hotel! The hotel has a green policy and so doesn't have a fridge/minibar in the room or air conditioning - you can open the windows instead. For drinks they let you order from the bar without charging any room service charges which we thought was a really good idea. They also do a really nice breakfast which is available til 1pm - much better than most places where you're expected to be finished breakfast by 10.30am. Having had breakfast in a nice cafe nearby, we found that the hotel breakfast was very reasonable (€8 for coffee, juice and a choice of cereals, yoghurt, fruit, breads, meats, cheeses etc) and we ate there 2 out of our 3 days. We also found a really nice Asian tapas restaurant called Transit which is only a 2 minute walk from the hotel - it gets very good ratings on tripadvisor and they are well deserved. The staff in the hotel were all really friendly and helpful and spoke perfect English. We got a rundown of the services in the hotel when we checked in (free wifi, laptops which you can borrow etc) and felt that we could ask any questions we needed to. We really enjoyed our stay at the hotel and would definitely recommend it - we'll be staying there again the next time we're in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous: clean, friendly, relaxed and beautifully decorated”
Reviews.Author: MK_patti
Reviews.Content: My three friends and I booked 3 nights here and arrived late morning after a very early morning flight. To my delight we were allowed have breakfast at midday in the sunny courtyard, which was a large and delicious continental buffet. The hotel decor is modern and interesting and the rooms were spotless. The staff were friendly and very patient and nothing was too much trouble. Everything worked: windows, shower, simple to use safe in the room, lift to our fourth floor room... We also had a delicious meal here one evening. NOt to mention the perfect (in my opinion) hot chocolate! The location is also great, right next to U bahn and tram stops.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, stylish boutique hotel. Highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: kadge
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel in a great area. Lot's of lovely bars, restaurants and boutique shops nearby. Easy walk to most sights or access the underground. Restaurant, lounge area and staff are all excellent. Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Coolest Hotel in Europe”
Reviews.Author: LondonMackem83
Reviews.Content: A few friends and I stayed here for a stag party back in February. I have to say that the hotel exceeded our expectations and then some! This is the ideal hotel for young people - it's modern, clean, stylish and kitten out with all the latest gadgets, including a communal ipad in the bar. The rooms are impeccable with a very good wifi connection. The staff go out of their way to be helpful, whether your looking for advice on places to eat, daytime activities or night life. They also serve up some great cocktails and will happily shoot the breeze. If you get a chance - ask to take out the hotel's segways, so much fun. The hotel is definitely more suitable for young liberally minded people, if you' fit this category then don't hesitate to book.

Reviews.Title: “I am such a critical person but this place is perfect in every way.... Blown away”
Reviews.Author: jamesfromtassie
Reviews.Content: i am staying here right now, 2nd night of 3, i am always unsure of the accuracy of the reviews as I am sure lots of hoteliers write their own. I can assure you this place beats expectations. I arrived at 4am after a sleeper from amsterdam and a staff member spent nearly an hour with me planning out my next few days on the complementary map. The breakfast was 8 euros and was beautiful, ask fresh and organic, including soft boiled eggs, beautiful cheeses and meats, this amazing german yoghurt stuff called fruit quark and do it your self tea.... Something I've never seen before. The room was really nice, staff friendly, location perfect. This place also pulls off a trendy cocktail bar and restaurant. Easily the best hotel I've stayed at and I'm a gold frequent flyer. Book ahead, I only got a room here because I called the day before and there had just been a cancellation.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we have stayed in - ever!”
Reviews.Author: MattnJess
Reviews.Content: Although we visited this hotel in December, we are still raving about this hotel to our friends now in April! The staff working there could nto have been friendlier or more accomodating to needs. They welcomed us, provided great advice about local food/places to go and were generally happy to have a chat about anything and everything! Lending out netbooks, dvd players along with recommended German dvds, ipods was a great bonus for us. The food at the resaturant was delicious - from the perfectly cooked scrambled eggs at breakfast to the home-made soups and sandwiches at lunch plus the affordable dinners too. The rooms, restaurant area and corridors were decorated were really cool local artwork and stencils which fits in with East Berlin's ecclectic art scene. We paid an extra 10 euros or so to have a slightly bigger room and it was definitely worth it as the cheapest rooms are a little small for a longer break.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT!”
Reviews.Author: Patricia_Borges
Reviews.Content: EXCELLENT! I believe the word excellent sums it all! The staff was unbelievable helpful, the hotel restaurant was perfect – the food was excellent – great location. The hotel provided the guest with free notebooks (yes, you could take them to your room), city guides and free city tours. Plus, the restaurant has live music on Fridays and Sundays – when we were there we saw a jazz player from the States and a Brazilian singer, which was really cool. As such, I strongly advise this hotel. For the price, it doesn’t really get any better than that.

Reviews.Title: “Probably everything has already been said about this hotel - but....”
Reviews.Author: RuthEleanor
Reviews.Content: We are not the kind of people who look for luxury. Rather we look for quality represented in good service atmosphere and the special touches. Thats what you will find at the Circus Hotel. Despite the modern and sometimes unusual design, This hotel has a lovely warm and friendly atmosphere, Staff are extremely helpful and they try and think of everything that a traveller might want. Need the use of a laptop, they'll bring one to your room, need a reservation,,, they'll do it. Nothing is too much trouble. Attached to the lobby is a nice cafe/restaurant that doubles at breakfast, they also have a corner with a library and the use of ipods with head sets. I think there is room service at no extra charge In their brochure they mention their environmental/social awareness. Also impressed by their tribute to the family who owned the building but had been murdered in second world war. Here's the quirky part, as the hotel tries to be environmentally aware so take bottles of shampoo and shower gel as you need it from a shelf near reception. Each bedroom is individually designed. Our room was not that big and our room was on first floor facing a busy junction. We heard the traffic outside but not bad enough to disturb our sleep. Next time, I would ask for inner room or perhaps higher up. Only criticism was lack of cupboard space. Large shower - great!! Walking distance to Museum Island, underground station close by.

Reviews.Title: “The Circus Lives Up to It's Reputation”
Reviews.Author: Aurora100
Reviews.Content: I spent eight days in Berlin in April 2011, and chose the Circus based on the great reviews here on Trip Advisor. The Circus lived up to its billing, and I’m not sure how much more I can add that hasn’t been said already. As others have noted, this is not a luxury hotel. However, it does not feel like a “budget” hotel, although you will be paying a “budget” price. It was refreshing for me to stay in a non –chain hotel that did not cater to the business traveler and did not nickel and dime you for every little thing like the big chains typically do. The first thing to note about the Circus is that the location is great. The Rosenthaler Strasse location is in a vibrant neighborhood, with lots of interesting shops and restaurants everywhere you look. It also borders the very trendy Prenzlauer Berg neighborhood where there are lots more interesting shops and restaurants. The Circus has a U-Bahn stop right in front of it, and it is only about a 10 minute walk to the Hackescher Markt S-Bahn stop which is really handy for getting around town quickly and for making a day-trip to Potsdam. I felt that by staying at the Circus you really got to experience Berlin’s more unique neighborhoods and not just seeing the major attractions as most tourists do, without really getting to know the city in depth. The staff at the Circus were very friendly and helpful. Rooms were very comfortable but as others have noted, are on the small side (but with great showers). I had a standard double room. I was by myself; but if my husband had been with me I would have paid the extra 10 euro and gotten the junior suite just to have more room. While a standard double was fine for me, I was happy I did not get a single or Double Economy room. I did not eat in the hotel restaurant; as there were so many places in the neighborhood. I particularly recommend Monsieur Vong, Chen Che (right down the street on Rosenthaler) and Babel about five blocks up on Kastanienallee in Prenzlauer Berg. For breakfast, there is the Back Bakery chain, located across the street. Good selection of pastries, rolls, sandwiches and very reasonably priced. Another advantage of the Circus is the free Wi-Fi and a place to do laundry almost right across the street. The only negative thing I can say about the Circus is there is very poor lighting for reading at night, but I have found this to be true at many other hotels as well. To summarize, a great hotel in a great city! I hope to return to Berlin sooner rather than later and will stay at the Circus again! I only wish this hotel had other locations elsewhere in Europe!

Reviews.Title: “Little things add up to a great experience”
Reviews.Author: TomPattison
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spend four nights at the Circus hotel and were extremely impressed. I won't go into all the individual strong points which are written far more articulately by other reviewers but what stood out was how small details made for an enhanced experience. Little things like free apples on reception and getting a travel pass cheaper through the rent system made this a totally stress free stay. The only complaint would be the rooms can be quite stuffy as windows must be closed at night due to noise but that is a small price to pay for a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: klbterp
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the reviews from other guests I had to book with this hotel. The staff, food, atmosphere the whole experience was wonderful! My husband lived in Germany for many years and said this was the best hotel he has ever stayed at in Berlin. The only complaint I have is that they did not have us in the system. I was sitting in our room when I got the email that they were sorry we didn't make it??? It was a minor thing of course. We loved our room! The staff spoke beautiful English, recommended us to great places to eat and have drinks. Everything is in walking distance. In their elevator it has updated information going on in the hotel and surrounding areas regarding tours. We took one of the tours and it was GREAT! The breakfast is a must also!!! Book this hotel for your stay in Berlin!!! It's awesome!!!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: thewanderer2107
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel, fantastic staff, great location and lovely room! Best hotel I have ever stayed in!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cmgrhs
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Berlin, and we had booked The Circus based on the reviews on Tripadvisor. From the very first moment we walked in the door, till the moment we left, we were treated to the very best service. The staff were great, the room (101) was fantastic. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: helenandandrewLeeds
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my partners 30th birthday and were so impressed by the service and quality of the accomodation for the price. We arrived a few hours before check in time and after a very warm welcome we were able to go straight to our room. The hotel is located very centrally and we were able to walk to the Brandenburg gate, Oranienburg str(bars and restaurants), Friedricht Str. (main shopping) and many other sites. The rooms were very clean and comfortable and really good value for money. Would definately recommend staying here and hope to be back again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, even better than we had hoped for”
Reviews.Author: S1970
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel. We booked it on the strength of all the good reviews it had on here, and were not disappointed. We booked a junior suite, in which a small bed had been made up for our 3 year old. The room was quiet, spotless, spacious and very comfortable. There was plenty of room to park our buggy and store luggage. The shower was a massive hit with us all - our wee one loved standing 'in the rain'. We arrived having had a bit of a disaster - we'd left one of our bags on the train coming into Berlin - but Christopher on reception was so helpful and kind that we were put at ease immediately. As well as giving us toiletries he also contacted the train company for us. We ate in the hotel two nights, and the food, cocktails, beer and wine were fantastic. The only slight down side was that it can be a bit slow, but if you are in relaxed mode this really doesn't matter. The kids menu was perfect - we loved the idea of kids just getting a plate and fork to rob food from the adults. We also had breakfast in the hotel every morning - this is a steal, and great quality. Our three year old loved having bread and chocolate for breakfast, and was never charged for it. The location for families is brilliant. These is public transport on the door step, within 50 metres there is a play ground, and you can walk to the big attractions within minutes, past lots of funky shops. We were also able to borrow a baby monitor so that we could have a couple of drinks in the bar at night while our wee girl was asleep upstairs. The bar has a glass front, so you can just sit and watch the world go by. The hotel staff are really friendly and went out of their way to be helpful - they booked a table for us at a local italian for our last night, made a fuss of our wee girl, and were always keen to have a natter about your day. A real home from home.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Wonderful Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DaiWeiShi
Reviews.Content: This is a remarkable hotel on Rosenthaler Platz, U Bahn and S Bahn at your door steep, great restaurants walking distance in all directions, walking distance to Museum Island. The rooms are modern and clean, great shower, hotel has WiFi and will lend you a laptop to use, no charge....This was by far the best staff of any hotel I have stayed at my 50 odd years of traveling....nice restaurant attached to the hotel, wonderful for breakfast to stop relax and have a drink during the afternoon

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel in best location”
Reviews.Author: BTW45
Reviews.Content: Can't recommend this hotel highly enough. Staff really friendly, room very spacious and good value for money (we had a junior suite), bar great (live music on Fri & Sun). Location is excellent - there are loads of cool bars, restaurants and boutique clothes shops on the streets nearby and an underground station (rosenthaler platz) literally right outside the door. Overall just a really nice, friendly & relaxed place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: KatieBenjamin
Reviews.Content: Probably the most friendly and helpful staff I have ever encountered. They are out to make your stay and your experience in Berlin as pleasant as possible. The hotel is located directly next to a subway stop with bus stops easily accessible. There is an abundance of restaurants and nightlife, and the train station, airport and other attractions are just only minutes away by public transportation. During my next visit I will not even look for another hotel, it will be The Circus. Just fabulous! Cannot wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great again”
Reviews.Author: Trev_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a second, for 3 nights and it was just as good as the last time. The hotel is still spotless and very well maintained, staff are still as helpful and the breakfasts are still great (we go for the buffet). We love the location as well, right beside a U-Bahn station and lots of bars / resturants in the area. Will stay here again the next time we are in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Pefect for those who like "cozy"!”
Reviews.Author: halogrly
Reviews.Content: For those un-obese Americans, this is a great stay! It is in the heart of Berlin, very nice reception (I'm a girl and the lady receptionists were super hot! :) The rooms are small, as are all European budget stays, so either do your homework before griping. There was even adequate space to hold our two weeks of belongings as we were backpacking, and a friend from Netherlands came to stay and all three of us slept quite soundly in the bed. The breakfast is a deal for 8 euro, other places we stayed wanted to charge up to 23 for a much more mediocre breakfast! It had fresh fruits, tons of breads, several meats (mostly salami sorts), jams, cheeses, granolas, oatmeals and lots of other stuff for the price. Be sure to tip the waiter though! Even though its a buffet, they are always answering questions from travelers everthing from- "where is the coffee, and the way to get to "there"? They see you with a map and they will ask if you need help. Tip them! The place is cute and quaint - only for "large families - and I'm talking number and/or weight" you should request and pay for one of their larger rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Beauty is in details”
Reviews.Author: Spriwibowo
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. Simply cannot fault it. I really like the theme of the room and the organic breakfast. The staff are very helpful. The room fixtures are great.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: Viaggiatore31
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Berlin in February with my two friends and my 2 year old daughter. The Circus Hotel was the perfect choice. Great location, lots of lovely restaurants and shops nearby. Hotel itself is fantastic - decor is really funky with an individual design for each room. Spotlessly clean. Staff were really helpful. Food was great. Child friendly.Great value for money. A must if in Berlin. Couldnt recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT all around”
Reviews.Author: AdrianoCelentano
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite Hotel. Period. (but I have to write more as tripadvisor requires us to input at least 50 characters in the review). So, Fantastic, unique concept. Extremely friendly and helpful hosts. Cool atmosphere. Great Café/Resto. Great Europen organic breakfast. Extremely friendly and helpful hosts. Extremely friendly and helpful hosts. Extremely friendly and helpful hosts. ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant, warm, friendly and stylish”
Reviews.Author: ChrisKirsty
Reviews.Content: What a lovely atmosphere, great rooms, friendly staff, the perfect hotel, will def go back

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, central, friendly and stylish; a perfect place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: vejerbloke
Reviews.Content: From booking right through to checking out we had a great experience. The information on the website is great and the website is easy to use. The directions to get there were really helpful as were the online walking guides. On arrival we were instantly made very welcome. As we were early we took coffee in the restaurant and when our room was ready someone came to find us and our bags had already been taken up. The room was really lovely - stylish, clean and quiet. Good choices for breakfast and the waiting staff were really pleasant and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “I wish every hotel was like this”
Reviews.Author: Joolzsunka
Reviews.Content: It is in a great location, the staff are really helpful, knowledgeable & friendly, the breakfast and restaurant downstairs are great and the rooms are a good size and have everything you need and none of that stuff in hotels you end up paying for, but don't really need! It was excellent value for money. Free wifi, free guide books in the foyer, free DVDs to hire, train tickets at reception to "hire" and even a library that you can use (including music on iPods). I wish every hotel had a similar philosophy and feel. Please expand your chain around the globe! Loved it - thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Deborah011
Reviews.Content: Great Staff that were always willing to help. The walking tour picked us up from the hotel which was also fab. The U bahn is right there outside of the hotel. We ate in the restaurant which was good, not as great as the hotel, Breakfast a bit overpriced but plenty of it and good quality food. room was spotless as quoted by many a little quirky.

Reviews.Title: “Just lovely. Staff, ethics, bar, food...oh yeah, the rooms are pretty good too”
Reviews.Author: ascouse
Reviews.Content: Just amazing. I can't really add anything to all the other fantastic reviews. Just great. Staff are so helpful, they can't do enough for you. I will return to the Circus, no doubt. We stayed in the two bedroom suite, it was great. All that was needed

Reviews.Title: “A lovely stay at the Circus”
Reviews.Author: LauraW11
Reviews.Content: Not much I can really add as all the other reviews have pretty much summed up how nice this hotel was! Lovely rooms - very clean and quirkily designed - the shower OMG - I could have stood in it forever - it was so nice!! Friendly staff and very well located - I also liked the green ethic behind the setting up of the hotel and saving electricity, recycling etc. Have to admit didn't bother with the breakfasts as they weren't really my cup of tea - cold meats, yoghurt etc - I am more of a scrambled eggs on toast kind of girl!! We ended up having breakfast in the rather bizarrely named back factory across the road where you could get various pastries and coffee etc Make sure you visit the tower nearby as it offers amazing views of the whole city :-)

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: enzoweb
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Circus Hotel for four nights from 31/01/2011. I find the staff very friendly, attentive and they are knowledgeable about Berlin. Every time I asked them travel related questions, they provide me with satisfactory information, often with a map clearly marked. You can also rent their monthly metro ticket on a daily basis. This makes public transport very cheap. I find this service very touching since I've never seen it provided in any other hotels I stayed at. Apart from South America, I've travelled extensively in all the other continents. The hotel room is functional and small. Then again, most European hotel rooms are small. The internet is very fast and reliable. The buffet breakfast is very good value for money with quality and variety. The location of the hotel is brilliant. Many of the tourist attractions and museums are within walking distance. Even though this is not the most luxurious hotel I've ever stayed, it is however the nicest. I'd go back there at any time should I have the opportunity again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've stayed in, and such a good price”
Reviews.Author: Keithyboy25
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Berlin to find the temperature was -10c, but it didn't matter once we got to this brilliant hotel. The staff are some of the friendliest people you will ever meet, and are very knowledgable about the city. The rooms are modern and comfortable and the bar/restaraunt has a nice laid-back atmosphere to unwind in after a hard day sightseeing. If I return to Berlin I will definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place, Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Neilg08050
Reviews.Content: For a major European city this hotel is outstanding for 90euros per night. Rooms are spacious, clean and well presented. Staff are BRILLIANT, very friendly, exceptionally accomodating and always around to help. Breakfast is excellent value and location is also perfect to see the tourist areas of Berlin, as well as those 'off the beaten track'. The personal highlight has got to be the Segways..........The best way to get around Berlin, available to hire from the hotel for just 11 euro per hour. Overall, brilliant.........best value for money hotel I have EVER stayed in. Will definitely be back. Personal thanks to Mick, Isabelle and Christophe for all the recommendations and advice on finding the main nightlife. Will definitely be back. Thanks to everyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay who cares about the temperature outside”
Reviews.Author: Victoria190511
Reviews.Content: It has all been said before so my husband and I would just like to confirm as a token of gratitude for 4 pleasant days. Location and in house facilities really appreciated. However we especially appreciated the quality of service, every member of staff we had contact with was helpful, friendly and service minded in a natural way. This was what was special compared with many other hotels and created a good atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is good- but DO NOT eat at the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: coolik
Reviews.Content: I ate at the restaurant of the circus hotel while my colleague was staying there- and I got food poisoning from it. It was quite a severe one, so I will definitely never trust the food coming from that kitchen again. To be clear: my colleague loved the room, so this is not about the hotel, but the quality of the food was so bad, I wanted to make sure other travellers are warned.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary and future focussed while deftly acknowledging its past”
Reviews.Author: RosieEG
Reviews.Content: Pink flies meander across our wall but there's a flyswot just in case! After 15th century accommodation, this was a refreshing change. Clean, committed to sustainability, The Circus Hotel has been another great find - a great restaurant with a very reasonably priced buffet breakfast (and fresh, organic ingredients - 8 Euros), it's close to the centre of Berlin and our room was spacious and quiet (we didn't hear anything from the adjoining rooms or corridor). Staff happy to give tips to travellers who'd like to see more than just guide book Berlin. Tired after a day of sightseeing - so close to attractions- we walked to the Brandenburg Gate and Museum Island it was nice to watch the trams and daily life from our window.

Reviews.Title: “This place lives up to its great reputation”
Reviews.Author: Corinna_Ben
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to Berlin several times and decided to try a new place and we selected the Circus Hotel because it has such high ratings on TripAdvisor. I'm pleased to add our high ratings to the list. The staff were warm and welcoming, and very helpful. The room was a bit small (hough not ridiculous) and very clean. The restaurant is lovely, with nice breakfasts offered until 1 pm. The location is great - smack in the middle of Mitte. Also, the Rosenthaler Str. subway station is literally 10 steps away from the hotel. The hotel offered interesting tours every day (many of them free), including some that I would have never thought of on my own (like the Stasi Police prison in former East Berlin). The only complaint is that on our last night, someone had a party until 3 am which made it difficult to sleep. All things considered, though, we highly recommend the Circus Hotel and we definitely plan on booking a room here when we come back to the city.

Reviews.Title: “a very average experience”
Reviews.Author: Ascotman
Reviews.Content: Sorry to break the myth but this is a very average hotel. Sure its a bit funky, bohemian almost, but that masks the fact that its basically a three star inner city hotel with little soul. The room I stayed in ( apartment) was nice enough but noisy. But the big issue was the service which was slow and amateurish. I waited for ever to check in and trying to be served drinks and dinner was a joke. After over an hour of waiting for any food to come out of the kitchen I gave up and went across the road for a takeout pizza. Really disappointing after all the good reviews

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel in great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: mrcook18
Reviews.Content: From the moment we booked the circus for our break to Berlin, the service was out of this world! The staff were not only extraordinarily helpful, but spoke perfect English and were only too happy to give us tips and tricks for navigating the city. The apartment we stayed was not only exceptionally clean but a very comfortable and trendy room to stay in. The buffet breakfast was very tasty and very reasonably priced. The sightseeing walks that the hotel offers (in particular, brewers walks) are worth every euro and gave a very good sense of the surrounding area. I can not recommend this hotel enough to anybody visiting Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Clairesmithlondon
Reviews.Content: I booked here based on the trip advisor comments and to be honest i don't think i could have chose a better place. I was so busy travelling and sight seeing I can't really comment on the staff other than those in the bar which actually seemed quite unattentive, but the atmosphere and facilities kind of made up for it. Overall though the location is ideal, there are some very good places locally and it's so easy to travel around Berlin from there. If you want to go for a mini break then this place is great, and serves a purpose

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel; Great Value; Great Staff & Great Holiday!”
Reviews.Author: jpktrk
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a nice, smart, contemporary style hotel for our weekend break and the Circus Hotel was perfect. Easy to find and the staff were really helpful and friendly. THe rooms were lovely and bathroom great. Loved their eco-friendly attitude - no wasteful minibars and air con. Food in the restaurant was lovely - had their buffet breakfast and it was delicious, especially their museli with yoghurt & fruit, yum! Also had supper in their restaurant and that was great too and the beer was tasty! Good location, although if you want to walk to the otherside of town its about half an hour or so, but all the majot sites are on route. Trams and the underground are so easy and we talk advantage of their discounted travel card, which was good. Overall, can't fault it at all. On ef last day our flight wasn't until the evening and check out was midday, so they allowed us to keep our bags there and we did their 4 hour walking tour, which was good. Definitely recommend it, if you want a comfortable, friendly, well located, good quality and good value hotel. All the big chains were chraging about 15-20 euros for breakfast, whereas theirs was either 4E or 8E!

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: sciuradaltura
Reviews.Content: I spent at The Circus Hotel 4 fabulous days! The room was very nice, spacious (it was a Junior Suite) and clean. We had free Wi-Fi Internet in the room, in the hall and also in the restaurant (Fabisch). The staff is very friendly and a lot of services are available for free: miniPC, skypephones, etc. During Berlinale Film Festival every day two movie tickets are given for free (and we got them!). Breakfast is not included in the price of the room but you can choose between two different solutions, both at Fabisch restaurant: a small breakfast for 4 euros or a buffet breakfast for 8 euros. We chose the buffet and we had the opportunity to taste a lot of different bio-food. The hotel is located in Rosenthaler Platz, that means two u-bahn stops to Alexanderplatz. The area is quiet and many restaurants and shops are present there. I highly recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “The very best hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nix-bofh
Reviews.Content: The staff is friendly and speaks English very fluently. The hotel is very clean, brand new, the rooms are nice and spacious (at least the Junior Suite where we stayed), well furnished. The hotel offers free Internet access (via wifi), miniPC and skype phones, everything for free rental. We have also got two tickets for free for the Berlinale! The hotel has a restaurant (Fabisch) where you can have buffet breakfast (8 euro). You will find yogurt, jam, bread, eggs, sausage, cream, etc etc. Very satisfactory! The location (Rosenthaler Platz) is perfect. The area is quiet and the hotel entrance is just off the subway stop (line U-8). We loved the stay in this hotel, I think this was the best hotel ever where I had the pleasure to stay. I recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel! We will br back”
Reviews.Author: ROISIN1994
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 nights in the Circus Hotel. I wasn't actually looking forward to going to Berlin but the hotel was so good I can't wait to go back. The staff were so chilled out - when I checked in Isabelle didn't even take my credit card to take a copy. She was very pleasant and smiley. The double rooms were smallish but at the same time we weren't going there to spend loads of time in the room so that didn't matter. They were spotless, funky and the bathroom was so clean and new. The Restaurant Fabisch was so cool i wanted to spend every evening there! And the house white wine gorgeous. The leather sofas were just so inviting. We asked for an asian restaurant recommendation and the guy at the desk recommended Good Morning Vietnam 5 mins away from the hotel on foot. It was delicious! Just past this hotel on the other side was Yam Yam an korean restaurant - also great. As others said they lent us umbrellas and suggested sights etc, I loved the breakfast buffet - great value at €8 as I ate loads in the morning. It's more continental than cooked which suits me fine. I can't say anything bad about it at all. It was just great. And their ethos and principles commendable!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return - Circus Hotel is what every hotel should AIM for!”
Reviews.Author: MPaulas
Reviews.Content: During our fall trip to Germany, we planned a last-minute brief 2-night stay in Berlin. My only regret is that we did not stay longer. After searching for the perfect hotel, Circus Hotel seemed to fit the bill. The price was right and the locations seemed good. I was NOT disappointed! We took public transit from the airport to the hotel without any problems. Upon arrival, we were greeted with umbrellas for our use (it was raining), maps and guides, recommendations for eating, books to borrow, and laptops to borrow! What I was most shocked about was how true Circus Hotel is to their desire to be a "green" hotel. While most hotels in the States are likely just trying to save money by not washing towels, The Circus Hotel actually has renovated its rooms to require key-card access to use the power. We were really pleasantly surprised with The Circus Hotel. I took home the informative booklet on the hotel and shared with all of my friends. We would not even look for a different hotel if we returned to Berlin. Plus, the hotel is located in East Berlin, which is really where we wanted to spend most of our time. It's more affordable and there is a TON to do. The restaurant and bar (Fabisch) in the hotel is also highly recommend. Nothing bad to say about The Circus. The decor is very bright in the halls, but the room was very peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: luxurytraveller000
Reviews.Content: Like all the reviewers before me have said, this is an excellent hotel. The great customer service starts from the moment you book. I would highly recommend this hotel for price, service, location, cleanliness and free internet access. I used the hotel transfer service from the airport and this was excellent. I will be using this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, cant wait to visit again”
Reviews.Author: holiday80
Reviews.Content: Went to the Circus Hotel on the weekend of the 22nd Jan for 2 nights for my hubbys birthday. Was feeling positive due to the good reviews and was not dissapointed. Really nice modern, clean hotel. All the staff are friendly, helpful and provide a relaxed atmosphere. Location is fantastic, so much nearby....Shops, bars, restaurants, tram, U-bahn all within walking distance. We chose to have the buffet breakfast in the hotel each morning, which really was nice. All fresh and healthy food. The bread was lovely. Didnt have an evening meal there as we like to venture out, but the food looked really good when it came out!! Reception are very helpful and you can buy your day pass for the public transport here with discount.. 2 for 1 on a sunday makes it a bargain to get around all day!! Rooms very modern and clean, lovely shower and big bed. Really dont have a bad word to say, the worst part was leaving!!!

Reviews.Title: “Do believe the hype”
Reviews.Author: Jamboandsteve
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, great location, very helpful staff lovely rooms - there are a lot of recommendations for this hotel you can believe them

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous friendly experience in great location”
Reviews.Author: Erik_05Melb
Reviews.Content: We (family of 4) stayed for 5 nights just before Xmas in one of the Apartments. Whilst the weather was at times quite cold, the warmth of the Cicus Hotel staff and the amenities of the apartment. restuarant and bar more than compensated. The location is very handy with a UBahn, tram and bus stops right outside so reaching any of Berlin's sights is no problem. Its even walking distance to Museum Island if you prefer exploring the streets. The front counter staff have perfect English and there was no question or matter they couldnt assist with. The only minor negative - if you're looking to avoid Australian/NZ/USA travellers, stay elsewhere. But as I said its only a minor thing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CHabroad
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Circus at the start of Jan after seeing reviews on Trip Advisor....and I'm extremely glad we did. Great location which is very easy to get to from the Airport being located right next to the underground. Upon arrival we were greeted by a lovely girl who recommended tours/restaurants etc which all turned out to be great. Our room was a deluxe double and was a decent size, decorated well and was clean and comfortable. Infact, the bed was one of the comfiest we've come across in European hotels. I do agree with the other reviews that the wooden floors do tend to get dirty, expecially when it's snowing...perhaps a door mat/shoe rack would help?? We overlooked the busy junction however the noise level was ok and didn't keep us awake. Breakfast was good and we sat in the bar for a nightcap every night. Again, the staff here were fantastic. We would definitely return to this hotel and would recommend to friends and family. It's small, laid back and friendly...exactly what we like. Great value for money too which is always a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: DLMCC
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel having read previous reviews on this site and it lived up to all of the positive comments. It is a small, clean, friendly place to stay and offers excellent value in a great location. I would happily return and recommend this hotel. The rooms are small and simple. The bathroom's the same but both have everything you need. The bar downstairs is a lovely place to relax. We had breakfast each morning, the bircher muesli was particularly good (and I am not usually a fan of it). The hotel has a number of laptops which can be borrowed at no cost and used in the bar, a brilliant idea. The staff are very helpful and friendly. There is nothing I would change.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent concept and location”
Reviews.Author: TorunR
Reviews.Content: Circus has a perfect location in the heart of one of many nice areas in Berlin. This area is special, because of its history and its central position close to the Alexanderplatz. Underground station litterary on the doorstep of Circus plus several tram lines. That is if you want to leave the area, which is by no means necessary considering all the nice shops, cafés and restaurants in the neighborhood. I picked a 2 bedroom apartment for a family trip. We had Apt 4 in the top floor, which had its pros and cons. There was no need to worry about noise from this busy street corner - even the room to the street was very quiet. Not so nice was the fact that the windows were mainly in the ceiling, which made the apartment dark and a bit cave like. In summer it might get really hot and sticky in there. The bedrooms were nice and comfortable, as the bathroom, but the living area was not adequate for four people. It was far too small, and the fully equipped kitchen took its share of space. This didn't matter to us so much since we spent only two days and mainly used the hotel to sleep. But it seems a bit odd to have such a great kitchen and no space to just relax together all four. It should be stressed, however, that this is a really nice hotel. We appreciate the ecological concept and also that they stress the history of the building and the area. They have also made some innovations that are really helpful to tourists, such as the "rent a public transport card". The staff was very friendly and helpful. We had the 8 EUR breakfast buffet all three days, and it was as promised - quality instead of quantity. but no less filling!

Reviews.Title: “Great base in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: LionHongKong
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice in December, once before Christmas and once over New Year. The hotel is in a fantastic location, easily accessible to public transport and the staff are very helpful.
