We stayed in a superior room and the room was a good size, well appointed and with a great shower! We had breakfast in the restaurant and also dinner one night, the food was excellent and the dinner in particular was good value. The first room we had was facing the courtyard and this was quieter than on our second stay when we were by the street - however still not that noisy and it was New Years Eve! The hotel was good value for money, before Christmas but a lot more expensive over New Years - still thought it was fair given that it's peak season but would have liked to have seen breakfast included for that price. The cleaning could be improved - found a toilet roll on the bed when we came back one day, and floors could have been cleaned better (lots of snow outside made a bit of a mess). The hotel is also quite separate to the hostel. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very high standard for the price.”
Reviews.Author: YorkieGorilla
Reviews.Content: Just spent two nights here. Really good value. Wonderful staff. They adhere to their underlying green principles which is good. Already planning to come back again for a longer visit.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, staff and location”
Reviews.Author: qlder_03
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the only place to stay in Berlin. Firstly, the staff are fantastic, so friendly and helpful and they made an effort to get to know you. Also you get given two key cards as well. The rooms were spacious (for Europe) and the bathroom modern-great water pressure. Breakfast is not included but you can get museli, fruit salad, coffee/tea for 4euros or get the big breakfast for 8euros. It is great how they have a resturant downstairs and there was live music there several nights. Alternatively-there are great cheap eats next door/across the road. Or if you just walk a bit down some of the streets you find nice resturants. The trams & U are right outside your door step and it is easy to get to different locations. The best thing is, the hotel offers you a AB pass to travel on metro/tram/bus etc for 4euros a day which is cheaper than buying a ticket yourself. It was so convient. They also have stamps and will post your postcards/letters for you. When I return to this hotel, I will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: giannapj
Reviews.Content: The circus is a great hotel in a very good location with lots of restaurants, boutiques, bars around and in front of the tube entrance. We stayed in a Junior Suite with terrace on the back of the building with the view of the courtyard. It was a good size room with a large bathroom and a fantastic shower. There was no noise at all as we were on the back so we had an excellent sleep. The breakfast is organic, with lots of choice and worth the money. We did not tried the restaurant but there were many events organized there, if you cannot be bothered to go out in the snow. The staff is very polite and helpful. We liked the green attitude of the hotel. Things to improve in my opinion: - the cleaning needs to be improved a bit. On the day of arrival the bathroom floor was not that clean. the room needed to be dusted a bit better. - the beds: there were two single beds pushed together instead of 1 double bed and the worst thing was the duvet; there were two single ones instead of a big one. - when you enquire about the availability and price by mail, make sure you fully understand the total price to pay as the staff in the e-mails might mention an "average price" without stating it clearly and you do not really want to be put in the inconvenient position (as we were) of having to choose which price to pay... I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, goes the extra mile in all areas”
Reviews.Author: konikov
Reviews.Content: We were only staying in Berlin en route to Russia, but the stay in the Circus was well worth the few hours we were there. The hotel is really well located with a U bahn station around the corner and we took advantage of the hotels travel pass available with deposit. The room was individually decorated and we were left a bottle of wine by the staff as it was the first night of our honeymoon. Would certainly recommend for a stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value and a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ConsultantNomad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Circus for a long leisure weekend. It is a great hotel - lively but not noisy, with lovely simple spotlessly clean rooms, friendly staff and the best breakfasts we have ever had. Try the Bircher Muesli, the cheeses, the bread, everything. We also took the hotel's advice and did the tour of Berlin on the regular bus - a couple of Euros and really interesting. Berlin is not a beautiful city, and there is a definite German orderliness about it all - why do most people obey the pedestrian crossing signals even if there is no vehicle for miles? Why are the museums so unimaginative and dull? But it is a great place to wander around - walk up from the Circus and visit the old quarters of the DDR's former capital - great little shops (avoid the overpriced boutiques and go for everyday stores). If you go at Christmas, visit the markets but don't spend all your money there - much better value in the department stores! As you've guessed, we loved this hotel and the city. There is lots to do and lots to see, and the Circus, by the U-Bahn, is spot-on and excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: johamy
Reviews.Content: From the minute we walked in the door at Circus Hotel until we left three days later, everything was perfect: The staff was wonderful, service minded and always had a smile for us. The room was spacious, clean, and really wonderful. The bed was excellent, the bath was large and really nice. There were no noise during the night and we really liked the design touch. We stayed in a Superior Room, and the price was a bargain. The restaurant on the Ground Floor was really nice, and served excellent food, and also had good live music in the evenings. The staff was smiling and the service efficient. And you can get all on the menu served in your room if you like! The best part is that the hotel is a green hotel, and this influence every detail. The food is locally grown and from bio farming, you can rent bikes or an eletrical car, you can reuse the towels, the shower is a save shower (but still really good!) etc. The hotel also has an excellent location, you can walk to Hackescher Mark in 5 minutes. We are really looking forward to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The most wonderful hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: GraceGibbons
Reviews.Content: We'd read all of the great reviews on trip advisor and that's why we chose the hotel and it completely exceeded our expectations. The room was lovely and really good value. The nicest thing about the hotel is that the staff are all so friendly and helpful, from the moment we walked in, they made us feel so welcome and spent time giving us advice about where to visit. We went with a guide book but needn't have taken one because the hotel lent lonely planet guide books out along with laptops, fantastic movies set in Berlin to watch in your room and even a 'super speedy sledge' for playing in the show. The decor of the hotel was amazing, with so much thought being put into every feature. The food in the restaurant was also fantastic. I really couldn't recommend this hotel more, it was the perfect base for a fantastic break in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Email service/assistance OUTSTANDING!”
Reviews.Author: Melissa M
Reviews.Content: I know this is a weird thing to do, but I'd like to review a hotel I have not yet stayed at. I'm planning to stay at the Circus Hotel in April/May 2011, and I'm a wheelchair user, so I need to make hotel reservations by email after asking a number of questions about facilities. The staff at Circus Hotel have provided outstanding service in responding to my emails about my stay later this year promptly, politely and incredibly cheerfully. They have made me feel genuinely welcome before I have even arrived. In short, their email service has been outstanding. PS. The rate quoted for a twin room was excellent also.

Reviews.Title: “Look No Further...”
Reviews.Author: EJL12
Reviews.Content: When my husband booked a hotel called "Circus" I was a little worried but I needn't have been ços he found a gem. The hotel has large, clean and modern rooms with great bathrooms that you can both be in at the same time and not be standing on top of each other. The staff are a mine of information and are willing and available to share this with you 24/7. The restaurant/bar is fun and on one night while we were staying there was a great jazz singer so the place was buzzing. The location of the hotel is fantastic too as it is on top of an underground station and alongside a tram line so if you don't feel like walking to the main attractions (which are easily reachable on foot) then you can catch public transport without having to traipse around. If you are googling for accommodation, abandon the search and stay here, you wont be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in berlin!!”
Reviews.Author: joff16v
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the start of december, ill keep the reveiw short as there isnt much to say... This hotel is fantastic Very nice, modern, cool, quirky, amazing staff Right near a u- bahn station Loads of bars, restaurants near by What more can i say, when u go to berlin, stay here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Anniversary Break in Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: Becky8206
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Circus Hotel with my husband for 3 nights in December 2010. I had chosen the hotel after reading reviews on Tripadvisor, it did not disappoint. I looked at the hotel's own website which was very helpful and then made contact with the hotel by email. They dealt with the booking efficiently and any questiosn or arrangement of breakfast/arranging transport and arranging chocolates and wine for our room was dealt with quickly and in a friendly fashion. I decided to book a Junior Suite as it seemed to be good value for money. When we arrived we loved the trendy decoration and green friendly ethos of the hotel and our room was lovely (pics attached). I would recommend asking for a room facing the courtyard to avoid traffic noise from the road. The hotel is in a great location and the staff were very helpful and approachable. It is also extremely clean. We also booked the breakfast buffet at the Fabisch restaurant located under the hotel. It was a breath of fresh air that they served breafast until 1pm, althought I didn't want to waste that much of the day, very rarely have I known such accommodating flexibility. At 8 euros each I thought this was a little expensive at first but the breakfast included cereals, bread, cheeses, meats, boiled eggs, a glass of juice and unlimited tea and coffee was actually a great value option with the added perk of being extremely convenient. Also for reference we had an evening meal in the restaurant during our stay and can recommend it; good staff and good value food. My only negatives regarding the hotel was that as someone who likes a cup of tea in bed before going to sleep and when I get up the lack of tea/coffee making facilities in the room was disappointing, despite the convenience of the restaurant being downstairs I didn't want to subject other diners to my brightly coloured PJs! Also the bed was incredibly uncomfortable! Despite being a suite room the bed was made up of two uncomfortable single mattresses and two single duvets which my husband and I found difficult to settle with. Despite these two things I would recommend the hotel completely. You can see that the hotel is forward thinking and responds to what guests want. Despte being cool and trendy it also felt friendly and cosy. It provided the perfect base and retreat to explore the great city of berlin for a short break!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not so expensive, great location”
Reviews.Author: johannasalla
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights with a 5-year-old child. Room was ok, but a little cold (speacially floors) (it was snowing and a little cold outside too) and we could hear traffic noise all night long. Breakfast was delicious, location excellent, staff friendly. Good special offers like the public travel ticket only for 4 euros. Be sure to ask it first thing in the morning,because they havea limited amount of those cards. Alexanderplatz is quite near, you can walk there or take metro (two stops), the tram goes in front of hotel near to the Naturkunde Museum which was interesting place too (speacially for children). The place to put shoes and clothes was in the back of the room, so in this weather maybe not so clever...Shoes wet the room. But even with these little complains, it was well worth the price. I wouldn't stay there in hot summer, because they don't have air conditioner (for green reasons),but ok in spring, autumn or not so hot weather.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST HOTEL EVER!”
Reviews.Author: IandM
Reviews.Content: + side: Free Room service Free Wifi in all rooms Free DVD and good Berlin-DVD films Super nice and helpful staff Best organic brekkie ever (8 Euro) 5 meters from the subway and a good location in the mitte. You can rent segways for 35 EURO/ day ... OMG so much fun! - side: Nothing

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel of our trip, don't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: CinnamonBun
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in October and can't recommend it enough. The location is quite good - pretty much on top of a subway station and an easy walk to Alexanderplatz. The character of the neighbourhood changes from block to block, but there's a friendly, energetic atmosphere wherever you go. Hotel staff were great - always professional and helpful. We LOVED the decor throughout the hotel and appreciated the emphasis on sustainable practices. We chose an economy room, and although it was small it had everything we needed, including a very comfortable bed. Only downsides to the room: the hotel is located at a 5-road intersection, so it was often loud at night; we also had a shower door that didn't close properly and soaked our bathroom. Neither of these things would deter us from staying here again. We ate at the restaurant once and thoroughly enjoyed our meals - service was slow but they appeared to be understaffed that night. Although we heard they put on a nice spread for breakfast in the mornings, we decided that 8 Euros each was a little steep, especially in a city like Berlin where cheap, good food is easy to find (we had breakfast most mornings around the corner at the bagel place). If you stay here, don't overlook the hole-in-the-wall asian/doner/pizza place underneath the Circus Hotel - very fresh and tasty, especially the Thai cuisine, and you can't beat the price. Although we stayed at the hotel, on nights when we were looking for some fun we headed to the bar at the Circus hostel across the street. The bartenders were awesome, drinks were reasonably priced and there was a shrine to David Hasselhoff on the wall...what more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “from the phone call making the booking to the help in getting to the airport we found it lived up to its promise.”
Reviews.Author: avocetexsydney
Reviews.Content: We went here because of the reviews on trip advisor and we were glad we did. The website goes on about the ethos of the place and it seemed a bit overdone but then from the phone call making the booking to the help in getting to the airport we found it lived up to its promise. I will not repeat all the other guests praise, though I could as the whole stay was excellent. The communal room/bar downstairs will not suit all but there are lots of great cafes, bars and restaurants nearby and they are generous enough to recomend them on their web site. Well done guys.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, location, design and value”
Reviews.Author: DanielJacobs
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of the apartments for four nights in November 2010 based on trip advisor reviews. Location was excellent, staff were friendly and helpful at all times, and the value for money was simply superb. Only criticsm I could make was that the apartment had a constant smokey smell but all else was first class. Will definitely be going back

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel for People who don't like hotels!”
Reviews.Author: DevonHelen
Reviews.Content: Everything you read is true. Exceptional staff ( having said this all Berliners seem to be extremely jolly and friendly) and a lovely hotel located next to a tube. Weather you walk or use the train, everywhere is within 15 - 20 minutes including the Brandenburg gate. The hotel is so warm and has an excellent communal space in Restaurant Fabishe which has books, music, cocktails, breakfast, lunch, live music and dinner!! Wifi is free, and unbelievably so is room service. This is a truely sustainable hotel in every sense that manages to be perfect. Recommended for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Makes me smile that I am staying in the Circus Hotel after a hard day of sight-seeing!”
Reviews.Author: bwie_sg
Reviews.Content: I was in Berlin with my husband and stayed in the Circus Hotel for 3Days, 2 nights from 8 - 10 Nov. I booked via the hotel's website for their standard double room. We arrived from Berlin Schonefeld Airport and the hotel's instruction on how to get to the hotel from Berlin SXF was really useful and easy to follow. We found the Circus Hotel without any problems. The U-Bahn was located directly next to the hotel and this means it was easy to get around the major sights around Berlin. Saying that, some of the sights were within walking distance from the hotel. However, you might want to use the S-Bahn when the weather is cold! Check-in was quick and easy. All the hotel staff spoke very fluent English and I believe some of them speak french and a few of the commonly used European languages. The staff on duty at the reception desk has great knowledge of Berlin and always keen to recommend something. The hotel loans a day pass to its guest for €4/day and this allows you unlimited travels on the tram, S-Bahn and U-Bahn network. Just around the hotel are numerous eateries and take-aways so you'll never starve. The hotel has a really cool restaurant that you should check out too (which is also the breakfast area). One thing though, there was no supermarket nearby which meant we couldn't feed our habit of having a nice cup of tea to wind down at night with some snacks. My husband and I are fairly small in built so the room was alright for us. Some guests might find the room to have limited walking space. Otherwise, room was clean and was well-equipped with easy to use radiators. Amenities were available next to the reception counter; in line with the hotel's green policy. Find out about their walking tour if you'd like. It was a great tour and allows you to find out about Berlin's history!

Reviews.Title: “Visiting Berlin? Circus Hotel is perfect combination of location, good price, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: EuDiMu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Circus hotel few days ago... We picked the economy double room at 80 euro and I must admit it was great! The hotel is very new, modern, young and vibrant. The rooms are modern but with a twist of colors or nice pieces of furniture. the hotel is in Mitte, right in front of U-Bahn Rosenthaler Platz, and in a perfect position if you want visit the city just walking around.. everything is convenient and not so far. All around the hotel there are restaurants, bars, pubs, starbucks, stores, libraries, banks...everything you may need is maximum one block away. We have been welcomed by a very nice girl Sophie, that introduced us to the city and gave us some tips about where to go and what to do. In the lobby you can borrow lonely planet city guides, umbrellas if it's raining, and small notebook if you have to check emails. The hotel has attached a restaurant that serves breakfast, dinner and drinks. We had breakfast buffet at 8 euro. everything is biological and the food is various and delicious. Of course, if you want spend less, there is starbucks in rosenthalerstrasse. Rooms are new, modern and clean. There is everything you may need and is everything colorful and young. I would reccommend it for a short stay in berlin. In addition, the same Circus Hotel has also a hostel on the opposite side of the street, in case you want get even better rates

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: lemkinn
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the 2-room apartment with a couple of friends on a long weekend. I cannot fault the place for value, cleanliness and comfort. The staff are extremely helpful and the associated restaurant also served good german food and beer, and is very comfortable. Free wi-fi throughout the hotel. Will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Choiceness in Berlin!!”
Reviews.Author: Tanea H
Reviews.Content: This is my second visit to Berlin AND my second stay at The Circus Hotel. I can't recommend it enough. I booked via their internet site and when I wrote to ask to extend my stay, the reply was straightforward and friendly. Similarly, when I arrived, there was no hassle, no asking for credit cards up front. Just a lovely warm welcome. Excellent!! I spent the extra Euros 10 to stay in a double room which is spacious and comfortable. The wireless internet is really appreciated. As a woman travelling on my own, I really appreciate sitting in a hotel lounge having a drink in the evening without feeling out of place and uncomfortable. The hotel is well located to the public transport networks. I went cycling with a friend (who lives locally) and recommend it as a viable and fun way to get around the city. And for goodness sake, make sure you eat breakfast each morning - it is substantial and kept me full well into the afternoon!! Thank you once again Circus Hotel for being wonderful - hopefully I'll make the trek back to Europe next year. You'll definitely be top of my list!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel - great staff, spacious bathrooms, have the buffet breakfast!!!”
Reviews.Author: DKYW
Reviews.Content: There's a reason why this hotel is rated so highly by so many - value for money is incredible for a European city. Central location - only 2 stops from Alexanderplatz, you can walk down some shopping streets to get there, just perfect. The design and concept of the hotel are awesome - the hotel magazine is even cool. The lounge/restaurant are cool yet quirky. Staff are incredibly helpful & friendly, they have all kinds of ideas and advice about what to do in Berlin. I stayed in a double by myself as I wanted a big bed & it was a good size room, small but normal by european standards - modern funky design overlooking Rosenthaler Platz. Big bathroom with alot of room which I loved having. Have the breakfast buffet - it's EUR8 but the food is all organic and absolutely delicious. I have no qualms about this hotel whatsoever - I will be back in Berlin and I will definitely stay at the Circus again. I did find I heard other people get into their room late at night but didn't ruin my stay at all. Just bring earplugs (which I happened to have!). My only note to people is that the information desk at Berlin Schonefield told me to catch the bus to Rudow and then catch the metro - whereas the Circus hotel website tells you to catch the Airport express train to Alexanderplatz. The info desk didn't seem to know what I was talking about when I said Airport express train. Either way works. I ended up catching the Airport express train from Alexanderplatz on the way out of Berlin & it was probably a bit easier as it's pretty obvious when to get on & off - but not so much with the bus to Rudow.

Reviews.Title: “Truly unique and amazing”
Reviews.Author: HollywoodDuo
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the Circus Hotel. I don't think you will find a better deal in any major city in the world. The whole look of the hotel and the rooms was really cool. The staff was incredibly helpful. We spent several nights in the hotel bar/restaurant listening to their live musicians. It is right next to a U-Bahn station and within walking distance of a lot of stuff to see including Museum Island. If you are going to Berlin, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “An Outstanding Hotel in the heart of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Globalphile
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 7 night stay in Berlin. I loved this edgy and hip city with all of it's art, street art, museums, modern architecture and music. What really made my stay was The Circus. It is in a young neighborhood in Mitte, in the old East Berlin. It is surrounded by cafes, music venues and many Asian restaurants. The hotel is right next to an underground stop. The staff is really outstanding and helped me with direction, tickets to music events and taxi reservations. I tried to tip and they refused. The hotel restaurant was really great. Loved the young atmosphere and great food. The morning breakfast buffet had the best in musli, wonderful breads, yogurts,and cheeses and meats. I had dinner at the hotel on 3 occasions. Had cabbage stew, wild boar and wonderful salads. Made it easy to eat there after a day chocked full of sightseeing. Also tried some of the fun neighborhood restaurants. The hotel has a contemporary feel. My room (I opted for a larger double) was so very reasonable at 90 euros a night. Had two beds pushed together as a king, flat screen TV with cable, desk and reading chair. The bathroom was sleek and clean. They use all green products. I recommend this hotel to any one who wants to explore Berlin. It really fits the current vibe of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Best”
Reviews.Author: reinnymey
Reviews.Content: I have travelled a lot in my life and I am not the easiest of the customer but believe me Thaison Hotel is just to good to be true! Rooms are very clean with flat screen tv, the staff is unbelievable helpful. the hotel has a great location It is located in a very calm street so we slept like babies. Basically Circus Hotel is a perfect hotel with budget prices ..what is it better than this ?

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: scallions
Reviews.Content: In a good area for easy access to the rest of the city/tourist hot spots. Food in the restaurant is fine - not amazing but certainly not bad. THe Vegan breakfast wasn't great, the scrambled eggs and croissants are fabulous, the cheese board is delicious and the gnocchi was just ok. But this was just our opinion - taste is very subjective. Service is very good - staff friendly and helpful with faultless english. Good advice given on restaurants outside the hotel. Exceptionally clean hotel. We stayed in room 203 and the bed was very comfy, and we heard no noise from inside the hotel/other rooms/corridor... but we did hear a lot of street noise, as although it was november the room got very hot in the night (we turned off all the radiators before getting into bed) and we had to open the windows. But this is part and parcel of staying in the city - you're bound to hear street noise. Oh, and room service is free - what a lovely touch.

Reviews.Title: “amazing location - excellent staffe”
Reviews.Author: D28
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel - it was in a really young vibrant part of the city and this hotel was right in the middle of it all. the staff couldnt have been more friendly and helpful. we stayed with a 1 year old and they had cots etc and welcomed people of all ages. the room was a junior suite (i think!). and was quite small but big enough for us all to fit in. the rooms are amazing - with every little detail thought of, and the decor is modern and funky. we even had a little roof terrace. our only very minor issue was with the twin beds pushed together, with 2 single duvets. not great if you were travelling as a couple for a romantic break!! (although i'm sure they'd swap them for you? loved this place and would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Best city-hotel we ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: francobollo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are city-trip fans. We have visited most of the well-known capitals of Europe (Paris, London, ...). We always try to find a hotel worth the price, which is generally quite difficult : tourist cities usually are very expensive. The Circus may not be the cheapest hotel in Berlin, but I wonder if there exists a hotel with a price-value rate even close to the one of the Circus. I'm not going to repeat all the good others wrote, I can only say that all of it is true. I'd like to thank all staff members for their kindness and urge the owners to open a Circus in Paris, Rome and so on. There is, of course, one thing: staying, sleeping and eating in the Circus is so good you'd forget to visit the city. (Just joking) Frank Boogers

Reviews.Title: “In one word 'perfect'”
Reviews.Author: briand69
Reviews.Content: We had heard this was a great hotel and it was. The staff were very friendly and the rooms were modern clean with great facilities. This is a organic hotel with and amazing restaurant (only 8€ for a full buffet breakfast) I can not recommend it enough. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: Hellasfarere
Reviews.Content: Our first time in Berlin, and the service, friendliness and help that the staff gave us was excellent. The Circus has a central location to most interesting places in Berlin and to public communication in a very nice neigbourhood with nice shops and cafes. The breakfast and main meals that we had were very tasty. We will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: JABDusseldorf
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Circus Hotel for two nights in October 2010 as part of a short city break. The hotel is situated right next to Rosenthaler Platz U-bahn station but is within an easy walk to the main sites in the centre of Berlin. The hotel is excellent value for money, the rooms are spacious for a hotel near the city centre and the modern interior design gives it a relaxed atmosphere. The best thing about the hotel was the service, which was excellent. The staff were friendly and helpful at all times and were also more than happy to give us advice on sightseeing, how to get around the city, places to eat etc. Berlin has lots to offer and I am sure we will go back again and when we do we will stay at the Circus Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “best in town”
Reviews.Author: frankenreiter
Reviews.Content: i saw the reviews and it was certain we'll stay there. awesome place. rooms are small, but well designed and clean. extraordinarily friendly staff. good breakfast menu. perfect value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Make this a hotel you visit”
Reviews.Author: theoldone
Reviews.Content: From arrival to departure this hotel and its staff were excellent. The rooms are individually designed, clean and modern. The staff were without exception friendly and helpful. The hotel takes pride in its past whilst creating a modern hotel. It is all explained in a book in the room. The ouside courtyard was a haven in a busy city, although too cold in October!! We ate here every night as the food was very good and served promptly. Breakfast was of good quality too. There are books available in the library area to browse through. Music to listen to through headphones. All enquiries at the desk were answered willingly. Nothing seemed to be a problem. We have stayed in hotels throughout the world, some 5 star but this beat them on friendliness.

Reviews.Title: “a breath of fresh air...”
Reviews.Author: roadtrippbyopillows
Reviews.Content: i can't say enough about how nice the facilities and the staff were during our one night stop over in Berlin. we truly wished we had planned to stay longer, not only for the sights, but for the luxurious accommodations-especially compared to some of our other stays in European cities. my husband and our 2 friends opted to reserve apartment #1 b/c it was the same price as booking two separate rooms and it came with 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms (sink, toilet, roomy shower in each), a kitchen, a dining room and a sitting area. the sitting area had a day bed, so we could have slept 5 easily with a sleeping bag-a mental note i made. ;) everything is brand new. the furniture is clearly IKEA, so they will need to replace it in a few years, but for now it is comfortable, clean and fun! the staff was very helpful and friendly. they had a parking pass for us to park on the street for free (reserve this ahead of time) with only a deposit which was returned on check-out. they also have monthly public transportation passes for 4 euro a day (two people ride on one ticket on the weekend, so we paid a total of 8 euro for 4 people to ride all day). the U and S bahn stops are just outside of the hotel. one friend made use of the cafe downstairs and had the breakfast buffet and thought it was a good deal. we liked that the shampoo/conditioner, body wash and lotion are kept on a shelf beside the reception desk for self service rather than left in the rooms and wasted when not used. a smart business move as well as an environmentally friendly initiative! the circus hotel has all the right ideas for making a stay in berlin relaxing, fun and friendly. we hope to have an excuse to return to berlin so we can stay at the circus hotel again!!!

Reviews.Title: “THIS IS THE WAY CITY HOTELS SHOULD BE”
Reviews.Author: PeteD012
Reviews.Content: There are so many great reviews about the Circus that we did consider not bothering to write another one. But having just returned from a long-weekend, we couldn't stop ourselves. This place is just fantastic. What's so good about the Circus? There's a long list... It feels like a very upmarket hostel - you feel at home as soon as you walk through the door. It's most definitely not corporate - businessmen in suits would feel out of place here It's in a perfect location, no more than 15 minutes walk from many of the places you want to see when you first come to Berlin; right next to an underground station and tram stop and 2 minutes from some of the best cafes and restaurants in the City. (Can't speak for the nightclubs as we didn't go to any!) There are wonderfully friendly and helpful young staff at reception and in the bar and restaurant - all of whom speak perfect English (and probably other languages as well) It's very modern (just 2 years since renovation), with a beautiful contemporary design, in the public areas and each individual bedroom. There are imaginative touches all over the hotel The double rooms are large for a city centre hotel; you certainly don't feel cramped There is free wi-fi, laptop loan, a library of books about Berlin, daily European newspapers, with leather armchairs to flop into in the foyer and bar, oh, and fresh flowers everywhere At weekends, they can provide you with a public transport pass which will get two of you all over the city for 2 whole days for just 4 euros - an incredible bargain The breakfasts (8 Euros) are healthy and largely organic; the 'make your own teabag' system may test the patience of some, but everything else is top rate There is great modern German food in the restaurant, at prices which are lower than most other places we tried They have live fairly laid-back music on some evenings The bedrooms are quiet! We had a 3rd floor room facing onto a very busy main street with trams trundling along at 50kph, but the heavy double-glazed windows kept out all but the occasional police siren. We slept like logs There is a lovely central courtyard for sitting out when its warm enough (not when we were there) The Circus is a one-off - not a chain (although they do have the Circus Hostel just across the road) - and it really shows. It has a real human quality you rarely find in most souless hotels Please don't change anything - we are coming back in a couple of years and won't even bother researching other options. This is the place to be! Pete Duncan and Sally Thomas Newcastle Upon Tyne UK

Reviews.Title: “Not consistant”
Reviews.Author: dreamonixx
Reviews.Content: I booked this because of all the great reviews and I liked the hotel but didn't LOVE it. There are many good things about it such as location, the eco policy, the beds, breakfast & some staff. It's probably a 4 star property and I love also that it has personality and isn't a brand name hotel. The art and decor are absolutely wonderful! The thing is the people behind the desk are not consistent in service delivery. You get a great interaction then the next person couldn't care less. Without giving too much away I had a problem during my stay and asked the staff to please fix it (a noise issue). They assured me it would be dealt with and when I returned an hour later and a staff shift change had occurred no one knew about it / has resolved the issue. I therefore had to put up with another night of bad sleep because they never acted on the situation. In the bar we had generally good staff then on another night the American sounding bar guy was slow and kinda grumpy. I believe the staff work at both the back packer Circus over the road and also at the Hotel. Instead I think they need to keep the two products separate and dedicate staff to each project. The better staff should be working at the Hotel and newbies at the back packer. For Euro100 a night I have very different expectations than an backpacker might have so give me the staff who can deal with those expectations. Give me staff who will take ownership and ensure a situation is thoroughly resolved. As mentioned the basic shell of this is good and appealing - please don't get me wrong. They just need to work with staff on some customer service training and get rid of the back packer mentality. This is a hotel, not hostel!

Reviews.Title: “You couldn't ask for a better place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: AnthonyF2010
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a week long tour of Berlin with a group of fellow history buffs, and I was very pleased with the hotel, restaurant, and staff. While they call themselves a "Green" hotel, I didn't find this as a negative to my stay. If you're heading to Berlin, this place is worth a try.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Gaz_n_Dave
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was well presented, reasonable location and good value for money (although breakfast wasn't inclusive in the rate). Hotel staff were also very helpful. We would recommend it for a stay of any duration in Berlin. Stayed in Apartment 2 - very spacious, well equipped, good value for money. At 110 Euros per night, I believe this room would be far bigger than you would get at one of the big hotel chains and equally, if not more comfortable / well presented. Being picky, it would be better if rate included breakfast. Hotel is in a reasonably central location and is very well connected with buses, trams and underground. TIP: The hotel rents public transport travel passes which save you 2 euros per day compared to buying standard daily passes. Wifi internet is free and the hotel lends laptops free of charge which is helpful for booking tourist attractions (ie. the TV tower to avoid the queues) and restaurants in advance, as well as general internet browsing / research. For those staying in the apartments, there is a very good supermarket on Ackerstrasse - 5 min walk away from the hotel. Although the hotel had a restaurant, we didn't use it as there are lots of eateries in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel - amazing value for money”
Reviews.Author: AmbieLondon
Reviews.Content: I would thoroughly recommend this hotel. The value for money is amazing, the facilities available are everything you could expect. Would rival any four-star establishment. Close to many good bars, restaurants and cafes. About a 30 min walk to the Bradenburg Gate but right next an underground station if you don't feel like walking! Within walking distance of most of the main sights. Only complaint would be that the cleaners left the windows open on a very cold day, so when we got back in the evening the room was freezing! Apart from that I couldn't really fault much else.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT STAY”
Reviews.Author: Maggiesoup
Reviews.Content: Staff went beyond the call of duty nothing was too much trouble. Breakfast was good value at 8 euros for a fantastically varied and healthy start to the day. Rooms were spotless and the shower is to die for. One of the best hotels we've ever stayed in... and we do city breaks at least three times a year around Europe. 10 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel in a Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Barbie1976
Reviews.Content: I can only really reiterate what most of the other reviewers have said, I also booked the hotel on the basis of Tripadvisor reviews and it didn't disappoint in the slightest. Communication to the hotel prior to our arrival was spot on and they promptly replied to any e-mails. We had booked the 2 room apartment for 5 nights which was absolutely huge and beautifully decorated - lounge area, kitchen, bathroom and then upstairs to a massive bedroom. We only had breakfast once in the hotel just because we had other plans on the other days but it was excellent value for money with a really good choice of (exceptionally) fresh foods. We also had a sandwich one day in the restaurant as a snack and ate there one evening - both times the food was excellent. The restaurant was always busy (and attracts non hotel guests) which is testament to how good the food is. The location is absolutely perfect - you can walk to most of the main tourist areas and there are so many good bars and restaurants in the surrounding area. The staff couldn't have been more helpful on a variety of subjects (from recommending a bus tour to advising on the best time to go to Berghain/Panorama Bar!) I can't fault this hotel in the slightest, it really does live up to all the excellent reviews and I would only ever stay here on a return visit to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “One word : happy !”
Reviews.Author: Chriswillise
Reviews.Content: Came here only couple days but this is a very clean and nice hotel. Room wa not like 5 star standard but it was very comfortable and daily served, clean. The staff were enthusiatic and very pleased with their service. I like the breakfast and will comeback for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, fab and freindly hotel”
Reviews.Author: lilly8484
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Circus hotel for 3 nights and loved every minute of it! The hotel itself is so funky and our room was spotless and spacious. The location is central to everything and has really good access to public transport. The staff were very helpful and always offered advice when we needed it. We will definitely be back and have strongly recommended it to family and friends. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Except for the Room”
Reviews.Author: big_guy_from_NYC
Reviews.Content: My son and I booked a room at the Circus based on the reviews in TripAdvisor. At first we were not disappointed; the location was perfect for a visit to Berlin, and the outstanding staff could not be more helpful and courteous. In fact, the staff at this hotel is as good as any. Ancillary services like laundry and internet were readily available and either free or reasonably priced. Then we went to our room. It was tiny, hard to move around, and had no carpet on the floor (the wood floor shows its age). The room was full of dust, which made sleeping difficult. People with allergies should not stay here. This hotel has a "bohemian" feel to it and it seems to cater to people who liked to stay in youth hostels and wanted a hotel when they got older. Potential guests should be aware of this.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and the best service”
Reviews.Author: kmfalch
Reviews.Content: Excellent service - we where met with a big smile, and when we needed help the staff did their best to find out all about restaurants, tram/bus times etc. We rented bicycles for 2 days. That is the best way to get around in Berlin! The hotel have their own bicycles. You pick them up at the Circus Hostel on the other side of the street. Great breakfast. 8 euro is not much for such a nice start of the day. And the breakfast is until 1pm! We had 2 double rooms (not the smallest) facing the backyard and we got the rooms so the windows where facing each other. That was very nice :) Big bathroom, a lot of space in the room, wide screen tv and ipod docking :) The backyard is perfect and quiet in the nights. You can sit down for a drink or have breakfast/lunch/dinner. When we stayed there it was the World Championship in soccer and they showed the matches on big screen in the backyard. Location is the best! Rosenthaler Platz is very close to a lot of nice streets and places where you have a lot of restaurants, cafe, bars, shops. And is easy to reach the rest of the city from here. If i have to make one minus: The Mojito

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: melindah11
Reviews.Content: Hotel Circus is a real find. It is excellent value for money and we stayed in a Junior Suite which was huge and very clean. The staff were all lovely and friendly. We had a great time in Berlin and Hotel Circus was handy to all the sights with the efficient Ubahn was was right next to the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jgranger85
Reviews.Content: We came across this hotel by chance when I was randomly searching online for a cheapish/nice hotel near the center of town. Our first impression was that it was in a great location within walking distance of Alexander platz (and many of the tourist sites) and that it was staffed by really friendly and helpful people. The hotel is clean, safe and really well designed. We chose the economy double room and it was just perfect for us (a couple). We also really appreciated the hotel's eco values which most hotels don't seem to be interested in. We also dined at the Fabish restaurant/bar that's connected to the hotel - the food was lovely and the service brilliant. Overall, we had a lovely time in the hotel and I'll be recommending it to family and friends that visit Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: TickyMark
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Berlin and we had a hard time finding a place because of the Berlin Marathon which was not our reason for the visit. The Circus Berlin is the city best kept secret, what a wonderful find. Our room accommodation was excellent, rooms are little small however very comfortable for 2 persons, large bathroom with rain shower. This hotel does not have A/C for summer travellers. The students that work the front desk speak English and are very helpful, more than some of the 5 star hotels we've stayed in Europe. The hotel has a wonderful history and it's shared in a great magazine the owners put together, you will appreciate the building even more. The metro station Rosenhaler Plaz is right outside the door and city tram is across the street. Great restaurants all within walking distance. I would love for this to stay as " Berlin's Best Kept Secret " but word is getting out from all of the past guests as being a wonderful gem!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed, comfortable and well located”
Reviews.Author: Ianto999
Reviews.Content: Spent a very pleasant weekend in Berlin with my wife and our friends, chose the Circus on the basis of Tripadvisor feedback and was not disappointed. The hotel is laid back, very well appointed and the staff are without exception friendly knowledgable and helpful. Ate in Fabisch resturant at the hotel on the first night and had an enjoyable and good value meal, spent the following night in some of the great bars and restaurants in Hackesher Markt, easy 10-15 minutes stroll from the hotel (just turn right out of the front door and walk straight on). Would recommend with no hesitation at all, both the hotel and the friendly and fascinating city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Mirellise
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located off a main metro and tram/bus line, making getting around Berlin very easy, yet located just far enough away from busy restaurant or club areas. The rooms are somewhat small, but very modern and quirky - each has it's own personality. The bathrooms are also modern, very clean, with excellent hot water pressure. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly. The wireless internet connection is quite good as well, and there are English and other language cable channels offered on the tv. The hotel is also very focused on being environmetally friendly and sustainable. Overall, this hotel is excellent value for its price and I would highly recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: SarahsBlackEye
Reviews.Content: The Circus Hostel in Berlin is easily the best hostel we have stayed in during our two month trip through Europe. Upon arrival we were greeted with huge smiles and bombarded with information about Berlin and the hostel itself. Check-in was quick and painless and they ask you to go up and inspect your accommodation before they make you pay. Our room was incredibly clean and cheap. 23 Euro for a four person room. There aren't large lockers in the room (at least not big enough to fit a backpackers bag) but there are small ones for valuables above each bed. Downstairs, there is a 'Circus Wikipedia' with collected information from the staff of the hostel about the surrounding area and about Berlin as a city. Each staff member is incredibly knowledgable and friendly. There are several FREE services at The Circus: wireless internet, skype phone, chargers for phones and ipods, free ipod rental (with music already on them). They also rent bikes and smart cars for a fair price. There is a cafe attatched to the hostel that serves cheap breakfast and has a happy hour for drinks between 7 and 8pm with 2Euro 0.5litre Becks. They do sandwiches and dinner menu for fairly cheap as well. There is a bar beneath the hostel that we didn't get a chance to visit, but I hear it's cheap and fun. Next time you are in Berlin - stay at The Circus!

Reviews.Title: “Save the planet”
Reviews.Author: Mattand34
Reviews.Content: This was a very refreshing hotel. The staff seemed be be all on the same page - save the planet from pollution. I was very pleased with the buffet and my room was more than comfortable. The idea that a hotel like this can inspire visitors to accept responsibility for the keeping our planet safe is just great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel....worth every penny and more”
Reviews.Author: dietcokeman1
Reviews.Content: Where do you start with this hotel, it's just excellent.....the biggest credit has to be the staff, very friendly, very helpful,excellent service above and beyond! The hotel is incredibly clean, very nicely decorated, excellent finish all round. A nice bonus to the hotel is the courtyard out the back of the hotel, really nice and relaxing for a nice drink or two. You wont regret staying at this hotel at all, it's location is great for public transport with the U-Bahn station right next to the hotel. To get to the hotel we got a cab from Berlin-Tegel airport and it cost around 20 Euros for the 25 min drive, good value. In a word, stop looking for a hotel right now and just book this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-They get everything right! I...”
Reviews.Author: TokyoEric
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel-They get everything right! I was in Berlin for the marathon & think this is one of the best hotels globally. Rooms are modern & functional. Huge Grohe shower heads start the day off right. Breakfast buffet is great & costs 8 euro for hotel guests. Try the smoked salmon as an extra order at breakfast...really good. Staff were all super friendly & helpful. I ate dinner one night & it was really good-lots of locally sourced ingredients. They had nice live music, usually some kind of acoustic guitar or other instrumental music that started at 10PM. Rooms aren't huge but all have double-paned windows that ensure a quiet night's sleep. They have a great walking guide to Berlin for 1 euro that we found really useful. I stay in a lot of hotels & found this one really outstanding & am looking forward to staying there again. Located at a U-Bahn station and a 5 minute walk from an S-Bahn station so easy access to public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveller666
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews in Trip Advisor and booked based on these. I was not disappointed. We had a large double room and our son had a small single. The rooms were atttactively decorated and were very clean. I picked up soap etc for the bathroom at reception. The bath towels are large but very thin. However they do the job and dry quickly. I liked being able to borrow a lap top from reception. Breakfast was eight euros and we enjoyed the breads, cheeses and fresh fruits and yogurt. We had dinner here one night and the food was very good. The reception staff were were pleasant and helpful.There is also a very pretty court yard garden. I would stay here again. It was September and the weather was cool but it may be a problem in the summer with out AC.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, environmental friendly hotel with good service except for noise.”
Reviews.Author: Bluefish7
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the reviews and ratings at Tripadvisor. Was looking forward to the stay in Berlin. Hotel was easily accessible via subway Rosenthaler Platz U8 line which is just few steps away. However the subway lines in Berlin is massive, unlike the other Germany cities. Requires frequent line changes and to reach Rosenthaler Plat from most places tend to get tiring after a while. The Circus lives up to its philosophy of being environmentally responsible. There's no AC in the room, no mini bar and no bedroom slippers. It's a good thing but these may dampen a tired traveller's spirit especially when Berlin is not in the cool zone (in my opinion) yet. It got a bit warm in some days. The location of our room faced the main room and with opened windows for ventilation, the loud noise from the street, subway trains and street trams were all very audible. We definitely recommend the breakfast buffet (€8). The spread is good and I loved the nicely done hard boiled egg. Wifi broke down for several days during our stay but we could use the computer at the lobby. Slight inconvenience but the friendly staff removed any negative feelings from it. Overall, good stay and added to our great Berlin memory.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: jwa6
Reviews.Content: This hotel really lived up to the hype. Clean and spacious room, helpful staff, good location with restaurants and shops nearby...the list goes on. If you can't afford it, the Circus Hostel is right across the road and looked like a top hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Home from Home in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: IgelEye
Reviews.Content: I was totally convinced by the hotel´s philosophy concerning their environmental responsibility, delicious organic food and wines. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful, particularly Alice and Isabelle, who both speak excellent English. They are clearly happy in their jobs and will always go out of their way to meet the requirements of the clientele, even pre-empting the guests´ wishes!! Our room was modern with a spacious bathroom. The double glazing kept out the noise from Rosenthaler Strasse. The restaurant offers good, wholesome, delicious German food, including Berlin specialities. Again, the waiters are more than friendly. The decor is typically Scandinavian, which gives the hotel a fresh, modern appeal. All the staff we had contact with speak fluent English.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: Joywrk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful. The staff are uniformly professional and helpful. They gave us excellent restaurant recommendations as well as sightseeing advice. We used the bus passes that they rent on a daily basis and found it easy to get around. On the first afternoon we took the 100 bus from Alexanderplatz to the zoo and then back to get the lay of the city, Rooms were spacious and spotless and the breakfast buffet was terrific. One night we ate dinner in the restaurant and enjoyed it very much. We also loved the opportunity to have a drink at the end of the day in the bar. Prices were extremely reasonable. A phone call to Canada was 5 cents a minute. Special thanks to Isabelle and Yael for all the help

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: courteousdave
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, really friendly and helpful staff. A nice bit of music in the bar too! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to rave reviews”
Reviews.Author: Jaytara
Reviews.Content: It's been said before by so many other contributors to this forum, but it bears repeating, this hotel is superb value for money and we were completely satisfied. The rooms at the hotel are slightly more expensive than those at the hostel diagonally across the square but older guests would probably feel more at home in the hotel. At 80 Euros a night for an en-suite double ( terrific shower) it is unbeatable. The U-Bahn (subway/tube) stop is literally at the hotel's doorstep and the M-1 tram is also very convenient for short and medium-range trips if you don't want to walk up and down subway stairs. Taxi to Tegel(TXL) Airport is about Euros 20-22 or you can take the U-Bahn part of the way and then the bus(TXL). Above all though, the service is brilliant, the young ladies at reception are cheerful and a mine of information. I should particularly mention Alice who spent almost 15 minutes with us giving us sight-seeing suggestions above and beyond guide-book material. They can equip you with everything from adaptors to laptops/DVD players and DVDs/Segways, free wifi, you name it !! Also, transit tickets charged at Euros 4 /day compared to the Euros 6.10 that you would pay at the ticket machines, but, understandably, they have a limited stock of these concessional tickets.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely brilliant...........................”
Reviews.Author: rogermb617
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived until the time we left, nothing was a problem for the staff. Service was excellent, the breakfasts were great. There was 6 of us and we had the Junior suites which were spotlessly clean with great showers. They even posted our cards for us. If I go back to Berlin, I would not even bother looking anywhere else. Special thanks to Andrea We still have a lot to learn in the UK

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied all requirements and more.”
Reviews.Author: JennyMiddlesbroughUK
Reviews.Content: My friend and I are independent female travellers in our 70s and have just returned from a 4 day trip to Berlin.This is an excellent hotel, value for money hotel. Underground entrance at the front door! Very good location generally. Staff incredibly helpful and friendly with little extras to make the stay as easy and comfortable as possible. For instance they rent a daily ticket for all transport for 4 euros, The cheapest possible way to travel. Much better than buying the advertised day passes. A free trip to one of the concentration camps although we didn't do this. Everything seems easy to them. Excellent Muesli breakfast for 4 euros or a more substantial one for 8. We were delighted with the muesli option. Nothing seemed too much trouble and each day we had advice and any help we needed. The hotel occupies a very interesting site and the history is worth asking about. I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe the best hotel I've ever stayed!!”
Reviews.Author: monamour7
Reviews.Content: The Circus hotel is remarkably clean, modern, with really helpful and young kind stuff in a perfect location, as the metro station is across the street! They gave as free guide, any kind of information and assistance and they helped is very much as I broke my finger my first day there;) The price was really low for what you take:)I look forward to come back, I wish you had more of Circus hotels in other cities too!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, arty & great location!”
Reviews.Author: JenniferNgn
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel! Rosenplatz Stations is outside, good cafes, supermarkets & cash points nearby. Very central and convenient location. The staff are super friendly, so helpful and attentive. Advise on on where to go out etc. The breakfast, and food at the restaurant is great. There was a live band on one of the evenings. It seemed like some people came to the hotel/bar who weren't staying so that's a good sign. Definately recommend this place again, and will definately be back again in Jan, wouldn't consider staying anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Welcoming, Amazing Staff all witha great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: mikamilly
Reviews.Content: I can not recommend this hotel enough, from the minute we arrived to the minute we left the staff couldn't have been more helpful. We ate at the hotel restaurant on the second night, the food was great, modern German food served with great beer. The rooms are very clean, stylish and simple. As this is an eco hotel there is no aircon or shampoo/soap in the rooms but toiletries are given away free at reception. We will be going back to Berlin and will defiantly be going back to the Circus. (Also forgot to mention the ability to hire smartcars, segways and yoga equipment, laptops and dvd's with players free to guests)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: KiwiUKtraveller
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a great stay at the Circus. The staff were very friendly and helpful - with lots of great tips for places to go. Lots of great sights are in walking distance and the cheap travel tickets available from reception were a really nice touch for the days when you were too knackered to walk anymore. Having entertainment at the hotel was great and the food was pretty good too. Only improvement would be to have a fridge in the room, other than that it was pretty perfect. Comfy bed, clean generous spaced room, amazing shower (if i could have taken it with me I would have). Would def'ly recommend anyone stay here and def'ly ask for some evening entertainment suggestions from the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, no air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: joybell27
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for five nights from 28 June. The hotel is in a great location right at the Rosenthaler Platz U station. This made it very easy to get around on public transport and it was within walking distance of Unter den Linden. The hotel was in an old building in East Berlin that had been completely renovated. Everything was modern and in good condition. The beds were comfortable and the shower had great water pressure. The hotel had lovely toiletries that were not in the bathroom but available free from reception. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet had a good range of high quality organic food and at 8 Euro per person was reasonable value. The hotel had excellent free WiFi. My only negative was that we were in Berlin during a heat wave and there was no air conditioning. Our room was very hot and stuffy and we were given a fan but it did not make much difference. I would happily stay here again but not in the summer time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: 2010Dubllin
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Circus Hotel to a friendly welcome. When we went up to our room we were delighted. Beautiful decor and lots of space. Bed was very comfortable. Room and bathroom were spotlessly clean. Hotel was very central and easy to get to using the U-Bahn which was just outside the entrance, Food and drink delicious. Excellent service and helpful, polite staff. Will definitely return here!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous; Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: MikeRidley
Reviews.Content: First rate hotel with a great location and wonderful staff. Nothing but good things to say. Others have commented that the green philosophy means no AC. Didn't brother us because the weather was moderate. Could be an issue in the hot weather because the windows open on a busy, noisy Rosenthaler Platz. However, in every other dimension this place was a real find.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent overall but no AC!!”
Reviews.Author: VM13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the middle of July. On check in the staff were so friendly and helpful. The rooms were spotless and beds comfortable. The only downside was that there was no air con and it happened to be ROASTING over there mid July. So it was difficult to sleep.There is a fan in the room but didn't really help. Also request a room facing courtyard as it is quieter especially if you want to leave the window open! The trams pass by the window of the exterior rooms. I would stay here again as the location was very good and it was easy to get there from the airport. Maybe I wouldn't travel in July again but overall we had a great time, loved Berlin so much to do and see. Definitely will return to the Circus!

Reviews.Title: “The best!”
Reviews.Author: ScarletBea
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, and I will definitely stay there when I go back to Berlin. The location is very good, just next to a U station, with lots of nice cafes and shops around. It's 2 stops from Alexandra Platz, a major transport hub. The single room was one of the biggest I've stayed in, extremely comfortable, clean and modern. I don't eat much at breakfast, so it was good that there were several breakfast options at different prices. The staff was all extremely friendly and helpful, ready to chat with you or leave you alone, whatever you prefered.

Reviews.Title: “Totally lived up to its reputation”
Reviews.Author: Propner
Reviews.Content: They could not have been kinder. It was very laid back but very efficient. Nice touches like breakfast until 1 pm. Free Internet. Cheap International phone calls. Great little restauraunt and courtyard. Everyting worked just like it should and they were very tolerant of our rather large rable. Great Location. All in all a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Ran away to the circus”
Reviews.Author: roberciku
Reviews.Content: Oh joy oh joy, the perfect hotel in the best location. Berlin in hotel form, all about the vibe and the service and the forward-thinking approach and great at all of them. Three day stay here, mid-World Cup, as a decompression after sorting some personal stuff out down in Sachsen. It was like playing for three days in Europe's best playground, an environment that lets you run wild in it. When everything comes together, this is what it feels like. The cafe area in the morning is sooo relaxed, you almost can't shift your bum, coffee and papers on the go. Yoga is available too, as are various tours, and it's also possible to rent bikes and smart cars. The concept is fresh and sound, couldn't imagine staying anywhere else next time I'll visit Berlin, which'll be soon. Oh wait, I heard about another hotel with an in-house design studio not too far away, mmm...

Reviews.Title: “perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Jambo5
Reviews.Content: My family and I have just returned from staying at the Circus Hotel. We were in Berlin for a wedding so there were many other members of our family booked into the Circus. They amazingly didn't make any mistakes with all the bookings (all with the same surname). The Staff were extremely helpful indeed. The hotel itself is in a great area where there are lots of bars restaurants and art galleries and a very easy walk to museum island. The underground is just outside the front of the hotel and the taxi rank is just around the corner which was so handy as there were so many of us coming and going all the time. The hotel is very modern and clean our room was spotless every day. It can be a little bit difficult to get to sleep if you are in a room facing the road but that is expected in a city, especially as there is no air conditioning when it is hot, but I thought that was very good policy for a hotel that is environmentally friendly. I also had my sons birthday and the hotel baked us the most delicious chocolate cake ever! we had a little drinks party in the courtyard before going out and the staff were very kink and patient with us (there was about thirty of us!) . I will most definitely stay at the Circus Hotel the next time I go to Berlin. Thank you to Stephan, Felix and the lovely kind girls at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent with a couple of notes.”
Reviews.Author: EdmontonFritz
Reviews.Content: Stayed in an appartment for 4 nights which was spread over 2 floors in the inner courtyard of the hotel. Like everyone else has already mentioned, everything from cleanliness to the breakfasts was excellent, if you are light sleeper, and you will need to keep the windows open on the hot days, even the inside courtyard can remain noisy with guest DJ's and karaoke singers until well past midnight from the bar. The inner courtyard is like a big echo chamber. One other little note, the subway passes that they can provide, which are a really good deal, are not always available since they only get a certain amount...we missed out on a couple of days. Lots of great eating options nearby, accommodations like these usually cost a lot more!. For the best lattes on the planet try nearby Bonanza Coffee Heroes.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons service at Motel 6 price”
Reviews.Author: travelPAUSA
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Circus for six nights. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We had an issue with our room the first night and they were extremely accommodating. I agree with the previous positive reviews, and will add that we have stayed at many of the finest hotels worldwide, including Four Seasons, Ritz Carltons, and other top hotels. The service here rivals any of them, and the accommodations, while not elegant, are large, clean, and lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I had known there was no A.C., otherwise terriffic.”
Reviews.Author: Cakabr
Reviews.Content: This wonderful place, besides the terriffic,helpful staff,has the great bonus of being a totally green, ecologically sustainable hotel. The only downside to that is that there was no air conditioning, so you might want to stay somewhere else if it's a hot summer. Otherwise, we loved it. The Restaurant downstairs was also particularly good.

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday!”
Reviews.Author: ilovetravelling_bcn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Circus Hotel at the end of July 2010 for 6 nights and we have very fond memories. The location is unbeatable; the room was fantastic and the staff really friendly and helpful. We also had breakfast and a couple of dinners downstairs at the Fabisch restaurant and we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff, great location and good value.”
Reviews.Author: yano23
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in June, mainly on the strength of TripAdvisor reviews. The hotel is very well located in a nice area of East Berlin and right next to the Rosenthaler Platz Underground station. 2 stops takes you to Alexanderplatz which is a main interchange hub. The rooms are clean with modern furnishings. However be aware that there is no air conditioning! It was very hot when we were there and we were initially given a room facing out on to the road side. Rosenthaler Platz is very busy with traffic and noise all night, so it's not easy to get a good night's sleep with the windows open. The next day we requested to move to a room at the back facing the inner courtyard. This was done for us with no hassle and the next 2 nights we had a very quiet sleep with the windows open. If it's hot when you go I'd say it's worth requesting a courtyard room in advance, albeit our room was slightly smaller than the original one. The service is top notch. All the staff on the desk are very friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. You feel that they know good local places and interesting stuff to recommend. There are some great shops, bars and restaurants in the local area especially along Kastanienallee. The Prater Beer Garden is well worth a visit! The hotel also has produced a brilliant free jogging map which was great as I didn't have to work out my own running routes. You can borrow books and I think even laptops from reception. Breakfast in the hotel was good and although the bar/restaurant is not the cheapest there is always a good atmosphere here. Free wifi is also available in the lobby and bar but I don't think it works up in the rooms. The original Circus backpackers hostel is located just across the square. Make sure you don't get them mixed up! In my opinion this is just about the perfect good value hotel in a pretty cool part of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: sassyscameron
Reviews.Content: this place was soooooo very good! me and my friend loved the free laptop borrowing with free internet. its in a really nice part of east berlin. all staff were mega friendly and helpful. we were very sad to leave! we wanted to stay forever! thumbs definately up!

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located hotel with excellent, friendly service - ask for a room at the back!”
Reviews.Author: TravellingWilbury74
Reviews.Content: The Circus Hotel is in an excellent location in the Mitte, or central, district of Berlin and is easily reached by rail from Schoeneberg airport. We spent the first night of our three night stay in a double room located at the front of the hotel, facing out onto Rosenthaler Platz. The rooms are very tastefully decorated and much thought has been given to the environmental impact of the hotel trade. Toiletries are not automatically provided in the rooms but are available free of charge from reception. This does have the effect of making you think about how much you need. The receptionist explained to me that they have to throw away the toiletries left in a room when a guest departs, even if they have not been opened so this small gesture goes a long way to minimise unnecessary waste. The one downside of the double room was that it faced directly onto the main road - a busy junction with 24 hour traffic and public transport (both U-Bahn and S-Bahn are directly in front of the hotel). The heat in the capital city was incredible during the time we were there, reaching temperatures of over 35 degrees during the day and rarely dropping below 25 degrees at night. Thus our dilemma: open the window to let in much needed air (no air conditioning is another feature of this eco hotel) and listen to the S-Bahn trundling past all night; or close the window (excellent sound-proofing) and swelter? We went with the open window option and didn't get much sleep. We spent the last two nights of our stay in a suite. This was a bigger room towards the rear of the hotel and so not affected by noise from the road - equally warm however, although reception will provide an electric fan if you ask. Breakfast each morning is not included in the room rate but is good value at €8 for the large breakfast with unlimited choice from an excellent continental buffet of fresh breads and pastries, fruit, cereal, yoghurt, cheese, cold meats, tea, coffee and juice. You can also opt for a small breakfast for €4 with a number of options such as croissant and coffee or fruit and cereal, for example. The hotel also serves meals during the day and on an evening. We enjoyed the evening meal we had, particularly being able to sit out in the courtyard to the back of the building. The staff are welcoming and efficient and are also very knowledgeable on Berlin so do pick their brains for tips, advice and suggestions. Overall, I would certainly recommend this hotel - the only downside being the choice between the heat and the noise, neither of which the hotel was responsible for!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Circus”
Reviews.Author: ClaireJessica
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous 4 night stay at the Circus in June. The location is great - the hotel is a 5 minute walk from the Hackescher Markt and there are plenty of great restaurants within easy walking distance. It's also very easy to reach by public transport - the Rosenthaler Platz U-Bahn station is right outside the door. The staff at the Circus are top-notch - very welcoming and friendly. The hotel also offers some great extra services - they can rent you a public transport pass for the day, which is a lot cheaper than buying one yourself. You can also borrow a Berlin-based DVD from the front desk to watch in your room for no charge. We ate breakfast at the hotel's restaurant Fabisch each morning. It was fabulous - a buffet full of healthy, fresh, organic food. And compared to the price of other breakfast buffets we encountered in Europe, it was a steal at 8 Euros pp! The only negative to mention is that the hotel has no air conditioning. During our stay in Berlin, the weather averaged in the mid-30s and our first night was rather uncomfortable as we had to have the windows open to circulate air, but the noise from the street was very loud. Luckily, we were able to move a courtyard-facing room for the remainder of our stay and the heat was much more bearable as we didn't have the noise from the street to contend with and could keep the windows open with no problems. The best tip I could give would be to request a courtyard facing room if you wish to stay in summer! All in all though, the Circus is a fabulous hotel and the best value for money we encountered during our Europe trip. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “If only all hotel's were like this”
Reviews.Author: Trev_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Circus for 4 nights and loved it. Great hotel with friendly staff, funky interior, very clean and comfortable. Just the way all hotels should be. Breakfasts were also great as well and don't forget to try the cocktail lesson.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for a Berlin stay”
Reviews.Author: Tiunda
Reviews.Content: Rather easy to reach with public transport. Very friendly staff. You can borrow guide books and rent tickets (!) in the lobby for local transports. This is cheaper than to buy a BerlinCard to get around. It is a noisy area and if it is hot (no air condition) make sure that you book a room on a top floor or towards the courtyard, so you can have the windows open. They have no own restaurant so you will have breakfast in Fabisch (they are connected physically). Here our experience is that you can be invisible for the staff or that they can give you corrections for pinpoints. Not so fun.

Reviews.Title: “Deservedly No. 1 (If only every hotel were like this...)”
Reviews.Author: A_D_L_10
Reviews.Content: In a word, faultless. Stayed for three nights and loved every second of it. The hotel's location is excellent, in a trendy, central and safe neighbourhood. My room (a junior suite) was a good size and spotlessly clean, and the bed very comfortable. The buffet breakfast was good value too. However, it was the friendly, ever-helpful staff that really made the place. Their positive, "can do" attitude meant that nothing was too much trouble (including a 2pm check-out on my last day). Yes, it was very hot; but I had two quiet fans in my room and for me the temperatures were not a problem. I travel a lot, am choosy about where I stay, and have enjoyed hotels all over the world - ranging from back-packer to the uber deluxe. 'The Circus' is one of my favourites, incredibly good value and I can't wait to return to both it and the incredible, vibrant city of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best.....”
