Reviews.Author: wgomm
Reviews.Content: This is the first hotel review I have bothered to write simply because most hotels we have stayed in to date are part of large chains..the client is a number among numbers. The CIRCUS HOTEL BERLIN is certainly different. Staff are very pleasant [all of them], seem to really enjoy their work, great recommendations for tours and activities in the city. Very well located beside public transport. Great shops nearby [not department stores] . Food in hotel excellent particularly breakfast.Cant wait to return! G & M Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with good location and value”
Reviews.Author: chop144
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Circus Hotel in June for 3 days during a 10 day trip in Central Europe. The hotel is perfect for couples and for groups of friends. We stayed in a regular room that was plenty big for 2 people. The rooms are well decorated and very functional. The hotel does not have A/C but you can check out a fan at the desk. Although our room was not ready when we got to the hotel they locked our bags up for us and we were on our way. Some great amenities that are offered is the metro pass that you can rent from them, a lot cheaper then if you bought them on your own as they buy several for the entire month at a discount and they have free internet. I highly recommend this hotel. It is one of the best I have stayed at in Europe and for the value it cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, friendly and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: supersiz
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for one night. Was very friendly and comfortable - although I my friends who were on the road side said it was noisy. This was only a problem as the hotel is an eco hotel and so doesn't have air con (meaning you have to have the window open). I was on the courtyard side in a single room with velux windows and found it quiet . The staff were all really friendly and helpful, and the breakfast was also very good. We enjoyed the bar in the evening for a quiet drink and the free wifi was very handy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel as a base in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: SouthernBrit
Reviews.Content: We reserved our 2 rooms about 2 months before the trip -- good job we did as it is an extremely popular hotel and I don't think we would have got rooms if we had left it any later. We arrived quite late and Isabelle on reception couldn't have been more cheerful and helpful and checked us in quickly. My wife and I had a double economy which was an adequate size and very clean. The bathroom was sparkling clean and everything worked. Unfortunately, because of the location of our room (facing Rosenthaler Plz) we had to have the window closed all night to shut out the street noise, especially the trams. I would think that a room facing the courtyard would be fine. Breakfast was excellent and well presented. Good value at 8 euros. Selection of delicious breads (baked on the premises), cold cuts, cheeses, eggs, cereals, fresh fruit salad, teas and coffee. Breakfast staff were efficient, pleasant and made us feel welcome. The bar in the evening was not exactly busy (effect of the World Cup?) but the beer was good and service good. Shame about the music, though, very monotonous techno.... The location is excellent -- Rosethaler Platz U bahn station is right outside, tram M1 and M8 also. Easy walk down to the river and Museum Island. In summary -- good value for money, great staff, nice clean rooms, good breakfast, central location. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: paddy1mac
Reviews.Content: Great stay at the circus hotel the staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is very central with the U Bahn and tram just outside the door. The free use of laptops was very handy we won tickets to the ballet at the Berlin Oper through a hotel draw which was a lovely suprise. The only negative aspect we found was that the breakfast buffet was not covered which was open to the outside. Overall we we had a very plesant stay and would highly recommend to anybody staying in berlin

Reviews.Title: “Back again, happy again.”
Reviews.Author: MonkeybearNYC
Reviews.Content: Last time our room was pink and red, this time yellow and black. The same super-friendly service, beautiful restaurant with restful courtyard, great location, elegant and comfortable décor and bath, and free wi-fi that works every time. Last time, our room faced the street, which offered some traffic noise; this time we faced the courtyard, which offered some restaurant noise. Again, don't expect a/c, even in hot weather. And sure, the double economy room is very small, but as New Yorkers we’re used to tight, well-designed spaces. I effused about this hotel in my August 2009 review, and nothing's changed. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “The hype is worth it ...”
Reviews.Author: Apuleius
Reviews.Content: I loved the Circus. I was travelling with my 85 year old mother and we received the most wonderful warm welcome. The staff really go out of their way to assist you. We had a twin room facing the inner courtyard so there was no issue with noise. We enjoyed the courtyard, the bar, the free wifi, and a great buffet breakfast. The location was ideal - very easy to reach all the main sights and great transport links. Great local neighbourhood too with some interesting smaller museums and memorials. I also endorse the Brewer's walking tour which was great - I'm not sure if they've had other 85 year olds take part! Thank you to all the staff - it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value but bring Ear Plugs”
Reviews.Author: gazzerooni
Reviews.Content: I have to say from the get-go that I am really glad that i stayed here. The Circus is in a great location. I do understand why the past couple of reviews were a little negative so here is what I think. The Good Stuff: Location- The location is great- the trams run by outside and the underground stop is literally outside the door. We found that we ended up walking everywhere as a lot of stuff was within a 15-20 minute walk- i.e. Brandenburg Gate, Alexanderplatz, Oranienburger Strasse, etc The Staff: I found everyone I dealt with to be very professional, friendly and very helpful. All staff were always happy to help and very pleasant with everyone. I felt like they cared about me which is a good feeling. Cleanliness: The whole hotel is very clean. The lobby area is clean and modern, with a lovely outside area where you can eat or have a drink. Our room was spotless too with enough towels etc. The Cost: This is why this hotel is so highly rated- I paid €90 per night for out twin room, which is amazing when you think of the fact that you are staying in a great location in a large European capital city. I know you can get more luxurious hotels for more money but if you are going on a city break to see that city, then this hotel is perfect. The Bad Stuff: Room Storage: I was surprised to see that there wasnt anywhere to put my clothes. I was able to hang up a few shirts, there were 8 hangars for the two of us. We both left our cases on the floor with most of our stuff in them, which I would have preferred not to do, especially as were on a 4 night stay. Noise: We stayed on the first floor facing the street which was fine. However as there is no air-conditioning we left the windows open. The noise from outside was quite loud- drunk people at night, trams early in the morning, street cleaning etc. Luckily my room-mate had brought earplugs so we used them. I am a heavy sleeper so i slept well but my roommate is a light sleeper and he didnt enjoy his sleep as much. I think if you are a light sleeper, ask for a back room. Air Conditioning: I am very surprised that there is no air-con in this hotel. it was very warm a couple of nights and we had to leave the windows open which is not so good when there is outside noise. The hotel reception gave us a fan on request which did help but its not the same. I liked this hotel and as the time passed, I realised I liked it more and more. We had breakfast every morning and it was always good- very fresh. We had drinks a couple of nights and the cocktails were great, as was the friendly barman. I brought my laptop and the free wifi was very handy too!! I would recommend this hotel for anyone wanting a well-located hotel that saves you money to spend on dinner and tours. If you are looking for luxury or a hotel with all the frills, maybe book the Kempinski instead.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: Scottie23
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in great location and very good value for money. Staff could not be more friendly or more helpful. One minor complaint is that a double room is a bit small and not helped by the layout e.g. there are two nice comfortable chairs but they are under the TV (which is wall-mounted) and not very practical to sit on. But I am being picky here as overall the room was very nice and the bathroom was very spacious and nice with a lovely, large walk-in shower. My other complaint (and this is my main one) is that even though it wasn't terribly warm at night outside, it was very warm in the room and uncomfortable for sleeping. The hotel is eco-friendly and therefore has no AC (we couldn't keep our windows open since our room was at the front and when they were open the street noise was a bit much) and I only found out when I mentioned this upon checkout that I could have requested a fan! So if you stay at this hotel during the warmer months request a room at the back so you can open the windows and not worry about noise or ask for a fan but otherwise I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel, nice staff, great food, but #1 in Berlin? Um, no.”
Reviews.Author: mattkorey
Reviews.Content: I am a little perplexed by this hotel as I had read the hype for a year before staying here and just don't really get it. How in the world this is so highly rated is still a mystery to me, even after staying there. Specifically, I found it to be very much no frills, no a/c (ouch, in the summer), and in a very loud area, especially if you have to sleep with the windows open. Luckily, they found a fan for me or I fear it would have been a two-star experience. As has been said, the staff are very nice, and I do admire their green aspirations, but it is a hotel after all, and it is just not a pleasant experience to try and sleep in a very hot, loud room. Not for me anyway. On the plus side, my room service dinner meal was one of the most delicious things I have ever eaten. Really amazing, fresh, very much homemade, organic and where the green concept is really quite successful. I can't say as much for their breakfast buffet, which was surprisingly spartan. However, you can pay extra to get eggs and juice and such, which are in fact quite delicious. Looking at this hotel through the prism of value for money I can see the accolades I guess, but one should never even try to stack it up against any of scores of other higher priced hotels in Berlin which really put it to shame. Just know what you are getting into and set your expectations accordingly and you'll be fine. It would also be good to be a very heavy sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel so much during waking hours.”
Reviews.Author: RestlessTravelBaron
Reviews.Content: This hotel is hitting on all cylinders- service, rooms, location, price, breakfast, very progressive and green- PROVIDED that during summer when you have to sleep with the windows open, you have an interior courtyard room. We loved everything about this hotel until we went to bed- trams, motor bikes, drunk guys having a great time till all hours kept us up- and then on one night, the tram line maintenance at 4 AM with track grinding- unbelievably loud and smelly. Don't get us wrong, we would still highly recommend staying here- it is a great hotel- the staff are absolutely wonderful- just make sure you get a room that overlooks the interior courtyard in the summer- the windows are very sound proof, so this is not an issue in the fall, winter, or spring when you would sleep with the windows closed. Please don't let this review turn you away from this hotel- it really is special and wonderful- the staff really is superb- friendly and very informative- just get an interior room, and everything will be PERFECT. And be sure to take Terry Brewer's walking tour- the staff will also recommend it. This is a 7 hour walking tour through central Berlin conducted by Terry Brewer, a cantankerous Brit who spent significant time in Berlin with the Foreign Office from the 60's onwards. He can be testy and a bit of a school master as the day wears on, but Terry has an encyclopedic mind, and though you will cover less ground than the bus tours, this is a tour where you will pick up far more about Berlin than on the buses. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

Reviews.Title: “In Berlin, this is the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: my3grls
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I stayed four nights at Circus Hotel and it was marvelous! We were greeted warmly, given the info about no toiletries (and if you needed them they were available free at the reception), a map of the area, how to get around on the underground and trains, etc. If you have a rental car, ask in advance about reserving a parking pass. We were given a parking pass for our stay and parked our car at no charge on the street nearby. Our room was a junior suite for 100 Euros per night (smaller rooms were all booked). It was beautiful and faced the courtyard, so it was very quiet. We had the windows open at night and when the maid saw all the "cotton" that floated in (from a certain type of tree), she provided us with a fan in case we preferred that to the open windows! It was rather warm, so we did both :) Beds were comfy, TV was nice, free wifi was fast and dependable, bathroom was beautiful and there was a laptop safe as well. We "rented" the underground/train/bus passes every day for 4 Euro each, and quickly knew our way around the public transit. The hotel is within walking distance (10 minutes) of Hackisher Markt, where there are lots of restaurants with outdoor seating, plus shopping. Not much farther is Alexander Platz. Both are accessible via public transport as well, of course. We had a nice breakfast at the restaurant daily, and had dinner there once. Very nice! We walked up Rosenthalerstr. the other direction one night to find a nice place for dinner and there were many, many options! I highly recommend Circus Hotel when you visit Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel in former East Berlin with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: GreatSouthernLand5
Reviews.Content: This hotel was good value for money in Berlin and offered a refreshing alternative to typical mid-sized hotels. Appreciated the brochure with information on the area and the history of Rosenthaler Platz and every member of staff at the Circus was super friendly, unlike any other hotel we have been. Rooms were simple and clean without any frills like mini-bars or bathroom products. However, they also did not have any air-conditioning which while in keeping with their environmental policy, would make things very warm in summer particularly as you can't really open the windows because of the noise outside. Very close to U-Bahn and S-Bahn so made transport very easy. Found restaurant options nearby a bit limiting but maybe we didn't know exactly where to go. Overall the Circus was really unique and the staff were obviously trying very hard to make this hotel a special place to stay for each of its guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great vibe”
Reviews.Author: LeeAnneLonndon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Circus at the end of May. We were very pleased with the location. Our double room was very clean and nicely decorated. The bathroom was large. Everything worked and we had no complaints. We borrowed a lap top on a couple of occasions and also ate in their restaurant which we found to be reasonably priced. I highly recommend this hotel. It has everything you need at a price that is right!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent,cool vibes,cool people,delicious food.........”
Reviews.Author: AdamCarlisle
Reviews.Content: Me and the missus stayed there recently and i can honestly say its one of the finest hotels ive stayed in,easy to find,in a great location,the ambience as soon as walking in was nice,chilled electronic vibes filtering through the speakers with Ipod listening staions in the bar,the staff were extremley freindly and efficent without being pushy and you can tell that they all care about the image of the hotel in the way they deal with you,the 'green/organic' element i loved,the decor of the hotel was modern yet simple and as for the resturant,the food was amazing,so much so we ate there every night,the breakfast was either set or buffet,which was an extra cost but the choice and quality of food was very high,all fresh local produce and again i loved the 'sustainable' concept,this place was everything i expected and more,in my opinion,if you stay travel to Berlin,you have to stay there!! PS £90.00 eur for a double room of the standard we got was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “All hotels should be run like this one”
Reviews.Author: alathays
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights in The Circus Hotel and I only wish it could have been more! Wonderful staff, great location and excellent facilities. The hotel buy monthly transport passes and then rent them out to guests. We had a three day pass but as we left at midday they only charged us for two and a half days. WiFi access was excellent and they even lent us a bang up to date netbook to access emails etc + printed out our boarding passes for us. Food was excellent and the hotel bar was warm and inviting. They even have a useful video for your iPod to help you find them from the airport. The multi lingual receptionists were very helpful and gave excellent advice on local restaurants etc. One last tip - check out the little Curry Wurst bar beside the hotel, it's excellent value and very friendly. Great city and great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “brilliant, great service, lovely hotel - agree with everyone elses opinion”
Reviews.Author: tompel
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 nights in the incredibly lovely Circus Hotel in Berlin. Ended up going out 1 day early due to the BA strike and stayed in the 'apartment' 110 euros and wow - what a place! For 110 E you get a firm, comfy bed (2 x single size), lounge area with TV, ipod docking station, radio, decent kitchen with cooker, fridgee, microwave, and bathroom. Its on the corner of 2 mains roads and despite the very good triple glazing, there is still a faint hint of traffic noiss in the morning. If you are a very light sleeper bring ear plugs and an eye mask. We then moved into our pre-booked toom (90euros a night), which overlooked the central courtyard, a decent sized room for a capital city in Europe. Rooms were very newly decorated and comfortable - nice firm beds. great power shower in a very clean bathrooms. Incredibly helpful, but relaxed staff at the front desk. This isn;t a big hotel with a concierge, but very kind, and capable desk staff who will assit you. I have nothing bad to say about this hotel and would stay here agian in my next visit. It's a 10 mins walk to Alexanderplatz and all U-bahn connections (and the great Fat Bike Tours), its just around the corner from superb restauants (like Mister Vuongs) all in all just great. I have only ever given one other hotel a full 5* (have rated 24 or so now) - i.e. I am fussy, but I have nothing to fault with the Circus.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: BDG618
Reviews.Content: Anticipating our stay at The Circus Hotel - rated #1 on Trip Advisor of all hotels in Berlin -- it seemed impossible that everything everyone said about it could be true. But it was! The management, attitude, care/concern for each guest demonstrated by "The Circus Team" (and they are really a team) is a case study on how to run a hotel. The owners are present, the staff, exceedingly helpful and energetic, go out of their way to make sure you accomplish all you want to see & do in Berlin (an extraordinary city), rooms were spotless, all organic breakfast buffet excellent quality & selection, great location with plenty of options for restaurants, entertainment, and access to public transportation. Go to Berlin; stay at The Circus -- you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Best boutique hotel in Berlin.”
Reviews.Author: IgalFeuerstein
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Berlin with my wife and 10 years old daughter. We stayed at the Circus for 4 nights and enjoyed this cute and lovely hotel. Great service and hospitality. All stuff are young and fluent English speaking. The rooms are quite even though we had a nice room facing the busy RosenthalerPlatz. The windows are double glassed and well isolated. The location in the Mitte was just perfect. Almost all "must see" attractions are in a walking distance from the hotel. The "U" underground station is 10 steps from the hotel door. These guys will pay attention to all your needs. They have umbrellas in the lobby for rainy days (we had one such a day...). The free Wi-Fi in the rooms, lobby and restaurant was very convenient. They even have some nice Apple MacBook laptops to borrow in the lobby. The breakfast in the hotel is delicious, fresh and organic. I recommend to have it for only extra 4 Euros. (you can have a "all you can eat" buffet for 8 Euros). We paid 90 Euros per night. Great value! We definitely will return to this hotel on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Just a small tip for the hotel”
Reviews.Author: missbAmsteram
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a long weekend break to Berlin and lovely stay at the Circus Hotel. True, the staff was brilliant, the location couldn't be better and the room was lovely. My boyfriend and I couln't stop talking about the friendlyness of the Berlin people! But perhaps I had my hopes up too much or am I a bit fuzzy about smells.. but I found the hallways of the hotel just not fresh..it's clearly they cannot open a window in the hall or ventilate.. they do mention they do not have airco on purpose but surely some sort of ventilation would be advised.. now everytime you get out of the elevator or stairway you are hit by a odeur of body's..;( We had great great tempreatures this weekend ut I cannot imagine how the smell must be in the middle of summer after the city has heaten up.. But this is just a small tip for the hotel.. the hotel itself is really one of the bet budget hotels I have everbeen!

Reviews.Title: “Could not do any better than the Circus in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: ChrisandDave0
Reviews.Content: The Circus is a great service-oriented hotel that is both baby friendly and in a good location. The hotel offers an excellent selection of services like loan laptop computers that can be taken and used within your room, metro passes that can be rented for a day or so and front-desk staff are very informative/knowledgeable about the Berlin area. Breakfast is a must - its fresh and has an awesome selection of locally-sourced and organic food. The restaurant was also baby-friendly at dinner time with good quality and well-priced meals. The room was clean and modern, with an unusual open plan set-up of having the double bed against one wall. Bathroom didn't have a bath, but was quite spacious. The mix of timber floors and tiles made the room a bit echoey at times, and with a small baby it was a bit of a worry for us that we'd be keeping everyone awake.

Reviews.Title: “Best Staff in Europe”
Reviews.Author: AZTennisGuy
Reviews.Content: I traveled around Europe for about 6 weeks and this was my favorite place to stay. It's in a great location and the staff was extra friendly and helpful. Each evening they suggested great bars and clubs. Everyone who was staying there was talking about how much they enjoyed their stay. I'm planning another trip in November and I will be going back to the Circus.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with the friendliest staff”
Reviews.Author: SaraMurdoch
Reviews.Content: We booked the Circus Hotel based on trip advisor reviews and were not disappointed. We booked a junior suite which came with a balcony. The room was clean, bright, modern and comfortable. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Loved the fact we could borrow a laptop at no cost to use the internet. The hotel is perfectly located for transport links but also not too far away from the centre if you choose to walk. We had a fantastic few days in Berlin and hope to return - if we do we will also return to the Circus Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Construction. Great otherwise”
Reviews.Author: BeachesBoatsBars
Reviews.Content: If you read prior reviews they are spot on I don't think you will find a better combination of neighborhood, quality accomadations, overly helpful staff and location for the price in Berlin. Unfortunatly right now there is construction on going in the adjacent building so at 7:30am I was awoken to some sort of grinding/vibrating noise coming through the wall. Not something I want to deal with on my vacation. My recommendation is wait for the construction to be done then is will be to the place to go to.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service,good location, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: LondonJazzman
Reviews.Content: We booked in here on the basis of some good previous reviews on Trip Adviser and the recommendation in Time Out Berlin 'shortlist' guide. We were not let down -very friendly and helpful service throughout our four day stay, well appointed bedroom, filling breakfast (not your full English of course) and attractive dining, bar and relaxing area. In particular, the location at Rosenthaler platz with U bahn stop right by hotel and in easy walking distance of Hackescher Markt and Alexander platz was ideal,and once you got to know the U bahn, S bahn, tram and bus routes you really appreciated the location even more, as virtually everywhere you could want to reach was easily accessable. Good choice of excellent restaurants around Kollwitz platz in Prenzlauer Berg realtively close (pleasant stroll or quick tram ride) -we particularly liked the food and the atmosphere at the 'Gugelhof' restaurant. And if you're into jazz, the Bflat club is just down the road! finally, we noted that the hotel was supposed to be pasrticularly favoured by the young and trendy. In fact, it was also favoured by the older brigade (cultural and energetic) like ourselves .

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: WorldFeet
Reviews.Content: This hotel was more than we imagined, the room, staff (thanks for the great tips, the free walking tours, maps, everything!), localization and lots of facilities!

Reviews.Title: “all is good”
Reviews.Author: fairtrader
Reviews.Content: We will definitely go back to this excellent hotel. A good location for public transport, or you can easily walk to the Museum Insel etc. in less than 30 minutes. There is some noise from traffic, but it is normal for a city. Our double room was not huge, but it was well thought out and had everything we needed. The bathroom was larger than average and the shower was very good. Weleda toiletries are available from the reception and a hairdryer (a proper one, not the usual wall fitment) is provided. The whole ethos is green and ethical - how refreshing. As mentioned by many others, the staff are exceptional and seem to enjoy their job!

Reviews.Title: “How do they do this for the price?!?”
Reviews.Author: EuropeanTraveler09
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Circus offers more bang for your buck than anywhere else we stayed in Europe. The hotel staff are by far the most friendly and helpful that we encountered on our entire trip. The lobby has a charming restaurant which provides a great breakfast in the morning. The location is great for getting to all of the major cites. I would not look any further if you are planning a trip to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Raffasworld
Reviews.Content: The Circus Hotel is probably one of the most pleasant hotel I've ever been. I booked because other reviews and I was totally happy about. Pros: almost everything. let's start with the building, the room was spacious enough with the square's view. Very silent and clean. Front desk very kind and helpful. Everything is super clean and new. the location is perfect, in the old East berlin, the subway stop is just outside the hotel but it also very nice to walk in the area. we also ate once at the hotel restaurant and dinner was very good. Location and price are simple convenient. Cons: difficult to say... probably the breakfast, despite being good, I think it was little bit pricey for what you get. anyway the area is full of cafe, bar and restaurant. The Circus is the best!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, excellent, friendly and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: EEC9
Reviews.Content: I can't recommend this hotel highly enough. I travel extensively throughout Europe on business and am forced to stay at large faceless generic hotels. I had forgotten that staying in a hotel could be a pleasure and it's been a long time since I encountered such helpful and friendly staff. Every single member of staff couldn't do enough to help and all seemed genuinely happy to do so. Such a refreshing change! The rooms are spotless and comfortable. The hotel restaurant is very good and has relaxing areas to chill out with a drink after a hard days sightseeing. Please open up more hotels across Europe! Only minor issue was traffic noise. I am a light sleeper and woke during the night due to tram or metro noise. If you have the same problem with sleep, ask for a room facing the courtyard or perhaps it would be quieter on the top floor (We were on the 2nd floor).

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: sccpm
Reviews.Content: We just spent a most pleasant stay at this hotel. Our room was very clean, though a little small. I would go with a larger room next time and pay a little extra for it. What makes this place so special is the cheerful and helpful staff, especially Isabelle. It is hard to resist their smiling faces and they are genuinely interested in helping you with anything.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden, gem. Terrific staff, Comfortable, and convenient at a great price.”
Reviews.Author: Dewey29
Reviews.Content: The Circus really lived up to its recommendations. We had a thoroughly enjoyable stay. The room was a little small but very comfortable (plenty of towels, extra pillows) and clean as a whistle. We faced the rear and it was extremely quiet. I’d request that because the front of the hotel is on a busy street (Rosenthalerstrasse) almost on Rosenthalerplatz, but we heard nothing. Since the weather was sunny but cool we found no need to open windows. Without air conditioning and windows open I’m not sure of the noise level. The staff was wonderful, the best you’ll ever find. They were always cheerful and helpful with special requests, directions, maps, suggestions, etc. The hotel will lend you a laptop and free WiFi connection and provide transportation passes at reduced rates. The restaurant downstairs served excellent breakfasts and we also had occasional late evening snacks. Just perfect. The location was most convenient just two U-bahn stops from Alexanderplatz (East Berlin) and connections everywhere. The neighborhood is interesting; you can walk to Alexanderplatz, the nearby marketplace and even to Unter der Linden and all the major buildings and museums. At 90 euros the Circus can’t be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Pros definitely outweigh the cons”
Reviews.Author: PigletNewMarket_MD
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Circus Hotel for a week in late April. We found the staff to be very helpful and eager for the most part. A packet of information welcomed us to our room, and gave us the history of the building and surrounding area. We had a "double room" at 90.00 euros. The room seemed somewhat small. There was enough room to stow luggage and walk around the bed and to the bathroom, but nothing extra. I would consider a "double economy" next time for 10 euro/night less. The room was nicely decorated and had plenty of functioning windows, a flat screen TV (very handy as we traveled during the Iceland volcano explosion), and functioning safe. The U-bahn is just outside the hotel door, as well as a taxi stand, and the S-bahn is right across the street. The biggest drawback was the noise level outside the hotel. Rosenthaler Platz is a bustling area with restaurants and outdoor cafes that stay open into the wee hours, as well as a street car that screeches and the hotel is on the ambulance and fire truck route. I admire the Circus for their efforts in being green and not having air conditioning. It was one of the reasons I chose the hotel, however the days were somewhat warm and for air circulation at night we needed to keep a window open. Our room faced the platz so sleeping was often difficult. Lastly, I cannot rave enough about the restaurant Fabisch in the hotel. The seating area has tables and chairs as well as couches and overstuffed leather chairs where one can sip an espresso and watch the world go by after a busy day of sightseeing. Breakfast was marvellous with choices from fresh baked croissants, jam, and delicious coffee to the buffet with breads, cheeses, meats, fruit, multiple types of cereal, yogurt and a juicer with fresh fruit and veggies. There were up to date books, magazines and news papers in the restaurant. As well there was often entertainment in the evening. DJ and finger foods to acoustic guitar etc... Really excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in almost every way”
Reviews.Author: PuffinPuffin
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. The staff were so delightful and looked after us so well and just seemed to love their jobs. Our rooms was lovely - stylish, comfortable (it's very hard to get nice twin-bedded rooms in hotels and this was outstanding). We did suffer a little from not being able to open the window at nights as we faced the street but the windows did keep out the noise. Breakfast was totally delicious and we just didn't want to leave. How could I stay anywhere else in Berlin - it's just a joy to be in a hotel where they have thought of so many small things with such care.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel !”
Reviews.Author: KatieNewry
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights with my husband in one room (junior suite, a bit bigger than standard bedroom)and daughter,son-in-law & grandson under 2 years, in bedroom next to us. The most friendly, cheerful and helpful hotel staff I have ever met. Location only 2 tube stops from Alexanderplatz, the main starting point for most excursions. The tube station is right on the corner and easy to use - anyway, hotel staff will tell you exactly how to get about. Hotel will lend you a baby monitor, laptop, umbrella on a wet day, mobile phone, should you need them !! Breakfast was very good, a good selection at the buffet or you can have a French breakfast or a German one which are cheaper. We had internal rooms that looked into the inner courtyard, so were undisturbed by noise.These rooms were also tucked away round a corner at the end of a corridor which was great for us with the toddler sleeping from early evening. I loved Berlin city itself, really calm and laid back place. We also explored the immediate surroundings of the hotel and liked the area very much. It is realtively easy to walk from the hotel into Alexanderplatz. My husband has walking difficulties but was able to walk with me down Rosenthaler Street to the river and over the bridge to Museum Island. There are many restaurants in the locality catering for all tastes and pockets. I would like to return to Berlin and I would definitely stay in the Circus Hotel. I can't recommend it strongly enough!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, But a Little Noisy”
Reviews.Author: alidoremi
Reviews.Content: Our first night's stay was on a Saturday. I don't think Berlin goes to sleep on the weekend; our hotel room faced the main street (an intersection) and we were constantly awakened by street noise, sirens, etc... The windows in our room were not as insulated as those in my husband/son's room. At one point my mom and I got up at 3:30am just to peer out the window and check out what was going on. Lots of young people still out, the cafe across the street still open. Fortunately, Berliners work during the week and the late-night partying wasn't as late the following nights. The hotel staff was excellent, very helpful and accommodating. The breakfast was good but not as wonderful as in other German lodgings; the hotel prides itself on offering 'bio' or organic food. We had dinner there one evening; excellent.

Reviews.Title: “We loved The Circus Hotel and would highly recommend it”
Reviews.Author: gbroadhurst
Reviews.Content: The Circus Hotel in Berlin is fantastic. We loved it. The location is good, walking distance to Hakescher Markt, Alexander Platz, the Brandenburg Gate plus Kastainalle and also well connected with U-Bahn, Trams and Buses. Our room was clean, spacious and well decorated and overall nice and quiet. The staff can't do enough to help and are extremely helpful and friendly. There was live music in the bar and the restaurant food was good and reasonably priced. There is a great little bar just round the corner called Mein Haus am See, which is open 24/7, literally, and feels like a home from home. Go to Circus Hotel if you are in Berlin, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Did not want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: a766
Reviews.Content: Spotlessly clean, wonderfully located, fantastic staff, gorgeous food, great bar / restaurant with music each night, every assistance offered and always with a smile. Can't wait to go back to Berlin to do all the things we didn't have time to do on this trip, and will definitely be staying with The Circus on our return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic Hotel, Brilliant Staff & Superb Value”
Reviews.Author: Djag79
Reviews.Content: I don't know if there is much else I can say that hasn't already been mentioned in previous reviews. The customer service and the way the staff make you feel valued was the main thing I appreciated from this hotel. The hotel room was spotless, furnished to a high standard and cleaned every day. The location of the hotel was perfect due to the subway being right outside. Add this to the fact that Berlin has a super efficient transport system, it means that you can get to all the touristy areas very quickly. One small tip I would suggest is to take 5 minutes and read the paperwork that the hotel leaves in your room. This way you should be able to make good use of all that the hotel has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: FREDDIE88
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at the end of march. Agree with all reviews on here. Excellent staff, clean room, nice bathroom and good breakfast. Ideally situated near the u-Bahn. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, trust the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Kathrynp
Reviews.Content: I took my husband to Berlin for his birthday last weekend. We'd never been before, so had no idea where to stay/ go/ eat etc. and having seen the excellent reviews for The Circus, decided to give it a go. I'm so glad we did! We arrived at the hotel at 10am on my husband's birthday, but check-in was not until 2pm. My husband had contracted a nasty bug and had chronic sickness by the time we arrived at the hotel. I explained this when we arrived, and the concierge was straight on the phone to the cleaner, asking that our room be turned over immediately so we could check in early. I was so grateful for this, and it's just one example of the level of service that comes as standard. That night we were unable to go out, so I ordered room service, and drinks from the bar - how refreshing that to have them in your room is the same price as you'd pay in the bar and restaurant - no different, rip-off menus, or hidden delivery charges. Our room was very clean ad stylishly decorated. t had two large windows facing the main road, but the sound proofing was excellent. Yes at night you could hear the occasional tram, but not enough to wake us up, and we're both light sleepers. The location was perfect, a light stroll to the nearby museums, and it was lovely to learn more about the history of the Jewish quarter, and of the hotel building itself. The staff were all extremely helpful with restaurant recommendations, and nothing was too much trouble. I would recommend The Circus again and again, for its excellent value, service, and commitment to running a lovely, great value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Makes you want to come back to Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust099
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in which you can feel young again. The young, eager staff keeps everything flowing in the right direction. The rooms, restaurant and bar give a welcome and comfortable feeling and beckon you back from the streets of Berlin. We ate all our meals at the Circus because of ease, taste and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been any better”
Reviews.Author: Mike_1112
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a sight seeing visit to the city and boy what a great hotel. Before flying I downloaded a short video from the hotel’s website on how to get from the airport to the hotel using local transport however on arriving at the railway station we found the video was useless as the authorities had decided to do some repair work on the line we needed. The railway staff were not very helpful about how to get to our destination so I called the hotel and got a most helpful member of staff who gave me an alternate route. On arriving at the hotel we were giving an apartment, which was first class, thank you very much. Our stay in Berlin was excellent and this was in the main due to the very helpful staff who took time to speak to you and treat you as a real human being. They gave us the benefit of their local knowledge, which is always very helpful. The hotel is about 10 yards from the underground station and from there you can reach any part of the city within minutes and being German it ran like clockwork and the trains were clean and tidy. Would I stay here again? You bet! Would I recommend this hotel to others? You bet! One final comment, why can’t other hotels be like the Circus Hotel Berlin?

Reviews.Title: “wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: vwcamperLakeDistrict
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with the hotel The staff were friendly, helpful and informative.. The hotel was spotless and very quiet during the night allowing us to have a good nights sleep. We used their Travel Pass which only cost £4 a day per person to travel on all public transport. This was very useful because Berlin covers a large area. We found excellent restaurants in the vicinity of the hotel although the hotel sells good food. We decided to have breakfast in the hotel which consisted of cereals, nuts,yoghurt, fruit, cheese, meats and bread. This was ample food, enough to last us until our evening meal. We would strongly recommend this hotel to other visitors to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandeeebaby
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for myself and my boyfriend for a short trip to Berlin. We had a Double room, and were very pleased with everything during our stay. The location was perfect for sightseeing, and the website gives excellent directions on how to get to the hotel from the airports/train stations. The staff were very friendly, and eager to help, giving us recommendations for restaurants and places to see. There were lots of little extra touches, such as being able to rent travel passes, laptops, bikes etc etc. The breakfast and room service was delicious, organic and fresh, the cakes are divine! The hotel itself was clean, modern and green. The bedroom was bright had lovely decor and the bathroom was immaculate. My only gripe was that I was assured we would have an ipod dock in our room, but there were none available, and our room faced the main road - so it was a little noisy, but nothing you wouldn't expect from a city, and would not spoil anyone's stay. Overall a very pleasant experience, which was made even nicer by such friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in the heart of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: helsbells75
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Circus hotel during a 4 day trip exploring Berlin. We picked the hotel due to the great write up on Tripadvisor, and have to agree with all of the postive things said on the site. It's an excellent base for exploring the city. The U Bahn is literally on the doorstep, and the S Bahn is a pleasant walk away. Restaurants & bars are everywhere, and the helpful staff will direct you where to go depending on your taste. The free WiFi was great, and the rooms were clean and new with a fabulous walk in shower. I've never experienced such helpful and knowledgeable staff - all of the tips they gave us were good. We went on the 'free' (although you have to tip) walking tour that left daily from the hotel, and we were so pleased we did it - very informative and not at all cheesey. If you're planning a trip to Berlin, I couldn't recommend The Circus Hotel more highly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in every sense!”
Reviews.Author: roughpatch
Reviews.Content: This place really deserves its ranking - it's one of the nicest places i've stayed in, staff are great, location is ideal, bar is really cool. Top class

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: boris_tyumnev
Reviews.Content: This is the great hotel. Staff was ready to help inany time with any question! Fine restarant. Free WiFi. We've stayed in economy-double - fine room, not very small, not very big. Location is great: 5 seconds from U-Bahn station Rothentaler plz. There was one small minus - tram on the street. My wife woke up at the morning because of it, but I don't ;) Generally - really great hotel!! Definitally, I recomend it and I would stay here if I come to Berlin once more!

Reviews.Title: “Most Helpful Staff Ever”
Reviews.Author: FMAY
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Circus Hotel for 3 nights in March 2010. The hotel itself was all you would expect from a modern German hotel-ie good rooms ,houskeeping, quality of public spaces etc. The reception staff at the hotel are outstanding-very friendly and so helpful. I did an online checkin with no fuss at reception. They all spoke english and their advice was spot on.

Reviews.Title: “The Circus Hotel really is as good as its TripAdvisor reputation!”
Reviews.Author: rb1703
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at The Circus Hotel in late February, and are very pleased to report that it's one place that certainly does live up to its TripAdvisor reputation! The hotel itself is very easy to reach on arrival in Berlin. We flew to Schoenefeld, and from boarding the train at the airport, were in our room in no more than 35 minutes. Rosenthaler Platz U-Bahn is literally on the doorstep, which is minutes from Alexanderplatz, from where connections to anywhere in the city are plentiful. Rosenthaler Platz itself is a bustling junction, full of eateries, interesting and quirky shops and cafes and transport links. Trams run in a couple of directions from directly outside the hotel if the U-Bahn doesn't go where you want to (easiest way to get to Friedrichstrasse was on the M1 tram we found) We stayed in a Junior Suite on the third floor (301), overlooking the courtyard, which was lovely and quiet (as requested when we booked). The room was spacious, spotlessly clean, very well appointed, with an extremely comfortable bed. Worth particular mention was the brilliantly spacious bathroom, which had one of the best showers I've ever experienced. The room itself was full of quirky and individual design elements which had clearly been very cleverly thought out, and made the best possible use of the space available. The staff in the hotel were - without exception - friendly, helpful and informative with no question too trivial to answer. All of course spoke perfect English, which put our pidgin German to shame. The bar/restaurant on the ground floor, Fabisch, has to be one of the Circus's best assets, and in paricular, the coveted window seats are perfect for watching the world go by on Rosenthaler Platz. We had breakfast in Fabisch on a couple of occassions, and the choice was apetising, plentiful and fresh. The Circus is the perfect base for exploring all the many delights that Berlin has to offer, and the hotel itself was one of the highlights of our stay. We would consider staying here again without hesitation if another weekend in Berlin was in the offing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: kayasurf
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay and very close to everything that Berlin has to offer..

Reviews.Title: “Another great hotel found from Trip Advisor”
Reviews.Author: Scampi_Chips
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Circus. Booked direct with the hotel and flew with Ryanair to Schoenfeld. The hotel website gave clear instructions as to how to get from the airport and these were a great help. Hotel was in a great location next to the U-Bahn and the staff were friendly and always on hand to help. The room was clean and tidy and anlthough small was adequate enough as we never intended to spend much time in it. As mentioned in other reviews the shower was amazing. One point if you are booking direct via the hotel website. They only take your card reference as security so you pay the bill at checkout. I wasn't aware so had a shock when the owner gave me the total, though I had been sleep drinking/eating! :-) We hired travel passes from the hotel, they buy monthly ones, at a cost of 4 euros per day. While better value than buying from the station, I never once got the tickets out of my wallet as no one ever checked them? Either it was the time of year or our German counterparts are very trusting! :-) We ate at the hotel once for breakfast and once for an evening meal. The breakfast initially seemed a lot at 8 euros, and we decided to eat at Starbucks, but then you realise that the cost actually isn't that bad. The evening meal was superb and I recommend the braised beef cheeks in red wine. We also ate in Genderanmarkt (sp!) which is a lovely setting and on the last night I got a little worse for wear in a bar called Newton's! Fully recommended, just take lot's of cash, but hey you are on holiday! :-) Overall a fantastic stay, walked loads, saw even more helped by a friendly nation. We will be back and will not hesitate to book in at the Circus again.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Jossko
Reviews.Content: Good location in Mitte (right on the U-bahn) warm, clean, welcoming and with very helfpul staff, we really enjoyed our stay in the Circus Hotel. The junior suite was well appointed with a comfy bed and an ipod docking station/radio. We rented discount travel passes. They made everything very straightforward. We only found one downside: there was only one credit card terminal for paying at checkout, so we had to wait about 20 minutes in reception before leaving, so in future I'd pay the night before if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: richard_lennon
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel through lonely planet & trip advisor. When we arrived we were pleasantly surprised with the location of the Hotel - right beside the U-Bahn (underground). The hotel is very modern, with extremely helpful, friendly staff. A large open reception area welcomes you to the hotel with english speaking staff full of helpful tips for navigating the city. The hotel Bar/restaurant area is well adorned with unusual furniture & paintings. Very chilled out music welcomes you back to the hotel for an evening drink! The Rooms are a little small, but very comfortable with a spacious bathroom and window overlooking the central terrace. Overall the Circus Hotel comes highly recommended for centrality, amenities and friendliness.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!!”
Reviews.Author: lutonluddites
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel.U-Bahn station right outside hotel and only a few minutes walk to centre of city anyway.Very modern,helpful staff,clean comfortable room,close to bars restaurants and transport connections.Great choice of breakfast and served until 1p.m.Very adult allows night owls a lie in with no rush.Would recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, friendly and excellent location in the heart of East Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Janyvo
Reviews.Content: The size of the room may not be very big, but it is simple and practically designed which we found it very cozy. The bathroom is not only modern but spacious too with big windows overlooking the hotel court yark. The inhouse cafe/restaurant is a great place to relax at the end of the day. The breakfast buffet was good quality and very healthy, but wish they can include some hot stuff too (instead of having to order them as extras). The services at the reception is always courteous and informative - cannot ask for better! There is a spare laptop can be borrowed if you need. The location is easy to get around day and night. Sometime, instead of taking the subway at the front door to Alexanderplatz, we just took a stroll down the different streets (all toward the Alexanderplatz direction), and in 15 mins we would be at the square. From there, you can take various hop-on-hop-off buses to tour around Berlin. We will certain visit this hotel again next time in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel. Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: LaurenKSheffield
Reviews.Content: Reasons to stay here: - The hotel is in an excellent location. It has a U stop right outside the door. It's close enough to walk to the main attractions if you want and has lots of nice restaurants near by! - The excellent service. Everyone on reception was happy to oblige with any request- saw other guests borrowing items such as plug adaptors etc at reception. They can provide you with day passes for 4Euros a day rather than 6 odd Euros on the undergrounds and trains which we used for 2 days. When we were checking out we asked how far it was to schoenfeld airport and they provided us with a printout detailing exactly what trains to get at what time and what platform. Very helpful! -The rooms- very high quality for an excellent and very fair price! Ours was spacious had nice furniture and was permenantly warm- very important if you are in Berlin in February. And the shower....amazing. Just what you want after a day of sightseeing in the snow!! The only downside of this room was the noisy tram line just outside our window. But i'm a light sleeper so this affected me probably more than it would the average person. However the excellent quality of the room/hotel far outweigh this small criticism. And a little extra... -Look at the information printouts in your room on your arrival. We went to a really really nice and very reasonable japanese noodel restaurant (Makoto or something like that) they reccomended in the prinout. And it was really close by (5ish mins walk)...also another fantastic restaurant we discovered was about 3 doors down from the japanese place on the same road just on the corner. It does mainly pasta and it was the best pasta me and my boyfriend have ever had. Delicious and very reasonable. - If you enquire to stay here and they say theyre full keep trying. They had 2 of our 3 nights free but I kept enquiring and we managed to get a booking for the 3rd night after someone cancelled. It was worth all the emails, enquiries etc! I think this is a very buys hotel so book early if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in the hot summer night!”
Reviews.Author: leanjellybean
Reviews.Content: We had the Junior Suite for 3 nights in august. The room and bathroom was very nice, but the highlight was the big balcony. Since the junior suite had free room-service we used the balcony both for drinks and dinner. The staff were very sweet and helpful, and the location is great!

Reviews.Title: “Best value-for-money hotel I have stayed in in Europe”
Reviews.Author: scubagirlUk
Reviews.Content: The Circus Hotel Berlin is a great hotel and fully deserves its number 1 spot in the Tripadvisor ratings of hotels in Berlin. The hotel has a wide range of quirky and original amenities and services available to guests including laptops, ipods and skype phones to rent, jogging routes planned for you and even yoga classes recommended at a venue nearby (you can borrow yoga equipment from the hotel). The staff are incredibly friendly and helpful in a non-patronising way and will try to help in any way possible. It's in a great location; you can walk to a lot of areas of interest but there is also a U-Bahn stop right outside the front door. The hotel bar/restaurant is (like the hotel itself) stylish and modern; it doesn't feel like a typical hotel bar but more like a normal city bar. There is a small evening food menu and the restaurant/bar is also where the breakfast is held, which is composed of German specialities and is fantastic. One small thing is that I would have preferred it if the cost of the buffet breakfast was included in the room cost as "extra costs" like breakfast all add up. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again next time I am in Berlin. It's a hotel that's striving to be different (it prides itself on being a "green" hotel, supporting the concept of sustainability) and that gives it in my opinion a unique selling point. The amazing value-for-money and high quality of service tops it off!

Reviews.Title: “Eco Chic, Great Locale”
Reviews.Author: lizzy_in_the_sunset
Reviews.Content: My hubby & I stayed @ Circus in the end of summer & very much enjoyed staying there. The beds were large & comfy, the bathroom was chic. Breakfast was good, although beware Berlin bees in the end of summer. They are persitant & agressive when eating outside. We got excellent suggestions on great food nearby & fun activities. Def do the walking tour. The location is amazing, as is the Berlin U-Bahn/S-Bahn system. Definitely rent the transit pass & let them explain how to ride the train. We got around the city in the blink of an eye & it seemed safe, efficient & timely (hmm, the Germans are good @ that, huh?) We enjoy a more backpacker crowd, so we spent a few nights in the Circus Hostel Bar. Fun crowd...Hasselhoff Shrine... The hostel seemed like a fun, clean & reasonably priced place to stay as well. Def recomend to anyone traveling in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “All hotels should be like this one”
Reviews.Author: everton1Uk
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best short stay hotels we have ever visited. It is centrally located, yards from the underground, trams and taxis. The hotel is designed to a very high standard for the price with modern fixtures and comfortable beds. It has its own restaurant serving simple and high quality food with a lovely organic breakfast buffet. The staff could not have been more helpful. They were all young and enthusiastic and knowledgeable and nothing was too much trouble. They spoke good English, looked things up on the Internet, suggested ideas for areas to visit and places to eat and seemed genuinely pleased to help us and to chat. Free wi-fi too. Shame there isn't a Circus hotel in every city in Europe!

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to its Tripadvisor reputation”
Reviews.Author: DerekCarver
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel on the basis of Tripadvisor reports and found it to be excellent. It was modern, comfortable, extremely friendly staff, very reasonably priced and with a U-bahn station right outside the door. Sadly our enthusiasm did not extend to the restaurant kitchen where the quality of what was on your plate (which was not inexpensive) did not live up to the high quality of the service. But the cakes were good. Never mind. We highly recommend the hotel - just eat somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location, service, and amenities!!”
Reviews.Author: Gretchenst
Reviews.Content: This hotel met and exceeded our expectations. My young adult children chose the hotel and I thought it looked good. It far exceeded what I expected. We had a double room and a single room and both were comfortable with modern furnishings and nice bathrooms. The breakfast buffet is definitely worth the extra $. They rent out notebook computers, DVD players and even day passes for the subway. All of the things they say on the web site are true. When my daughter and I found that our flight to JFK had been cancelled 2 days and that we would be stranded in Berlin, we couldn't wait to get back to the Circus hotel. There are many nice restaurants in the vicinity. Don't miss the CURRY 122, best currywurst and fries and you can buy a beer next door and take it into the diner. Very fun!

Reviews.Title: “probably the best staff in the world---”
Reviews.Author: MonaghanWylie
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed for three nights in january the staff could not have been more helpful,the hotel was very central everything was walkable.The restaurant was very chilled and rooms very clean and shower great.Loved Berlin the art galleries and designer boutiques would go again and explore more.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel. Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: robEK2
Reviews.Content: What else can I say. Great hotel, very modern, with a real focus on being eco friendly. Really friendly staff, great rooms and really reasonably priced. Food menu is okay but as per the previous reviewer it is a little limited and perhaps catering more for the German market rather than international travellers. The hotel is in a great location. The best walking tour company meeting point is about 10mins walk away, and there are loads of traditional and stylish bars and restaurants in the area. The tapas bar YoSoy is on the same street and is very good. I'll definitely stay here again. For an extra 10 euros it's a good idea to upgrade to a junior suite for the extra space.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location and staff...”
Reviews.Author: JamesProgressive
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel and I could not believe the value. Food menu a little limited, but overall one of the best hotels I have stayed in (for £'s spent). This is eco fiendly hotel, which also makes you think about the waste when you stay with the mainstream. I believe it is officially 3*, but I would suggest more 4*/superior We stayed in the junior suite - room 401 and whilst it was small (for a suite) it was more than adequate. Probably recommend that you request this room during Summer as the large balcony was of little use when the temperature outside was -10 and a wind chill of -18. Decor was fab, as were the staff throughout the 2 night stay. We'll definitely be back to this hotel for a short break when the weather is warmer!

Reviews.Title: “diamond wedding celebration with our german friends”
Reviews.Author: annwynn
Reviews.Content: My husband &two friends stayed here &enjoyed our stay because all the staff were so friendly &helpfull, the restaurant was nice although a limited menu, we did eat there but we did find a nice Italian restaurant also a nice Mexican restaurant.nearby The rooms are very modern clean &comfortable . The breakfast room is pleasant &in the summer you could sit outside .the hotel is very central you can walk to some of the sites . AnnBowker LLandudno North Wales

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: Fortamsterdam
Reviews.Content: We saw this hotel rated nr. 1, checked availability and saw a very reasonable rate and decided to look no further. They didn't disappoint. The location is perfect. We advise to take a look at Prenzlauer Berg area, just north of the hotel, we found it to be the nicest area to visit. The hotel feels warm, clean and very welcoming. Breakfast buffet was a great start of the day and very very filling. Great great shower in the bathroom and it was very quiet at night. Excellent price/value. We can recommend this hotel to everyone visiting Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: BeachCove
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Circus Hotel for 3 nights just before Christmas. We chose the Circus after reading all of the posotive reviews on tripadvisor and we were not disappointed. On arrival we found that the staff were very friendly and helpfull. The hotel is ideally located with the metro station just outside the hotel! The room was very clean and modern and had a fabulous rain shower in the en- suite, a great way to start the day!! We would definitely stay here again when we return to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: gigiof
Reviews.Content: Perfect everything. Go there

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in berlin!”
Reviews.Author: ScreamingAbdabs
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at the Circus Hotel in Berlin. The room was very clean, and stylishly decorated, the shower was great too! The staff at the reception were always very friendly and helpful, nothing was too much trouble for them. Breakfast was just right, we also ate in the restaurant on two evenings, enjoyed a lovely wiener schnitzel and german beers. Can't fault our stay at all. The location was very good, and it was great to be in the old east side of the city. The only minor criticism was the driver of the mercedes who picked us up, pleasant enouhg but felt he was slightly perturbed that we didnt speak german. But never mind. We'll be back to the Circus one day!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - loved it”
Reviews.Author: stewartmck77
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel, my partner and I stayed in the premium double room. The location is excellent, so easy to get to from the airport and it is so central and easy to get to all the major sights. The hotel offers a travelcard for the ubahn that you can hire each day which is a great idea. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Lovely people and very welcoming. The room was immaculate. Toiletries were very nice. The bathroom had the best shower I have ever used. The breakfast is an additional 10euro but it is totally worth it as the buffet is excellent quality and very filling. All in all a great experience and I will go back next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very good staff”
Reviews.Author: StrestitutSydney
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights, I enjoyed the breakfast, bed very comfortable and the view of my room was great.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with fantastic staff.”
Reviews.Author: Wendy S
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 2 bedroomed apartment which was spacious, attractive and clean with a great bathroom and additional toilet. It was always warm and cosy despite the snow and extremely low temperatures outside (-14c) throughout our stay. The hotel is in a great location - you can walk to the majority of Berlin's attractions or there is a U Bahn stop right outside. The outstanding feature of the hotel is the level of service. Without exception everyone was friendly and extremely helpful and always in such a relaxed and unstuffy way. Travellers true needs have really been thought about. For example, there are lap tops to borrow without charge, docking stations in rooms and prepared directions to the airport etc. A really relaxed and attractive hotel with great service.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend to all!”
Reviews.Author: JLNairn0803
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a road trip through Germany for 10 days, begnning in Berlin. Initially, I was overwhelmed with the many decisions that come along with selecting a hotel in Berlin - location, price range, etc etc. After reading these reviews, we couldn't resist giving it a try. WOW! Both my husband and I travel extensively, but we just loved this hotel. We arrived about 9:30am from our transatlanic flight, and the staff stored our luggage in lockers so we felt 100% comfortable that it was safe! The staff was truly wonderful, and they gave great directions and suggestions very time we asked. The Rosenthaler Platz metro stop is literally right out in front of the hotel, which is priceless! They have many free amenities, including free laptops to borrow! The room was very modern and cleaned spotless! They made is clear that they are fully commited to ethical and green hotel practices and very proud of it! It made us feel even better about our selection. There was not a single thing we would have changed about our room!

Reviews.Title: “The Circus”
Reviews.Author: JulianoP
Reviews.Content: great hostel! nice breakfast, clean rooms and good stuff!

Reviews.Title: “Everything Written Here is True”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller540
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Circus Hotel. Everything said on Tripadvisor is true. The hotel is wonderful! The staff is super friendly and helpful; the rooms are extremely well designed; the restaurant is sophisticated; and the location is perfect for exploring Berlin, especially the former East Berlin. Can't wait to return to Berlin and the Circus.

Reviews.Title: “Could not be better - excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: ajmull
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in Dec with 10 year old son after reading Trip advisor reviews and was more than happy with everything. Positive memories (in no particular order) 1 Free laptop with wifi which we were able to keep in the room 2 Free DVD player and dvds (all German interest films) 3 Exceptionally helpful and groovy staff - no question unanswered 4 Great location next to Underground station which is 2 stops from Alexander Platz - from where you can go almost anywhere 5 Spotlessly clean room (we had a junior suite) with superb shower 6 Breakfast looked ok - but we opted for cheaper options within a few mins walk , such as sister place called Circus Hostel 7 Food and Wine in restaurant good 8 Daily travel tickets can be bought at 4 Euro per day - full price is 6.10 Euro 9 Books and newspapers in foyer 10 Walking tour from hotel was fantastic - really informative guides and good way to meet other guests 11 Good value - 98 Euro per night for Suite Berlin is a great city to see and remarkably cheap compared to London, Dublin or Paris- eating out was superb value. In summary - will go to Berlin again and most likely go to Circus next time as well. Its not a luxury hotel and thats not what gets it the good reviews - rather its the combination of chic, value for money and customer service

Reviews.Title: “Excellent would stay again”
Reviews.Author: jredfernBath
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the good comments on this Hotel but would also like to add that we booked the airport car to pick us up, it was great, driver waiting holding up our name, lovely smooth ride in a large Merc and it only cost 5 Euros more than the taxi back to the airport. The staff at this Hotel are very helpful,the rooms clean and in good condition we had 2 junior suites,food good we ate the first night in the restaurant and breakfast on 3 days of our stay, the location is excellent we walked to everything,

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional boutique hotel. Very clean, lovely staff and SEGWAYs!”
Reviews.Author: MsFastidious
Reviews.Content: This is an exceptional hotel. My main priority is cleanlisness and it was very, very clean. White sheets and towlels. No carpets or excess other furnishings. The room was light and airy with modern and sparse furnishing and interesting art. The lovely staff were helpful and knowledgeable. The hotel restaurant is similarly well designed: stylish, modern but comfortable and warm, very clean and very pleasant. A good selection of English and other daily newspapers is available free of charge to read in the restaurant (including the Guardian). The buffet breakfast (£8) is fresh and tasty and definitely worth doing. Good coffee, yoghurt, fruits, muesli, meats and selection of homemade breads. The enormous jar of gourmet hazelnut chocolate spread was great too! We had dinner at the restaurant for one evening and it was fine but a little more expensive. We appreciated the free WIFI and the loan of an adaptor for our phone. AND we had a marvelous time hiring their SEGWAYs and exploring the city for the bargain price of £11 per hour!! Note that a deposit of £500 is required. I also appreciated their environmental policy eg: complimentary shampoos, soaps etc are available on request to minimise waste; jug and glasses for tap water supplied in rooms. The location is OK. It was very close to an underground subway station and the area seemed fine. This hotel is No 1 in Berlin for sound reasons!

Reviews.Title: “Great facilities, great food, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Pavement-Walker
Reviews.Content: This modern hotel is very well furnished. We were in a double room, with large bed made from two large twins, with individual duvets. We had good lighting, some chairs, desk, tv. Well equiped shower/toilet. We asked for a quiet room and got one, facing onto the inner courtyard, on the second floor. This hotel goes to great lengths to help - there are guide books to borrow, things like telephone chargers, notebook computers (wifi throughout the hotel). They will arrange bike, Segway (!) and Smart Car hire, get concert tickets etc. All the staff spoke good English and were helpful and pleasant. The hotel makes a serious attempt to be "green", and sources food locally and seasonally where possible. If this matters to you, it can be read about. If it doesn't, they don't make a fuss. We ate at the hotel one evening, the food was very good indeed. There are various breakfast options, but if you have time, as we did one morning, the buffet (8 euros in Dec 09) is fantastic. Such good food, the local honey on the real bread was a treat in itself. If you have a heavy day of sightseeing there are lots of places to eat on the run in Berlin, including a new deli, Luigi Zukermann, just a few metres down Rosenthaler Strasse from the hotel. The hotel is in a section which was in East Berlin, a section with an interesting history (the hotel provides 10 pages of local history if you are interested). Berlin is still very much a building site, so, for example, there is a tram running down Rosenthaler Strasse which should take one nicely into the centre of Berlin, but due to roadworks, it stops not far away and a bus replacement service operates. To get anywhere by tube, it is always necessary to change, usually at Alexanderplatz. However it is not that far to walk to Museum Island from the hotel, as we did on the first day. This was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldnt hesitate to stay at this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: gloopus
Reviews.Content: The Circus really helped make our Berlin holiday. We stayed for 9 days in total and it was like being at home. All the staff were fantastically helpful, answering all our questions and making recommendations we regularly took them up on. We advise hiring bikes from the sister Circus Hostel and exploring Berlin by bike, along with one of the great walking tours offered by brewersberlintours.com We miss The Circus already.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most friendly ,helpful hotels ever”
Reviews.Author: jrnewb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my son at the end of November We were going to stay in two single rooms but were kindly given a two bedroom apartment. Everyone was friendly, helpful. The beds were comfortable and everywhere is spotless. Really close to a train station and about 10-15 minutes walk from museum island. This hotel is all you need as a base for visiting the city. Don't miss the Neue Museum, absolutely stunning[ if you are into architecture} We wouldn't hesitate to recommend the hotel No wonder it is number 1

Reviews.Title: “great, cosy, friendly, top location”
Reviews.Author: johanndepoar
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Circus make the difference- friendly, happy, funny, and helpful. The location is great, close to the center but on the fringes of Berlins alternative district. Great eateries and bars nearby. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, average restaurant (service)”
Reviews.Author: catlover1234
Reviews.Content: Not much to fault at this hotel, friendly hotel staff, they would do anything for you. Unfortunately a "bad" experience in the restaurant Fabiche which is hotel owned. We ordered the day menu and got a totally different plate, this was not noticed by the waiter. When I spoke to him about this he seemed surprised and did not seem to care alot. He said he could give me the plate at a discounted price or else I'd have to wait 10 more minutes. I opted for the latter. When they came with the requested meal it seemed they had used food that was given to me on the first plate, in a smaller portion than I had originally received. During this all restaurant could not care less and don't seem professional. A real turndown. The breakfast (8 euro) consist of nothing more than a few bread rolls, some meat, and some slices of cheese of which I took the last one and was not refilled for the remaining 30 minutes we stayed there. It was only 9.30 am and the breakfast "buffet" is served till 1 pm! Also take note juices are not in the buffet (only 1 free glass) if you want more you'll have to pay for it. As such are eggs, etc... A real shame. Coffee and water is at your disposal as much as you want if they don't forget to refill. Overall the hotel is very good, modern and new. The restaurant is a negative experience but this should not be reason to not visit this hotel as price/quality is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Worth visiting!”
Reviews.Author: pellegrina_leone
Reviews.Content: Ok, it's not an accident that Circus Hotel is the 1st rated hotel in Berlin! We stayed for 3 days in a junior suite. The room was spacious, modern, with great colors, comfortable bed and trendy furniture. Everything was new (it's been only a year since Circus Hotel opened) and cozy. The bathroom had good size and it was clean like the rest of the room. Circus hotel is situated in the centre of Berlin, in Mitte, which is very convenient. They offer a lot of different services like room service, laundry service, I-pod, internet, sightseeing and others. Many of them are for free. The breakfast wasn't including in the price. The cost is 8 Euros per person... not great value for money... they have very good quality products but there are just few of them and they do not offer anything hot. Moreover, the orange juice is excluded from the amount of 8 Euros! There numerous bakeries where you can have a delicious breakfast for 3 Euros or less. The staff was exceptional apart from a mistake they did with our reservation. When we made the reservation we asked for a junior suite but at the time was not possible to book one so we booked a double room. When we arrived, they accommodate us in a junior suite WITHOUT informing us! So, we only realized the fact in check-out when they asked for more money than we had agreed! The 98 Euros per night was a good value for money for the junior suite but that does not excuse the staff. In any case it worth’s visiting! Moreover, go to the museum of music (ask for the headphones) and to Botzow restaurant (Linien str 113), only 5’ walking from the Circus.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: naomiam
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked us into this place after reading the reviews on here and we weren't disappointed.
