Everything about this place is brilliant - from the quality of the rooms to the location - but what really makes it special is the staff. Genuinely the most helpful and friendly people we've ever encountered on our travels. They just can't do enough for you - whether it's lend you a digital camera or a laptop, or burn your pictures onto a CD so you can take them home. They also have a car you can borrow if you want and even a Segway! They're also very knowledgable and know all the best places to eat, drink and party. It really does deserve its number one status on here, and we will defintely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Happy to recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: DeanFleming
Reviews.Content: Hotel is super clean, staff is enthusiastic, knowledgeable and fun. Location is great, a few feet from the subway stop. The bar and restaurant are both good. I love that they are making an effort to be a "green" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: darkwing24
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel. Excellent Breakfast and Staff. Located directly near metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Wow....wow...what an amazing hotel and amazing rates!”
Reviews.Author: Flatlander3
Reviews.Content: I'm actually speechless. I've stayed in MANY hotels in my time for travel but mostly for work and the Circus Hotel blew my mind. First off, the price, 88 Euro a night, is a steal in a city like Berlin. The staff was SO friendly and helpful. The room was exceptional...big, modern, and clean. The rain shower was heavenly. And I love the fact that they are "green" so they only provide new towels if you leave them on floor and you can pick up free shower gel, shampoo/ conditioner at the front desk (to not be wasteful). And the products are all natural. The restaurant in the hotel was lovely. We had one meal there and it was perfect. However the neighborhood, Prenzlauer Berg, has many hidden gems for romantic little restaurants, cafes and shops. Just ask the front desk and they'll point you in the right direction. I hope they don't raise the rates...I'll come back every year to stay here! Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “superb in every way”
Reviews.Author: lilysouthcarolina
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed 3 nites end of October. Very unique hotel in that eco-friendly, fantastic staff providing superb service, ultra clean, great location with subway/tram/buses outside front door, mostly organic buffet breakfast well worth the 8 euros per person, purchase day transportation pass at front desk for only 4 euros, borrow laptops at front desk, restaurant has good food/bar, airport taxi 20 euros. Might suggest standard room if staying for several days due to larger size. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyment is to feel more then welcome...”
Reviews.Author: Domino2009
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our holiday in Berlin the 9th of November. During our stay we had common problems: laptop not working, need to print something, feeling we wanted to visit all and be everywhere at the same time, we wanted to listen to nice music, to sleep in silence, to feel welcome with our noisy child, to find a baby sitter service, to see the Berlin night life ....to visit galleries and write articles in peace. Everything was possible thanks to the service and the nice people helping us. You think what you need, you just look around without asking, and you feel welcome...all is simply there. If you have a child, you will brake the perfect atmosphere in the Restaurant but for sure he/she will love the two wooden dogs (art work course!) at the entrance....

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Berlin to make friends”
Reviews.Author: Hasselbladskan
Reviews.Content: Everytime I go to Berlin I go back to Circus. It´s a bargain and the location in Berlins most charming and happening quarter Mitte is just perfect. The rooms are basic but functionable and the value is great. The staff are nice, polite and helpful. The breakfast is lovely, don´t miss it. And in the lobby you easily make friends with people on the go.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: tcusatis
Reviews.Content: We had wonderful time at The Circus. Staff is the best. They are more then helpfull, you can feel that they do anything so you can be confortable and happy during your stay. They have city guides, laptops, ioga equipment, bikes, subway tickets, plug adaptors... everything you need for free!! The room is huge and really confortable. The best shower and bed you can dream of after a long day of sightseeing. Loved the circus. They are the best!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel- very friendly atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: TravelSmileEnjoy
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent value hotel. We stayed 4 nights and the staff were fautlessly friendly and helpful. It is an excellent base to explore Berlin. I can't recommend it highly enough. Thank you so much Circus Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: wk747
Reviews.Content: stayed at Circus on September the location is not that nice, not a clean area, and noisy although one step from a train station. the check in/check-out process was pretty fast, and the staff was friendly. the breakfast was terrible, and u have to pay for the croissant and juice. :S the room is nicely decorated

Reviews.Title: “This is a wonderful hotel, with thoughtful ethic”
Reviews.Author: 8travelbug
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights in a double room, and were very impressed with how thoughtfully the Circus is designed and managed. Rooms are quite small, but clean and functional. Same with the bathrooms, very well designed and a really great shower. The hotel is working to emphasize things that really matter: no frills, but clean, comfortable rooms, free wifi, friendly, helpful, knowledgeable staff. Food was terrific. Location great. Note that rooms in the front have lots of traffic noise, although windows can block it effectively.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the BEST hotel in Berlin!!!”
Reviews.Author: Roddick777
Reviews.Content: A chic hotel with an incredibly helpful and friendly staff. The Circus Hotel pampered me so much, I felt as if I were staying at a 5-star hotel! From the moment that we stepped in, the staff at the front desk were enthusiastic and sincere in welcoming us. What we wanted, the staff at Circus Hotel were able to provide, and more! I'm not kidding!! - When we inquired how to get to various places that we had planned to visit, the amazing staff were able to provide the easiest directions and train connections at their fingertips. When we asked to make reservations to restaurants, the staff assisted in doing so enthusiastically. When we asked for recommendation for good German food, we were given door-to-door directions to Sophien Eck. They even knew the exact timing for the next airport express!! Every single staff is so well-trained and they delighted us very much. While we did not get to meet every single staff, those who assisted us - Christian, Kaem, Lars and Katerina (not sure if I spelled it correctly...) - definitely played a big part in making our trip to Berlin so memorable. I believe that the winning formula of the Circus Hotel is how it manages to operate like a 5-star hotel (but so much more affordable!!) while maintaining a friendly, chic, and young hostel feel. It is a unique blend of success, and we are very, very impressed. Most importantly, the staff made all the difference - you guys are incredible! Keep up the good job!! We will recommend this hotel to everyone - young and old - visiting Berlin. It is seriously THAT GOOD!!! =)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: SWFT
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel and I would definitely stay here if I ever return to Berlin. It has a very simple but trendy feel. It wasn't "plush" but was clean and modern and had a bit of an "Ikea" furniture feel about it. Nice change from hotels in other cities that are looking staid and are a little depressing! - Room - I stayed in a single room on the second floor which overlooked the courtyard. The room was a decent size with everything one needed. It was quiet and the curtains made the room sufficiently dark. The bathroom was nice and most importantly the shower had good water pressure and water remained hot. The only complaint would be the lack of curtains/blinds on the bathroom window although the glass was slighly frosted. The bed was very comfortable and the rooms felt new and trendy. - Hotel staff - very friendly and willing to help. They made you feel like you were simply staying at a friend's place. The staff were consistent across the three nights I was there so I felt like they all kind of had a 'stake" in the place and cared about the guests. - Internet - they provide loan laptops which you can either take up to your room or use in the lobby. Great to be able to check your emails in peace :) -Location - literally above a Ubahn station. This was great because as a single female traveller I was able to get around easily and felt very safe. The area is great - very close to the Hakshermkt and Mitte is a cool place to stay. You definitely feel like you are in a cool area staying here- mind you at Circus you are more on the edge of things rather than in the centre but I liked that. -Restaurant - the restaurant/cafe in the lobby was nice. Not the fastest servcie but very friendly. Good coffee. -Check in - I arrived earlier than expected and was able to pretty much check in right away which was great. - Feel - the hotel is trying to be eco-friendly which should appeal to young and eco-conscious travellers. This means that bath products are available only upon request (which is fine as most people never use these anyway) I really loved Berlin and despite speaking no German felt "at home" here. I think staying at the Circus in such a cool area probably helped with this. If you come to Berlin - and you should- Circus is a great option if this is your budget.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: sos100
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend in Berlin (our first time there). It was fantastic! It's in an excellent location (funky neighbourhood), the price is amazing (under 99 euro a night), the hotel is clean, cool, collected and the staff are about the most helpful I've ever come across. I would highly recommend this place for anyone visiting Berlin, whether for business or for pleasure. It's a tribute to the owners and staff that they have made something really excellent here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel situated centrally in former east Berlin”
Reviews.Author: holidayer44
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this trendy little hotel newly constructed in a heritage property in former east Berlin . We had a 2-bedroom suite that was bright ,clean and well-equipped. The staff was more helpful than we have encountered anywhere in our travels.There is no spa and no pool but we don't travel to swim. The breakfast was fine and the location- right on the metro and tram lines and within walking distance of all Berlin's highlites- was perfect. Compared to most of Berlin's hotels it was a bargain too. Would we stay there again- absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “Quintessence of Cool”
Reviews.Author: Ravennarose96
Reviews.Content: Hard to add anything to previous reviews, and somewhat reluctant to do so since it's now #1 on TripAdvisor and has been written up in the NY Times--which means it will be hard to book a room next time we're in Berlin. What makes Berlin special is not the history, culture, attractions and nightlife--although it has more of these than most cities--it's the people, who, invariably in our experience, seem to have enjoyment in what they're doing. No more so than here, where the attentiveness of the bright young people who run this place put even Ritz-Carlton service to shame, No collection of hoteliers anywhere in the world that we've stayed seemed more concerned that we have a stress-free time. Should add that we got under the wire for the included breakfast which was great but has been discontinued as a freebee. Shame, because there's not that many options in the immediate neighborhood. We can't wait to go back to Berlin, and we wouldn't stay anyplace else (if we could help it).

Reviews.Title: “One of the coolest, reasonable and lovely hotels I have ever visited”
Reviews.Author: javapapo
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 days at the Circus Hotel, Berlin. First of all it is situated to one of the coolest and fastest growing areas of Berlin, Mitte. Lots of bars restaurants and site seeing nearby. The Metro stop is just a few meters away from the hotel's entrance. I have no really bad comment about the hotel 1. The prices are more than reasonable for that kind of service 2. I had the chance of booking one of the few apartments (not signle) rooms and they are ideal for couples and friends who wish to share a common place, with 2 bathrooms and a kitchen, 3. The hotel's design can be considered very modern and in general everything looked very new and very clean - quite amazed with that. 4. The hotel is trying to be eco-friendly with various ways and I really admired the fact that they promote such an idea. 5. All the stuff was more than helpful and always smiling ane being polite - you dont get that very often in various hotel (even more luxurious). 6. dining both breakfast and the various drink or food services are very good - really enjoyed the cappuccino service - very decent! 7. Last but not least FREE wifi everywhere! THAT was one my favs points!!! No lame proxies, no bad connections - working like a charm. So, if I am about to visit berlin I will definitely stay @ the Circus Hotel! I wish they keep this attitude towards good value for money, excellent service and being cool!

Reviews.Title: “a very relaxing hotel”
Reviews.Author: sil_99
Reviews.Content: My brother and I had a nice time in this hotel. The rooms are not too large, but they are very bright and calm. Everything is new. The bathroom had a wonderful and huge shower. In the hall you have a nice coffee shop and a restaurant where we relaxed a lot listening to some music. Overall, you get a gem for a very good price Silvia

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel! Want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: manda33
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Circus hotel for 4 nights during the last leg of our trip to Europe. I was extremely satisfied with the Circus in every aspect. The staff was amazingly friendly and helped us out with everything we needed from converter sets to train tickets. They all spoke perfect English and someone was at the desk on staff 24 hrs a day. The room we had faced the street and was a bit small but we were able to make it work. The inside of the rooms were very nice and the bed was very comfortable. With the windows open you could hear some street noise but it never kept us awake or anything. The bathroom was very spacious and modern. The restaurant area was a perfect place to grab a drink before heading out for the night or as a night cap before heading up to bed for the night. Hanging out in the lounge area was extremely comfortable and it was nice to hang out and watch the world go by outside. We did not eat at the restaurant for lunch or dinner but had breakfast there every morning. While we were there it was included in the price and was a nice spread of yogurts, cheeses, breads and meets, all organic. The Circus provides free Wi Fi, Internet access and laptops that you can borrow and either take up to your room or use in the lounge area. This was very convenient and we were always able to borrow a laptop whenever we needed. They also have day passes that you can "rent" out for the day if you want to use the public transportation. I would stay at the Circus in a heart beat if I am lucky enough to go back to Berlin again. Berlin is an amazing city and the Circus is amazing as well!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in great city”
Reviews.Author: valleysboy
Reviews.Content: We just spent four nights at Circus Hotel and it's easy to see why it's number one. Located in a really trendy part of Berlin, with many bars, restaurants etc. nearby although the bar/restaurant at the hotel is a great place to relax. The staff are first class, nothing is too much trouble and the place as the feel of a much more expensive establishment. Berlin has some incredible sights and not to be missed, however we thought the best area was near to the hotel, with some cool bars and restaurants. Good food at the Circus, but the restaurant at Honigmond nearby is outstanding, we ate there twice - outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing...best hotel of entire trip!”
Reviews.Author: amandaj24
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I traveled around Germany for two weeks and stayed at the Circus towards the end of our trip. Not only was it by far THE nicest hotel we stayed at, but also one of the least expensive?! Absolutely everything you could think of is provided at the hotel...if not, I'm sure the great staff would do their best to help. The decor really reminded me of something you would find at a W hotel. Yes, mostly IKEA, but it's very well done and tasteful. The breakfast was absolutely amazing...all "bio" (organic) and so delicious. Apparently the hotel will start charging for it soon, but it is definitely worth paying for. The Rosenthaler area is really the up and coming part of Berlin (formerly East side). There are many bars, great shops, and restaurants all within walking or tram distance. Berlin is such a massively huge city, there really is no reason to stay right in the city center because you will have to utilize public transportation at some point. The hotel staff recommended the Brewer's walking tour and it was great. Picked us up right at the hotel and gave us a great all-day tour of the city. If you are short on time in Berlin, I highly recommend this option to get the most out of your visit. I could see that the hotel would be noisy, as some other reviews have mentioned. It was cool enough during our visit that we could sleep with the windows closed (heavy dual pane) but during summer some ear plugs would be a must! The Circus is awesome. Stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing can beat the Circus hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ace_Coco
Reviews.Content: The Circus hotel is a fantastic hotel! If we could stay in the Circus Hotel in every city I visit, I'd be so thrilled. This is the epitome of hip & comfortable, which are not always found in the same venue. With a wifi (that is actually fast) available in all rooms, a buffet breakfast from 7-1pm, fantastically helpful staff, and yoga classes from Spirit Berlin (great classes - the english class is in the late afternoon - ask the front desk for the schedule), and a super comfortable room - it was great. The location, right about the U-Bahn and across from the S-Bahn make it an extremely convenient hotel for your sightseeing needs (though you may not never want to leave the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for travellers of all ages”
Reviews.Author: PHM12
Reviews.Content: The Circus Hotel was the perfect hotel for a 4 day visit to Berlin.The rooms , food and service could not be faulted The added bonus was the staff. They are young,charming, friendly and have a mine of information.They could do no more to enable the guests to have a good trip. They arranged everything we asked with the minimum of fuss. All guests are given the opportunity to buy Travel Passes for all the public transport--which incidently is first class--the trains run on time!---at a lower cost than in the ticket offices. Thanks to the Circus for a great stay

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a fabulous value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Linda072
Reviews.Content: The Circus Hotel is convenient to bus, tram, and underground. There are plenty of shops and restaurants nearby. Chinese take-out around the corner very decent(teenagers...) There is also a small deli-type store nearby. The Hackesche Hofe is not far from the hotel on the tram and worth a look around. Its a series of connected court-yards filled with shops and restaaurants. Also the Haskesche Markt has open-air restaurants and and on Thursdays, a market selling assorted fruits, veggies, hand-made chocolates and other odds and ends. Stroll down Auguststrasse near the hotel. Its very unusual , with out-door art exhibits and interesting restaurants. Only down-side to the hotelwas NO air-conditioning and it was very hot the week we visited.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in months”
Reviews.Author: Sarah W
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Circus hotel earlier this month and I have to say what a refreshing experience. The amazing service started with the website with the ipod download showing how to get to the hotel from the airport using public transport. I arrived at about 11.30am a bit early for checking in so I expected to just leave my luggage and go out, reception however, sent someone upstairs to check availability and have housekeeping work on the room immediately. I had to wait just 20 minutes for the room and was given a free coffee for the inconvenience. The single room I stayed in faced the interior courtyard and yes there was some noise in the evenings - people generally enjoying themselves nothing bad - although it wasn't that noisy and I have learnt after many years that rather than get annoyed and have a bad night's sleep; just use ear plugs (I am a very, very light sleeper). The bathroom was clean and generously sized for one person. The shower (there was no bath) was fabulous with a rain shower head. I found the lighting was fine for applying make-up etc. so no problems there and it included a decent hairdryer - not one of those awful vacuum hose ones. The bed was large and very comfortable and included a safe big enough to hold your netbook and potentially large enough for an average sized laptop. The hotel also has free wi-fi throughout, which is a service UK hotels could make note of. If you don't have a laptop, reception can lend you one. Breakfast is served between the very reasonable hours of 7am-1pm and consists of tea, coffee, orange/apple juice, fruits, fresh breads, yoghurt, cheeses, hams etc. You can also purchase eggs (scrambled/boiled), although I found that there was more than enough without them. Reception is really helpful and speak perfect English, they have a number of free services such as directions, recommendations, laptops, mobile phones, babysitting services - the list goes on and are executed with minimal fuss. they also have agreements with the local yoga and fitness centres. The hotel has a cafe/bistro - I cannot comment on the food as I only ate breakfast, but they also provide the same menu as room service for no extra cost. The hotel is next to the U-bahn station and is in a fairly decent area. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: CatandDen
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay although we arrived early and were told to wait until the room was ready. Eventually, 45 minutes after the 2pm check-in time, no one had still told us it was ready so we had to ask again. We were told that they had some late check-outs which was why the room was late! Not the best start! Also, our room faced the square and it was VERY noisy, We had to close the windows and spent a very disturbed night because of the heat in the room. There is no air conditioning so you need to ask for a fan from reception. Otherwise, the hotel and staff are very nice and the hotel has a great location. We would certainly go back but only to an interior facing room or in the cooler months.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Wow! Wow! The Oscar goes to Circus!”
Reviews.Author: lynnsf123
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a number of hotels in Berlin paying way more than here. The Circus Hotel is not only kind to your pocketbook, but every person working there has a heart of gold. Germany, take a lesson from the folks working here: Customer Service is here to stay. They do it right. The beds are comfortable, everywhere is clean, did I mention the great service? Free Internet with a simple password and free laptop loans. The New York Times online is how I found this place. I can only underscore their review. Enjoy your next stay in Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels in Germany”
Reviews.Author: amannnnda
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Circus hotel and my friends who had an infant stayed at the Circus Hostel. I really enjoyed the Circus hotel. My only complaint would be something that someone has mentioned. It does get really hot and in order to get air into the room you have to open the windows but the hotel is on a very busy street so you can't sleep unless you have earplugs. The front desk does offer fans but I'm sure that they are very limited. If you have friends that want to stay at the hostel for a cheaper rate, I recommend it. My friends and I were within walking distance of each other and we could also see each other from the windows of the hotel. The only thing is that you can't call each other because the hostel doesn't have phones but you can walk down to the front desk and have them call for free. The Circus hotel helped us with all of plans and answered every question we had. They also tried to get a stroller for the child. Although they couldn't find it they did try. They were very accommodating which made us feel at home. They have so many things available for guests, it is really like you never left home. They have chargers, laptops, cell phones for rent. Anything you could possibly think of. The only thing I rented was the day travel pass for 4 euros (they take 20 euros for collateral). Unlimited travel in 2 zones of Berlin. It was very helpful. The hotel is not exactly walking distance to the main city center but it is only three stops on the underground. Overall, I had a great time in Berlin partially because of the hotel. If I could I would definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay nowhere else”
Reviews.Author: EyresLondon
Reviews.Content: Have been travelling a bit and love finding a hotel that just hits the spot... The Circus does this. Young, fresh, relaxed, helpful, great location, staff who smile all the time and will do what they can to help you. Stayed in a 2 room apartment, which was perfect, everthing you needed! We even followed the Circus jogging route for a 7km jog around the river! Berlin is a cool city and the Circus is a perfect match!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but make smart requests!”
Reviews.Author: Eur0Canadian
Reviews.Content: Circus is a nice modern hotel located near-ish to Alexander Platz. It was clean and had the basics required for a decent price. However, it was summer and rather warm so the rooms were very stuffy. We needed to keep the window open and this was fine as we faced the courtyard. The outside of the hotel faces a very busy street. Staff were mostly helpful but everything seems to be done by the reception so there can be some congestion and wait particularly since the reception seems to manage the other members of staff like the cleaning staff and occasionally tended to serve fellow employees rather than clients. They don't take AMEX so plan for that. The food in the restaurant and breakfast is good although sometimes staff in in the restaurant are difficult to find.

Reviews.Title: “surely the best in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: yonatanz
Reviews.Content: the circus hotel is a wonderful hotel. With lovely modern rooms, ecxellent service and the most friendly and helpful staff around, we had a superb stay. It is perfectly located, has an underground station outside the door, a nice little bar and restaurant. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Best customer service ever”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkTamar
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed a week at the Circus hotel. We have never received such great customer service anywhere! Really, they staff are amazing and go out of there way for you. Wen asking for directions they usually get up and step outside to point you in the right direction rather than just handing you a map. They made reservations for us and really seem to aim to please. We stayed in a budget double room which was small...but very clean and modern and totally fine because you don't go to Berlin to hang out in your room. We wish they has Circus hotel's in other cities too!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel run with the mindset of a friendly youth hostel”
Reviews.Author: jophan
Reviews.Content: These people also run a youth hostel, and they have brought the charm, the enthusiasm and mindset with them. Outgoing, engaging, young people who seem to think it's a hoot running a hotel. Always friendly, always asking if there's anything else they can help with. Physically the hotel is a bit spartan, but wonderfully fresh and crisp, being newly built/refurbished. They do lovely stuff like renting out bikes, Segways and even cars and laptops - and things like charging your mobile or your ipod while you pop across the street for a kebab. A huge plus (in my book at least) for being very environmentally aware and serving organic/fair trade food as much as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, funky, relaxed and spotless”
Reviews.Author: TDBDS
Reviews.Content: The hotel website gives great directions for every mode of transport. All the staff were friendly, spoke good English and gave lots of advice. Hotel provides travel passes for excellent public transport at a reduced cost ( subway 5 meters from front door). There is a good atmosphere in the bar/restaurant and a lovely centre courtyard. Try to get a room overlooking the courtyard in summer as it is hot without air conditioning, as mentioned by other reviewers they have eco. policy but will provide a fan for your room. The same eco. policy means no mini bar or tea/coffee facilities in the room, however prices in Berlin are very reasonable and hotel has no surcharge on any room service orders. We stayed in a junior suite and it was great but its really just a bigger room and as you'll probably be enjoying a drink in courtyard or the thousands of great bars in Berlin I would just take a standard room. We looked in these rooms and they are small but perfectly formed. You can borrow laptop, guidebooks umbrellas etc and have a massage! The hotel is affiliated with nearby leisure facilities. The surrounding area is busy and cosmopolitan close to unusual wee shops , theatre district, Berlin wall info. centre, modern art museum , Alexandr Platz and much much more. If you can't enjoy yourself in Berlin and this Hotel maybe you should save money and stay home!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, great location, lovely staff, delicious breaky, new hotel”
Reviews.Author: deejth
Reviews.Content: Loved it. They have lots staff on reception, all of whom speak English, they were very helpful, they charged my i-pod, gave me tram tickets, advice on tours and where to go. It has WiFi and an environmental policy. The breaky was delicious with fresh/organic food. Double room was all brand new, very quiet hotel. No air-con but if you have room that opens onto the courtyard you can sleep with you windows open. Tram and train outside the front door with plenty of places to eat and drink.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with exceptional customer service”
Reviews.Author: BrightonBernie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Circus for four nights in July and had a really good time. It's the hotel's first year of operation and, as you would expect, is spotlessly clean as a result. But what really stands out is the level of customer service. As we waited to check out, we witnessed one member of staff patiently explaining everything to the couple in front of us from where to eat to where you can buy cheap shoes. The location, as other reviews have said, is nice and central - it's an easy walk to lots of the main sights, and you are right opposite the underground station. Because it's so new it can, at times, feel like the Circus is still finding its way a bit - for example, they have recently decided to stop providing shower gel and shampoo in the rooms as they found they were throwing so much away. Whether this was done for financial or green reasons is unclear, but it was no hassle to help yourself to bottles from a shelf by reception when you need them. The breakfast buffet is small but fresh and more than adequate. The only minor criticism I can make is that the night-time facilities are not quite as relaxing as they could be, despite the excellent cocktails on offer. It's a combined restaurant and bar, which can make for a slightly formal feel and would probably benefit from being split into two. We found we preferred the more relaxed vibe at the Circus hostel over the road from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: ey319
Reviews.Content: I accompanied my husband to Berlin for a business trip, and we had a wonderful stay here! The hotel was conveniently located with a subway stop right outside, but we actually walked everywhere because it was so close to everything. The hotel had good internet access so my husband could work efficiently, but also had great amenities for travelers on holiday. The included breakfast was the perfect way to start our days, and we really appreciated the little extras that were added, including ipods on loan with music from local artists, a good jogging map of the area, and great restaurant suggestions by the helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Funky Hotel in a Cool City”
Reviews.Author: BlackDouglas
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 nights in the Circus Hotel. Location is great, just outside Hackescher Markt in the old East Berlin. Close enough to loads of nightlife areas but quiet enough to retreat to after a long day in the city. Yards from Rosenthaler U-Bahn and the M1 Tram passes the door on its way into Friedrichstraase or up to Prenzlauer Berg. Hotel staff are incredibly friendly, efficient and helpful. Hotel is clean, modern, brightly decorated and serves a nice selection of continental breakfast. Rooms (ours was a Junior suite decorated in pink and silver) are very nice with modern bathroom facilites and huge rain head shower. Only slight niggle was not having our beds made/ freshened up during our stay. Loved everything about Berlin and would highly recommend the Circus Hotel Iain

Reviews.Title: “You'll have a great stay - guaranteed!”
Reviews.Author: mhottinga
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed in this hotel 6 days and had a really wonderful time here! The staf are really helpfull and friendly! They just offer really good service, something which unfortunately is not that common anymore in a lot of hotels. If you need a laptop, you can borrow one, if you forgot to bring a Lonely Planet or something, you can borrow one, at their hostel (which is located across the street) you can rent bycicles, you can also get cheaper public transportation tickets and a REALLY BIG PLUS is that you can lend a zone-parking ticket if you go by car, so that means parking is free, and so on. The location is really great as well. You can find a lot of restaurants, bars and shops in walking distance from the hotel. If you like to go to other areas, in front of the hotel is the subway and also a tramstop, so it's easy getting around. The hotel itself is not that big, but spacious enough. They have a restaurant, but I only ate breakfast there, so I can't comment on their food. Breakfast though wasn't that great. You can choose one of three types of breakfast. The breakfast in itself is enough, but sometimes you just want to have AND fruit AND bread AND an egg. The "problem" is that these three are not in the same type of breakfast, so it's either one or the other. Also, the fruit I got 4 days in a row wasn't of a good quality. The hotel has a really nice little garden, where you can eat your breakfast or have a drink. We had a double room which I found a little bit small, but ok. The only thing really missing in the room (for us) was that it didn't have a bath, but we're guessing that's because the hotel is a green hotel. Overall, I would really recommend this hotel to travellers due to it's excellent service, location and price!

Reviews.Title: “My 5th stay with the Circus, though my 1st at this location”
Reviews.Author: stephentodd
Reviews.Content: The Circus started out as a Youth Hostel. I first stayed there in 1995. They've been through two follow-on locations, the last still operates as a hostel. Nearby they've built a lovely hotel which is both modern and exceptionally comfortable. Prices are very reasonable and the staff seem to have a genuine interest in making guests happy. The hotel is centrally located and guided tours can easily be organised from the reception. Also, discounts are available for public transport. You won't be disappointed with this gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, tastefully appointed rooms and friendly, attentive staff. Circus have nailed it once again.”
Reviews.Author: missvantam
Reviews.Content: Chose the Circus Hotel after having enjoyed a stay at the Circus Hostel the previous year. Found the same, stylish attention to detail in the layout and furnishing of the room and of the hotel as a whole, with helpful, well informed and attentive staff on hand. We stayed in a junior suite for just over a week during the Berlinale and found it to be a very welcoming, comfortable base for both relaxing and working, thanks to free wifi in all the rooms. The bathroom was huge, with a great shower - and complimentary Weleda toiletries were a nice additional touch.. The only, minor downside was the breakfast (which is included): it offered hardly any vegetarian options and seemed of lesser quality compared to the buffet breakfast available at the Circus Hostel (for a fee). Hopefully this has already been improved. The Circus Hostel and Hotel provide quality accommodation and incredible value for money. They're located in one of the hottest parts of Berlin for clubs, cafés, boutiques, music and art venues. I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Great plece to stay at Berlin”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelers_9
Reviews.Content: We read the previous recommendations on this great hotel and they were all totally right. Great location near the city center, a lot of small restaurants and coffee places, and amazing stuff that is just willing to answer any question you ask or any assistance. The rooms are cozy and well decorated. Next time in Berlin we will definitely stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it”
Reviews.Author: Josacasa
Reviews.Content: The theory behind this place is sound - making people feel at home, providing extra services and being eco conscious. In practice they do a fairly good job of delivering....the staff are very helpful, planning events for us and happy to advice on anything. The restaurant, where breakfast is included, is tranquil and high quality ambiance - a little courtyard outside for evening drinks or a sunny breakfast too. The room was nice, but there were little touches we woud like to see improved - perhaps better lighting to read by and more drawers for clothes etc. However, small complaints really!! Entertainment by way of DVD's for your room is limited to 'cultural' films such as Das Boot and Run Lola Run. Location was fantastic - 15 minute walk from the centre, with loads of lovely restaurants nearby which seem to cater more for the locals than for tourists and were nicer for it. Easy to find by their directions coming from the airport too. Would definately recommend, and prices were reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: jeffercub
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotel I stayed in Europe. Stylish, Clean, Nice Staff & Comfortable! Highly recommended! I would definitely stay again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Majorwoof
Reviews.Content: While the Circus Hotel was spotlessly clean, in a great location, and with comfortable rooms, what really blew us away was the incredible staff. The high end 5 star hotels around the world could learn lots from the team at the Circus. They were young and enthusiastic and incredibly proactive at anticipating our every need. It's as if you were guests in their home! Would recommend the Circus to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “"Rosenthaler Platz is talking" so listen carefully!”
Reviews.Author: Steedappeal
Reviews.Content: Having previously stayed in the Central and Western Ku'Dam area I decided on my 3rd visit to stay in the city's eclectic Mitte neighborhood in the former East. After much internet searching I happenened upon The Circus Hotel Mitte and could not have been happier. Although only open since Fall 2008 this is a hotel fully operational and NOT trying to find "itself. Spendidly, its services and amenities run super-smoothly and exist to make the traveller feel well served and accomodated. (They also run a well-regarded Hostel a block away for those in search of more basic offerings). Unique Qualities: The rooms are cheerful and immaculate: I booked the larger of the Apartments (#4) which has two separate bedrooms and a generously appointed kitchen with living/dining room area; it also had one full toilet with shower and a half bath with toilet only. At 160 Euros it is as expensive as the hotel offers but most other, non-suited rooms are far less in price. The Front Desk is well-versed in answering most tourist requests and offers an exceptionally large reference Library of Berlin-related books as well as Berlin-centric dvds. If only I had the patience to watch the entire 'Berlin Alexanderplatz' 15 1/2 hour saga which featured this neighborhood so indelibly! The hotel's personalized hotel/neighborhood info pamphlet (from which I reference the Doblin quote that introduces my review here) is especially informative. For those staying for several days make sure to rent the 4 euro per person/per day monthly transit passes. Wireless is free and short-term, complimentary rentals of notebooks is available. This is a "green" hotel so the FD is happy to give you shower supplies and the like but only as you request. Leave your towels on the bathroom floor if you need replenishment. The complimentary breakfast is blessedly served late (until 1 pm) and there is an option to upgrade to a full 'English' breakfast for a small fee. The restaurant "Fabisch" is very consistent and really good- so good that I even went back a week after I had checked out. The bar offerings are very extensive, too. Jared, the Head Mixiologist, is well-versed in the art of artisanal cocktails and very hospitable (he's an American in Berlin). Happily, room service at off-hours is available. On your way to the downstairs restrooms make sure to spend time visiting the micro-exhibit which details the fascinating history of the 'Circus' building and the Fabisch family. It was once a grand department store that anchored the Rosenthaler Platz neighborhood for generations until its ownership met a terrible fate during the Nazi era. Negatives: virtually none. There were no seperate phone extentions in my suite's 2 bedrooms which made wake-up calls a mad dash into the living room. A request to make my safe work went unheeded. At breakfast, they should serve a full coffee or tea cannister rather than relying on the staff to replenish cups (especially if you eat late and the staff is occupied preparing or the lunch service). NONE of these micro issues would prevent me from staying here in the future. A reminder that this hotel is on the U8 U-Bahn line which requires a connection usually at Alexanderplatz if you need to go East-West or West-East. I will always remember my front row "seat" to Rosenthaler Platz courtesy of this brillant hotel- sipping my wine, watching the trams languidly roll by as the rain misted over the denizens of Mitte dashing to-and-fro.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return to the Circus!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hairgood
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? Oh yes, first and foremost the staff is AWESOME! We arrived a bit early and they switched our rooms to accomodate our early arrival...... Talk about awesome! We had bags delivered from the airport and instead of interrupting our sleep, they placed the bags in lockers for us. We practically bugged them everyday for directions to restaurants and clubbing.... they never showed us they were tired of us and the questions! We had a very nice room and it was spotless. We were greeted everytime we passed the desk and the staff was well diversified. We also used the car service that the hotel reserved for us, the driver was professional and very nice (25 Euros from Tegel airport) On another note, I recommend B-Flat (jazz club) also if you like Falafel (DaDa's) was great.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant choice - you get so much more than you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Ms_Minka
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Junior Suite and were delighted to find we had a HUGE room and bathroom. Very stylish and well maintained for a seriously cheap price! Breakfast is served till 1pm which is much more suitable for those trying to have a relaxing holiday. Staff were super friendly and very helpful with tips, directions etc. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: virginieHeidelberg
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms, nice location, very nice staffs. We would go back without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “At the best location excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarinaPl
Reviews.Content: We went for 4 days and we didin't want to leave!! the hotel is situated in excellent location, in east side and outside its central door there is a metro station, but it has easy access in majure monuments even also on foot! Very very clean and cosy rooms each one with its style! The staff also was very friendly ! We are planning to go again in Berlin and definatelly we are going to stay at Circus Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel in the Best Part of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: leadmy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Circus Hotel in Feb 2009 for three nights - and we didn't want to leave! The hotel is funky, minimalist-cool, and extremely friendly - just our style. Absolutely loved all the staff, so helpful, really went out of their way to show us the best of Berlin. Great location in the heart of East Berlin, just up the street there are dozens of cool bars, cafes, boutiques, etc. The free breakfast served in the restaurant was also great, just another of the many perks at the Circus. They even have free laptops to borrow if you didn't bring your own, and rent out daily transit passes for 4 euros. Fantastic hotel, highly recommended - one of my favorite hotels I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: CiaraMuzz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a double deluxe room at the circus hotel for three nights in Feb 09 and would recommend it to anyone staying in Mitte. The room was a good size, spotlessly clean and comfortable, with little quirky touches. The room cost 85 euro including a very tasty breakfast. The restaurant also had nice food, we had dinner there on our first night. It has german traditional food with a twist. Nice, but a bit more expensive than many other restaurants in Berlin, and the portions were quite small. I would recommend the hot chocolate with rum or amaretto though, very nice! We rented segways too, which are brillant fun and good value at 11 euro an hour. The staff are friendly. Lars in particular was very helpful and recommended an excellent pizza restaurant called Il Duo Forni, which was certainly worth the short walk! The hotel location is excellent, right next to the U BAHN station Rosanthaler Strass, two stops from Alexanderplatz (where the airport express from Schonefeld arrives). We would stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: The Circus Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Rosenthaler Strasse 1, 10119 Berlin, Germany
